description: The Wondery mission is to be a sustainable outdoor lifestyle brand dedicated to liberating women in the outdoors through awareness, resources, and the creation of a women’s outdoor community. Wondery harmonizes fashion with utility to create practical apparel for women.  Wondery is seeking a marketing intern to begin ASAP for the Fall semester.  Responsibilities include (but are not limited to): Assist with all social media marketing (Facebook, Instagram, Tik Tok, LinkedIn and more) Assist with the physical and digital marketing of our subscription box, Wonder Goods Assisting in the marketing tactics and sales for B2B Creating and managing partnerships with influencers and other complementary brands Analyzing data from marketing campaigns Directing and communicating inquiries between influencers and the Wondery team Scheduling and creating marketing content when necessary Engaging with the marketing and PR team on a regular basis to brainstorm ideas for new and innovative marketing and social media campaigns Assisting with gathering data for marketing reports and supporting a variety of marketing and advertising programs Creating campaigns to support the efforts of Wondery Researching industry specific sites (blogs, forums, etc.) for product reviews, customer comments, and other relevant marketing information  Qualifications: - Working towards a BA in marketing, public relations, or equivalent - Detail oriented - Must be a people-person - Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills - Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel), Google Docs - Proficiency in Photoshop and/or Illustrator - Undergraduate GPA of 3.0 and above - Self-starter with good time management skills - Ability to work independently and with others - Ability to maintain strong and consistent communication through email and phone  Must be able to travel and work at our office location in Chatsworth, CA once COVID restrictions have ceased. We unfortunately will not be making any exceptions.

jobTitle: Disney Gift Card Services, Program Development Intern - Spring 2022
description: Job Summary:  Be a part of an innovative team and culture…  Disney Gift Card Services, Inc. is an enterprise entity responsible for creating, launching and maintaining Gift Card and Stored Value Products sold and distributed globally through a variety of channels, including online, corporate sales, retail stores and other partnerships. The team consists of Program Development, Business Development, Brand Management/Marketing, Operations, Finance and Guest Service groups dedicated to enhancing the Guest experience, reducing payment friction and supporting Walt Disney Company business initiatives.  Responsibilities:  A Day in the Life…  This role will play an integral part in various project activities assisting and supporting the Disney Gift Card Services Program Development team. This individual will be responsible for, but not limited to, communicating project deliverables to stakeholders, business acceptance testing, documentation and training efforts, managing system access and other sustainment activities. In this role, the individual will develop project management skills by partnering with technical, financial, creative and operational teams at various levels to gather and provide requirements for projects and process improvements. This position may require flexible hours to support weekend & after-hours initiatives.  Basic Qualifications:  What we are looking for…  Demonstrated strong organizational and time management skills to prioritize multiple competing priorities with attention to detail Quickly adapt to evolving and growing business needs Proven critical thinking, creative solutioning and decision-making skills Demonstrated ability to influence and build relationships with internal and external partners at various levels Ability to work both independently and within a collaborative team environment Ability to adapt communication styles for technical and non-technical partners Demonstrated ability to handle confidential information Desire to take creative, thoughtful risks in line with business needs Familiar and engaged with emerging technologies Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and presentation software Ability to analyze metrics to create stories depicting product performances and user experiences to assist in making strategic decisions  Preferred Qualifications:  Experience with project management processes and software, agile methodologies and working with external vendors/partners Basic understanding of technical topics (e.g. database, API, JSON messaging) Awareness of user interface/experience design trends and strategies Engagement and familiarity with payment and digital consumer experiences Knowledge of creating process flows and diagrams  Required Education  Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university and taking at least one class, or be a recent graduate of an accredited college or university within the last six (6) months at time of application, or be currently participating in the Disney College Program, Disney Culinary Program or Disney Professional Internship Program Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or Post Graduate degree in Business, Project Management or Information Technology  Additional Information:  The approximate dates of this internship are January 2022 through June 2022. Candidate must be available to work full time hours (approximately 40 hours per week) for the duration of the internship. You will work remotely until in-person work resumes. The location for this work will be Orlando, Florida. Please note, candidates must be receptive to working Eastern Standard Time for the duration of the program (approximately 8:30am-5:30pm ET).  865279BR

description: A growing global company. Endless career and development opportunities.  When you join Ritchie Bros., you’ll be part of a diverse, global team that’s focused on delivering great customer experiences. Our culture is centered around people and guided by our core values of Integrity, Unity and Vision. Learn more about our culture and commitment to diversity and inclusion at Candidate Portal.  If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are passionate about making a difference, we invite you to join our growing team. Whether you’re out in the field or back at your office, you’ll be helping us achieve our vision of becoming the trusted global marketplace for insights, services and transaction solutions for commercial assets.  We’re looking for a Business Development Manager who will be covering the Dallas Fort Worth metroplex.   The Opportunity:  The Business Development Manager (BDM) is an outside sales role specifically focused on developing new business within assigned geography. The BDM is primarily responsible for identifying new prospects, soliciting and selling the full RBA solution offering; matching prospect needs to solutions, and transitioning signed business over to Account Managers. The ideal candidate is extremely goal-oriented and adept at identifying and generating a comprehensive and fluid sales pipeline, developing new opportunities across all channels and platforms and adding new customers to the portfolio. BDM’s engage in sales activities primarily outside the office via face to face meetings focused on engendering trust and establishing relationships with key decision-makers and influencers. They ensure adequate time is spent on prospecting outreach through phone, email and cold calling to create the necessary opportunities resulting in sales.  In this role you’ll:  Target net NEW business that would be transitioned over to Account Manager, prioritized by opportunity size Ability to identify and research target companies, customers, or clients to investigate the potential of a partnership with RBA.   Able to quickly and efficiently qualify potential opportunities with a prospect. Develop customer relationships regardless of the prospect’s contractual status with competitors and proactively create awareness of RBA’s solutions offering. Skilled in cold calling, setting up in-person or video meetings to understand the prospects' needs and motivations to enable a partnership with Ritchie Bros Work with internal departments such as the Marketing team to be aligned on growth initiatives, finding ways to promote the brand and generate awareness and leverage Business Intelligence-gaining insights and deep understanding of the market and competition. Effectively engage and utilize internal support functions for the contracting process and problem resolution. Enter and maintain customer information, notes, and activities in the CRM tool throughout the sales cycle.   Identifies, leverages, and engages regularly with industry associations and their members to identify potential prospects while establishing themselves among the industry’s community and customers. Qualify and secure contracts; ensure successful interactions and results Actively support the RB Unreserved Commitment to Safety: to send everyone home, every day, the way they came to work, by taking personal responsibility for your safety and the safety of your team, co-workers and customers.  Here’s what you bring:  Bachelor’s Degree Innovative and creative Enjoys selling and is opportunistic Excellent communication and presentation skills Highly goal and results-oriented Operates with a “sense of urgency” Self-Motivated and resilient Decisive Excellent time management 5+ years’ experience and demonstrated success in quota-driven sales (Industry experience/knowledge preferred) Knowledge and experience with CRM utilization (preferably Salesforce) Excellent communication and presentation skills Highly Self-Motivated & Action-oriented Experience in prospecting for new business Desire to win, bring a sense of urgency for generating favorable results, and resilience to bounce back from setbacks or rejection  What We Offer:  Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how:  Base salary + commission Comprehensive medical and dental benefits. 401(K) and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match. Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.   Ritchie Bros. has grown from a small-town auctioneer to a global asset management and disposition company. Through our family of companies, we help our customers buy and sell a wide range of used and unused equipment for construction, mining, transportation, agriculture, oil & gas, lifting & material handling, forestry & other industries.  Ritchie Bros. is an equal opportunity employer and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with all applicable laws. This position is open to all qualified applicants who are legally entitled to work in the country in which this job is located. Candidate selection is made by Talent Acquisition. Only electronic applications can be accepted. No agency calls, please.  If you required any accommodations, please send an email to: careers@rbauction.com.

description: Positions only open at the following schools: North Carolina State University North Carolina Central University Duke University Wake Tech Community College **All applicants MUST apply directly through our website** NC State - https://jobs.redbull.com/us-en/raleigh-student-marketeer-north-carolina-state-university-138345-055771 NCCU - https://jobs.redbull.com/us-en/durham-student-marketeer-north-carolina-central-university-135987-053798 Duke - https://jobs.redbull.com/us-en/raleigh-student-marketeer-duke-university-138616-055968 Wake Tech - https://jobs.redbull.com/us-en/raleigh-student-marketeer-wake-tech-community-college-135994-053801  Red Bull Student Marketeers are part of the most dynamic and empowered brand ambassador program in the world. They understand Red Bull's target group and will promote the brand image and product understanding on their campus and in their region. The goal of the Student Marketeer program is to reach new consumers, excite university students, increase sales, and manage the Red Bull brand on a student level. This includes direct contact with consumers on campus, inviting product trial, in addition to working at Red Bull events to provide an unforgettable brand experience for consumers.

Did you know 40% of Fortune 100 CEO's started in sales career?  Did you know that due to the rapid adoption of technology, a new modern sales professional called the Sales Development Trainee (or Representative) (SDR) has been one of the fastest-growing jobs in the last 5 years in a row?  Are you ready to be surrounded by incredibly smart and driven people that push you to be better?  If the answer to these questions is yes, then we need to talk.  LaunchSource is changing the way a new generation of talent break into some of the fastest-growing tech companies across the United States. Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) and Business Development Representatives (BDRs) are the first point of contact for a new customer of a customer and the engine of growth not only for sales but serve as the bench for an entire organization. Our partners are vetted and provide rapid room for career advancement (average promotion is 14 - 18 months) and are critical to a company's new business. If you're looking to learn more about LaunchSource check us out on Glassdoor.com or visit our website at launchsource.com (oh yeah and there's no cost to you ever).  In this role, you will Create new revenue opportunities by educating customers Conduct strategic calling and emailing to identify new business opportunities Will work closely with account executives (your sales colleagues) and marketing to implement strategy and process Become an industry specialist and develop product mastery Consistently achieve (and exceed!) monthly quotas and goals Receive continuous weekly training to further develop sales skillset You are A self-starter Entrepreneurial Intellectually curious Passionate about learning Adaptable Salary: Base Salary + On-Target Earnings (OTE): $50,000-$80,000  Here at LaunchSource, we don't just accept our differences — we celebrate them, we support them and we thrive on them for the benefit of our candidates, clients, and our community. LaunchSource and its clients are proud equal opportunity employers.  LaunchSource provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. jobTitle: Rookie 2022 Summer League Internship - Sales & Operations
description: Under Armour has one mission: to make you better. We have a commitment to innovation that lies at the heart of everything we do, not just for our athletes but also for our teammates. As a global organization, our teams around the world push boundaries and think beyond what is expected. Together our teammates are unified by our values and are grounded in our vision to inspire you with performance solutions you never knew you needed but can’t imagine living without.  Position Summary  As an Under Armour Rookie you’ll be given a hands-on, self-driven project that makes a real business impact. Throughout the 12 weeks you’ll work one-on-one with a mentor and have access to learning experiences, such as interactive Q&A sessions with our executives and professional development opportunities with our talent advisors. With our focus on cross-functional collaboration and global mindset, as a Rookie, you get to see how your work goes way beyond yourself.  Potential Placement Areas  Sales  Sales Rookies support our teams in driving our business and the UA brand within our strategic accounts (retail partners). They may assist with selling strategies working with internal cross-functional partners from Product, Merchandising, Marketing, Finance and Planning – to help ensure products are powerfully positioned to drive revenue within these wholesale channels. This opportunity might appeal to students with majors such as: Business Operations, Business Administration/Management, Retail Studies, Communications, or Psychology  Store Operations  Store Operations Rookies support our teams with the creation and implementation of store operations standards across the globe. This opportunity might appeal to students with majors such as: Logistics, Industrial Engineering, Business Operations, Business Administration/Management, Supply Chain, Information Systems, Economics, or Retail Studies.  Eligibility  To be eligible for our Rookie program, you must be expecting to graduate between December of 2022 and June 2023.  Hiring Process  Our resume review process will start immediately upon applying for this role. If our teams are interested in your experience, you will be invited to interview virtually with members of your potential team. You may have the ability to interview for multiple roles if the opportunity arises. Once virtual interviews are completed our recruiting team will extend offers or follow up with you directly on your status.  APPLICATION DEADLINE: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 12, 2021 at 11:59 PM EASTERN TIME  At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

description: Our company Kellify is the science-centric scale-up that comprehends the world through images. We globally scale high potential businesses crafted with AI, Computer Vision and Neuroscience. The boundaries of our science stretch from singling out catchy images at the right time and place in the martech industry, to predicting property and fine art prices. Some of our fast-growing apps have become stand-alone brands: Gradient unveils visual D&I and tells brands how to make it inclusive. Naiada is the first AI uncovering charming masterpieces that will make your wallet smile.  Founded in 2018 by a team of scientists and entrepreneurs from Columbia, Sophia Antipolis, and NASA, Kellify raised $9.0m+ in funding. True to our need for scaling, we blossomed into a team of 45+ people from more than 10 countries, and we are currently live globally with offices in Genoa, Madrid, New York and Seoul.  That’s why we look for smart, dynamic and proactive individuals to join our international-at-heart team of software developers and data scientists, marketing, finance, and product architects: digital enablers that light up instant-workflow realities, either from a scientific or business perspective.   Who you are The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of the US market and will turn insight into action across our globally distributed environment. We expect you to be an intuitive and fast learner, leveraging complex skills rooted in analytics, user feedback, and business goals to support setting clear goals, priorities, and managing stakeholder expectations.  As part of the Growth Team in New York City - which plays a fundamental role in both the day-to-day operations of our development, and business teams, but also influences the future of our growth in the United States - you will support driving awareness and adoption of our products portfolio and the features within it in the US business landscape.  What you will be doing You will work on fueling the business development strategy across the core industries, leveraging key stakeholders in New York City. The role will report to the United States Regional Leader, although you’ll find yourself embedded within the Growth team day-to-day.  In this role you will: Proactively scout and onboard new clients or partners, ensuring long-term success in the US ecosystem Get in the game to influence and manage the key moments of the sales cycle, always focusing on Kellify’s priorities Build brand alliances with a great network effect, with local and global resonance  Conduct research and analyses to support ongoing projects  Help the team identify new potential partners and areas for research  Execute time-sensitive projects in a fast-paced environment   You Should Apply If  You have a genuine interest in business development and sales You are extremely customer-centric  You have great communication skills You are comfortable with metrics and holding backup data to it You enjoy working within a fast-paced environment   Benefits You will get to work in one of the hottest and fastest-growing digital startups right now Competitive salary Professional development Reward Gateway

description: Description  Olive’s AI workforce is built to fix our broken healthcare system by addressing healthcare’s most burdensome issues -- delivering hospitals and health systems increased revenue, reduced costs, and increased capacity. People feel lost in the system today and healthcare employees are essentially working in the dark due to outdated technology that creates a lack of shared knowledge and siloed data. Olive is designed to drive connections, shining a new light on the broken healthcare processes that stand between providers and patient care. She uses AI to reveal life-changing insights that make healthcare more efficient, affordable, and effective. Olive’s vision is to unleash a trillion dollars of hidden potential within healthcare by connecting its disconnected systems. Olive is improving healthcare operations today, so everyone can benefit from a healthier industry tomorrow.  Job Overview  The Sales Associate Internship will focus on fundamental operations of the growing Revenue Organization. The Associate will work closely with both in-field Sales leaders and the executive team to create scalability and consistency in deliverables. This role is key in Olive’s high growth environment, as the Associate works as a coordinator between in-field sales, demand generation, leaders, and other functions to communicate key account learnings & industry analysis, ultimately developing materials to assist the revenue organization’s high growth.  Internship Dates: May 23, 2022 - July 29, 2022  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Prepare decks & in-field sales presentations alongside the SAL & ED, providing scalability in preparation for Solution Overviews & Presentation of Findings Conduct constant market research on specific groupings of accounts, executing a plan built by the Executive Directors Assist the Market President & VPs in data preparation for internal events Live within Salesforce.com for record accuracy and quick resource to any core questions Be able to develop basic level Salesforce reporting & analysis on an ad hoc basis Act as a record keeper in external & internal meetings, to highlight owners & actions of key topics Supplement the larger Sales Enablement effort, which is a coordination of Marketing Documents being operationalized into Sales. This includes pdf preparation, meeting scheduling, & Close Plan aggregation Shadow various areas of the Customer Lifecycle, for professional development & operational learnings. This includes Market Development, Customer facing sales meetings, post-signature Implementations, Assessments, internal Operational Support, and Customer Success The Associate should be capable to assist the Performance Improvement team in running numbers & comparisons of customer ROI in a given assessment Expected to add scalability to the Assessment Solution Architects by helping record workflows, notes, and processes, which is the core stage in the middle of the sales cycle In the case of a special ED or SAL that is traveling to a customer, or on PTO, the Associate will act as a stop-gap coordinator of important information, so customers will not experience any gap Requirements Entry-level experience, 0-2 years expected Background in Healthcare Technologies is preferred Pursuing degree or certification in Business Management, or related field Experience in sales or customer service Ideally combined background of revenue generation, product implementation, and design leadership Awareness of basic Healthcare industry terms Demonstrates desire for continuous learning and improvement Enthusiastic and creative leader with the ability to inspire others Excellent communication and presentation skills At Olive, we're committed to growing and empowering an inclusive community within our company and industry. This is why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives across our organization. Research shows that oftentimes women and other minority groups only apply to open roles if they meet 100% of the listed criteria. Olive encourages everyone — including women, people of color, individuals with disabilities and those in the LGBTQIA+ community — to apply for our available positions, even if they don't necessarily check every box on the job description.  Disclaimer  This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned.  This job description does not constitute a contract of employment and Olive AI, Inc. may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

description: Company Description  Who We Are:  CareBand is an award-winning company that empowers people living with dementia to stay safe and healthy while providing peace of mind to caregivers. The solution includes a wearable device that monitors activity, behavior and location. With the integration of machine learning technology, caregivers can proactively manage common behaviors such as wandering and agitation through non-pharmacological interventions. With CareBand, people living with dementia can stay safe, function at their highest level of independence, and avoid unnecessary hospitalizations while caregivers have peace of mind.  Join the CareBand Team  We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts in hardware engineering, software development, machine learning, design and senior care. We always strive to learn more and dig deeper into our research and analytics, to stay engaged and creative in everything we do. Are you one of us?  Recent News  CareBand has customers in the US, Canada, Slovokia, and the UK. In the past few months, CareBand has: CareBand was award $440k NIH R21 with University of Minnesota: https://med.umn.edu/news-events/memory-keepers-receive-grant-optimize-early-detection-alzheimer%E2%80%99s-disease-and-related-dementias CareBand starts a pilot with Amazon: https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/devices/echo-tile-and-level-devices-join-amazon-sidewalk Our founder's TEDx on Technology and Dementia: How Innovation is Empowering Beyond Diagnosis: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jkvp3FcxzGE Job Description  The Role  With CareBand’s recent momentum comes both opportunity and responsibility. Working closely with the CEO, we are seeking a Business Development Rep who will help guide the company’s development and growth. This role will work with system integrators, value-added resellers, partners, and end customers.  This position requires an ability to succeed in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. We have high standards and are seeking an experienced and dynamic team member who shares our passion and who will roll up their sleeves and get the job done. If you are excited about revolutionizing an industry, have uncompromising integrity, and would like to work for a company that is positioned for success, we’d love to speak with you.  Commitment: Part-Time (~10-15 hours a week)/ Opportunity to go Full-Time  Start Date: ASAP  Responsibilities Be the first person of contact for inbound leads Managing business development activities to evaluate, and develop prospects for business opportunities Synthesize conversations and communicate to Business Development Team Increasing the value of current customers while attracting new ones Finding and developing new markets and improving sales Attending conferences, meetings and industry events Developing quotes and proposals for clients Developing goals for the development team and business growth and ensuring they are met Build and maintain long term relationships with customers and partners Know, understand, and clearly articulate the company’s story, mission, and benefit in a persuasive and informative way Assist in negotiating aspects of the customer and partner relationship (i.e. pricing, payment, contract terms and resources, etc.) Qualifications Strong academic achievement, BS in Business. MBA preferred Entrepreneurial mindset: no task is too large or too small Effective at managing multiple tasks simultaneously and comfortable taking on responsibility High level of attention to detail Problem solver; you don't accept the status quo and are always looking for creative solutions Excellent communicator with clarity of thought to quickly identify what's most important A very good sense of humor and personal balance Demonstrated record of entrepreneurial achievement and/or leadership Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  PLEASE UPLOAD A COVER LETTER ON THE NEXT PAGE TO BE CONSIDERED

description: What You Will Do:  As a Marketing Representative, your primary responsibility is to execute marketing initiatives and provide daily support to the marketing management team. Daily activities include identifying consumer trends and solutions, implementing marketing programs to increase consumer exposure, and keeping detail records of all potential customer leads. The Marketing Representative will also monitor and communicate market / industry trends, consumer feedback, and adjust the campaigns accordingly with the team. Given success in individual projects, this position will also have the opportunity to assist in managing territories, creating training materials and the potential for project management. The goal of the Marketing Representative is to ensure that their client’s brands are recognized as industry leaders through increased revenue, brand awareness and increased market share.  How You Will Do It: Responsible execution of daily tasks surrounding product and service promotions for assigned clientele Collaborate with cross-functional teams to map territory, game plan, and launch marketing plans Provide ongoing market evaluation through direct consumer contact, follow ups, and monitoring of competition and industry trends Interact with consumers daily to asses the current demand of client products and services and adjust campaigns to have a coherent message that resonates with the target market Ensure a seamless sales process through effective marketing and promotional tactics and collateral Maintain a safe and clean work environment. Understand and follow company rules and regulations. Perform all other duties as assigned and required.  What You Will Need: College degree in Business Administration or Marketing is preferred, but all majors will be considered given a sincere interest in marketing. Also, work history including internships and co-ops are a plus in related fields. Self-motivated, proven leader Excellent communication skills Basic technical proficiency  What You Are Getting Into:  We all are committed to creating unique and rewarding consumer experiences. Everyone is interested in succeeding – for the team, for themselves and for the business. Cross-functionally and across the company, everyone has common goals and aspires to be their best.  You will learn something new or at least look at things differently every day. There are so many innovative people around that you’ll be motivated to pursue the ideal.  Team spirit is infectious. Communications is essential. Ideas are welcome. We challenge conventional wisdom and refuse to accept that something cannot be done.  Powered by JazzHR  TtNMtGm99l

description: Job Description  Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is a global lifestyle apparel company with a portfolio of some of the world’s most iconic denim brands: Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock & Republic®. We design, manufacture and distribute superior high-quality products that look good, fit right, and are crafted with sensitivity to our planet to give people around the world the freedom and confidence to express themselves.  Our global community of more than 15,000 employees fosters a culture of integrity, collaboration, performance and entrepreneurial spirit. We are looking for inclusive, humble, creative and forward-looking employees with a passion for creating innovative apparel products, accessories, and solutions that are both meaningful and purposeful for consumers and employees.  Sales Trainee: Become the Newest Member of Kontoor Brands  The primary responsibilities of the Sales Trainee are to learn the organization’s products, services, and policies and to develop the needed knowledge and sales skills to become an effective sales representative. Presentations and sales of the company’s products to new account prospects and established accounts, either in the showroom, at the account’s location or at the sales functions such as trade shows and sales markets. This could be done independently or with the assistance of a more experienced sales representative. Involved with the company’s event team and attend special events and assist with the sales efforts of the event in any way possible. Responsible for attending all company’s sales meeting and to stay currant on all aspects of sales business.  Key Responsibilities Present to and service new and established accounts whenever possible, either independently or with the assistance of a more seasoned sales representative Attend special events when asked and support all sales efforts at the event in any way possible Acquire a complete understanding of salesforce.com (web based sales automation software) Power BI, and be able to access and understand all other sales reports Go into customer’s stores’ and merchandising product, set-up fixtures and display all (POS) point of purchase material Develop knowledge and skills of an effective sales representative by learning the organization’s products, services and policies Have knowledge of all current product lines Be able to put together or “hang” the seasonal sample line Skills For Success Strong communication skills (oral, written, presentation) Strong organizational and process management skills Energetic self-starter Self-disciplined Ability to resolve problems and make decisions Experience/Education At least 2 years of related professional experience

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The future is what you make it.  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.  That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.  Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.  Are you ready to help us make the future?  Using your project and organizational skills, you will be responsible for management of various projects to train highly effective salespeople, drive revenue, increase productivity and improve processes. You will lead by influencing working teams within sales enablement around learning programs such as onboarding, methodology/skills, and sales leadership/coaching with focus on the entire program from needs assessment to program measurement.  You will be in a visible position and will require direct interaction with peers and leaders across all these groups. These projects span across multiple subject areas and businesses and will vary depending on the organization being supported; therefore, this role requires someone genuinely curious who enjoys learning about multiple markets, industries, and business models.  Key Responsibilities Work with sales management to identify learning / performance gaps and implement solutions to fill those needs Assess training needs through surveys, interviews, and metrics to determine performance gaps and identify opportunities, priorities, and recommended training Analyze needs of various sales roles and develop innovative and creative training solutions Facilitate Sales Manager training and coaching skills programs Support field sales coaches through communication, tools, and development Create and deliver customized learning modules to meet long and short-term needs of various sales roles for use in the classroom or virtually Develop individual learning plans and talent development tied to sales competencies Oversee sales methodology training for all sales roles Act as liaison for other teams to ensure curriculum is accurate Maintain updated training content in our Learning Management System (LMS) Coach sales team on best use of enablement materials Internally market and support sales enablement programs. Manage scheduling for learning programs across all locations/regions YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree 2+ years of experience managing Learning Programs and/or 5+ years of sales or business development experience WE VALUE Experience with Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, Access, SharePoint and modern collaboration tools like Microsoft Teams, PowerAutomate and Microsoft Forms. Working knowledge of CRM (Salesforce) and ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) Strong written and oral communication skills, particularly in cross-functional collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation Ability and interest to work with autonomy Ability to work on multiple projects and effectively manage priorities Exceeding internal and external customer expectations Master’s degree and/or CPTD certification preferred Experience in sales or sales management Instructional design experience preferred Significant experience in project management Additional Information JOB ID: HRD135823 Category: Sales Support Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Stripe is a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of all sizes—from new startups to public companies like Amazon and Salesforce—use our software to accept online payments and run technically sophisticated financial operations in more than 100 countries. By helping businesses accept payments from anywhere in the world and accelerating the economic shift from offline to online, we aim to increase the GDP of the internet.  The Field Communications team connects Stripes in our rapidly growing Sales & Marketing organization with the information they need to operate efficiently and better serve our customers. We’re looking for an analytical, creative, and intellectually curious someone to develop messaging that informs and inspires, while helping us build the infrastructure that will enable communication at scale.  The ideal candidate will be energized by working with a tightly knit team on a variety of projects at all levels of organization. You’re just as comfortable creating top-notch original content as you are building rigorous long-range communications plans or providing expert counsel to leaders. Most importantly, you know your audience and work backwards to produce compelling communications that elevate their experience. If this sounds like you, join us!  You Will Develop and execute on proactive communications strategies that amplify our vision and goals, as well as support reactive communications efforts Create and maintain communications vehicles that keep our growing organization informed, engaged, and connected Work with internal leadership to develop their messaging, whether through writing, live address, or digital media Build communications plans in support of major change initiatives Design and develop standards for measuring the success of communications We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of communications or marketing experience, preferably in the B2B technology space Exceptional written, verbal, and visual communication skills Experience developing effective communications strategies and/or change management strategies in a high-growth environment The ability to build relationships with employees in all functions and at all levels Strong judgment and a can-do attitude - capable of delivering high-quality results in a rapidly changing environment where much is unknown You Should Include These In Your Application Your resume and/or LinkedIn profile Any additional information you think will help us understand your background and accomplishments A writing or digital storytelling sample - show us your best work! description: About RingLead:  Founded in 2003, RingLead is a leading SaaS data management company with 35 employees and over 600 customers and growing, headquartered right in Melville, Long Island. RingLead offers a complete end-to-end suite of products to clean, protect and enhance company and contact information, leading to improved organizational efficiency, reliable business intelligence, and maximized ROI on CRM and marketing automation investments. Visit our company website at www.ringlead.com for more information.  Under the leadership of Executive Chairman, Russ Artzt, RingLead helps solve the dirty data problems of large enterprises, Fortune 500 companies and small businesses across the globe. Protecting over 200 million records and counting, RingLead is a trusted data management platform committed to providing to the best value for the most cutting-edge technology on the market.  Department Description:  The RingLead Sales Organization consists of top performing and driven professionals. We strive to hire top talent to continue to serve our customers and provide them with the tools to enable their success. At RingLead, integrity, reliability, and work ethic are as important as talent and effort. Recent college graduates are strongly encouraged to apply!  Role Description:  We are currently looking for a resourceful, driven, team player with a competitive spirit, and strong business acumen to help contribute to the rapidly growing sales team. Whether you come with sales experience of not, this could be the role for you If you have a curiosity for technology, or at least have a passion for making your customers successful.  Successful Business Development Representatives at RingLead have the ability to develop prospecting skills using the following methods: inbound follow up, outbound calls, personalized emails, social selling, and target account selling. All of our sales professionals have the ability to continuously learn and develop their skills through our two virtual training programs, the RingLead Library, and the RingLead University.  This person won't simply focus on selling the world's #1 data management solution, they will also cross-sell our entire suite of products, which includes world-class solutions for DMS Cleanse, DMS Duplicate Prevention, DMS Enrichment, and DMS Capture, and our full suite, DMS. The goal of a Business Development Representative is to build up a strong pipeline consisting of decision makers and influencers, schedule product demos and proposal calls on a weekly basis (aiming to fill their calendars). Our goal is to build an organization of smart, ambitious sales reps committed to our performance-based culture, continuous learning, and exceeding our customer's expectations.  Compensation:  BASE + COMMISSION + STOCK  Responsibilities: Proactively qualify ideal companies to target, along with the best people to call on according to their titles Schedule meetings for Sales Directors to close business Generate new business opportunities to fuel the Enterprise or Commercial pipeline Research and build "cold accounts" (i.e. adding contacts, sending emails, cold calling, social selling) Conduct high-level conversations with Senior Executives in prospect accounts Successfully partner with business leaders to understand the business needs and execute on goals to foster an environment of sustainable growth and success.  Basic Skill & Requirements: Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communications skills Ability to work in a fast-paced, positive team environment Strong desire to be in Technology Sales Motivated, proactive, and dynamic sales approach Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively 4-year BA/BS Degree  Preferred Requirements: Prior sales or other internship experience Salesforce or any CRM user experience Powered by JazzHR  0d6DPeNtge

description: Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI) is advancing the world’s technology. With our global perspective and diversity of thought, we proudly serve our customers around the world. We are looking for team members who share our commitment to learning and growth and excel when collaborating within and across teams.  SSI is headquartered in the heart of Silicon Valley and is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. - the #1 employer in the world (Forbes, Oct 2020) and top patent-holder in the U.S. Want to advance the world’s technology with us? Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.- one of the largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays. SSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. description: About the Opportunity:  Electo Analytics is a public affairs software startup based in Washington D.C. We are looking for an enthusiastic and thoughtful business development intern interested in the public affairs and GovTech field. Ideally, you have studied or are enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program studying a relevant field and/or have real-world experience. The internship will be offered as a three-month opportunity, with the potential to extend or become a full-time opportunity. Ideally, this role will be in-person.  What Sets You Apart:  You are a self-starter, finding relevant opportunities to contribute to the workspace. You are detail-oriented, concise and organized. Experience in an academic or professional setting in business development and entrepreneurship. You have outstanding written verbal communication skills. Experience with using data-driven analytics to understand KPI's, and experience communicating KPI's to a wider audience. You possess the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Passion to learn more about public affairs and mission-driven enterprises. Interest in learning more about the GovTech field.  How You Will Spend Your Day:   Support sales and business development teams: Reporting directly to the VP of Business Development. You will receive hands-on mentoring and guidance. Creating leads lists of potential companies and partners. Assisting with strategy for email campaigns to new companies. Facilitating demos of the product and building relationships with prospective clients. Assisting with development of marketing tools and strategy. Support in gathering and analyzing marketing analytics alongside KPI's.  Work alongside our entire team to assist in the growth of Electo: Help support in preparing relevant copy. Attend meetings as requested and document notes on occasion. Support in initiating and strategizing the sales process. Represent Electo at certain events and report back with notes.  Some of our perks include:  We work in a vibrant office space right by the Capitol. Our team enjoys spending time with each other out of the office at fun events organized in collaboration with all team members. We encourage community service and offer paid time off for service given to local communities.  How to apply:  After applying via LinkedIn Easy Apply, please complete your application by sending an email to briana@electoanalytics.com with the subject line "Business Development Internship", with your CV and a short paragraph on why you would be the right person for this role.

description: Ten10 is a payments/reward app for local purchases that positively impacts local communities and causes. We are hiring across multiple locations in the United States. As an intern, you’ll report to the Head of Social Impact and play a key role in building scalable solutions and processes while nurturing a fun, collaborative culture. You’ll work closely with various stakeholders across Product, Sales, Operations, Marketing, and Support across all three sides of the business: Education, Business and Non Profit teams.  • ...And much more! description: The Group  Morningstar`s Business Development & Sales group is responsible for helping our advisor and institutional clients build their businesses and provide better outcomes for investors. The group is structured primarily along the following client segments: advisors, asset management, institutional consultants, academics, pensions and hedge funds.  The Role  In the Sales Development Representative role, you will represent Morningstar`s software, tools, or services to the appropriate individual, advisor, or institutional clients. Our SDRs are the first point of contact for the vast majority of our new business opportunities. As an SDR, you’ll run a high volume of outreach, make connections with decision-makers at companies that fit our ideal customer profile, and generate new business opportunities for our Regional Sales team. A successful Sales Development Representative embraces challenges and change, considers themselves a people person, and has a natural curiosity to learn about others and their needs. This is a role that makes a direct and significant impact in our business, working closely with the product development, marketing, and other sales teams for the solutions you represent.  The SDR role provides boundless opportunities for both personal and professional growth. The SDR team serves as a launchpad to accelerate your sales career at Morningstar. For those dedicated to exceed expectations, career paths at Morningstar are endless. Every department at Morningstar has representation from former Direct to Advisor sales team representatives. This position is based in our Chicago office.  Responsibilities Act as the engine of our sales team, revving up and warming up prospects to be shared with our regional sales team; Work with a strong sense of urgency, which translates into activity with the expectation of making 50 calls per day; Ask thorough and pointed questions, guiding potential clients through needs assessment and discovery sessions to qualify the prospect and drive new opportunities; Act as consultants - our clients appreciate the value of our data and software for their needs, so we take the time to understand those needs and address them head on; Demonstrate extensive product knowledge to our potential client base; Work closely with client service, sales, product, and marketing teams. Qualifications Have terrific prioritization skills - we generate a LOT of prospects for the team to work with every month, and this team knows how to identify and go after the key customers; Are stellar and professional communicators, both verbally and in their written works; Possess strong negotiation skills and can effectively advance prospects through the sales cycle; Are self-motivated and dedicated to succeed; Love to meet and exceed goals on a daily, weekly and monthly basis; Are team players with entrepreneurial spirits - they come up with and are willing to try new ideas to achieve greater levels of success; Are interested in financial markets or services, particularly investing Generally have at least one (1) years of professional work experience, ideally in some sort of sales role; Have positive, focused, goal - oriented attitudes and mentalities and can be motivated both as an individual and as part of a team; Requirements A bachelor’s degree is required.

Founded in 2015 Scenthound is a wellness-centered, membership-based dog grooming business and has five corporate Scenters open and operating in Florida where the company is based. The model takes a unique approach to grooming with a focus on the five core areas of routine and preventive care for dogs; Skin, Coat, Ears, Nails, and Teeth (SCENT). Scenthound launched the Franchise opportunity in 2019 and has over 114 locations open or in development across 12 states.  Scenthound is an exciting and dynamic business that is still in start-up mode. We are a passionate team with an entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to roll up our sleeves to get the work done. We have a strong culture that revolves around our North Star of removing barriers so people can love and connect with their dogs every day.  POSITION SUMMARY:  The Sales Training Specialist is a vital position at Scenthound, providing effective leadership, learning events, coaching, and training support. The main responsibilities include facilitating trainings, developing learning material, and evaluating trainees to provide individualized learning. We are searching for an experienced customer service and membership sales professional who has a passion for teaching and developing the skills of others. A successful Sales Training Specialist is a proactive problem solver, adaptable, detail-oriented, and a compassionate dog lover!  REQUIREMENTS: Experience in sales (membership sales preferred) and customer service (food service or retail preferred) Experience in a teaching, training, coaching position, or a similar role Willingness to travel (up to 30%) Must live in or be willing to relocate to the Palm Beach, FL area Must be comfortable handling dogs Ability to teach and adhere to the Scenthound model Reliable transportation Stamina to stand for long periods of time; strength to lift up to 50 pounds  PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: Franchise experience Membership Sales experience Familiarity with Learning Management Systems (Schoox preferred)  WORK ENVIRONMENT: Corporate office (Jupiter, FL). Dedicated training facility (West Palm Beach, FL) Various Scenthound locations  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts to develop and maintain training materials, through meetings, interviews, and job observations Organize in-house and offsite learning activities, including presentations, role-playing exercises, and job simulations Facilitate orientations and trainings for Franchise owners and customer-facing employees (customer service, membership sales, Point of Sale system, Scenthound culture and values, etc.) Evaluate trainee performance to provide learning events and reference materials to further develop their knowledge and skill Stay up to date on Scenthound processes and L&D best practices Be available to franchise owners, managers, and trainees for training support Other tasks / responsibilities as required   SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Energetic, motivating, and encouraging Patient and adaptable Strong communication and interpersonal skills Effectively communicate with individuals of varying experiences and educations Control of conversations & timing and flow of trainings Effectively communicate with customers Strong teaching/ coaching skills Attention to detail Team-oriented Organization and time-management Computer/ Technology proficiency Accountability; hold oneself and others to Scenthound Standards  BENEFITS: Health insurance with 50% company contribution Dental insurance Vision insurance Paid time off 401(k) Free grooming services for your dog Energetic, fun, loving work environment Unlimited growth potential with an expanding business Competitive compensation with merit-based pay increases

Our Future Leaders Programme will ignite the leader in you. This unique programme is designed to develop Unilever’s Future Leaders (UFL) by providing challenging and purposeful opportunities that accelerate their readiness to take on business leadership roles.  The Summer Internship is the primary pathway to beginning a Marketing career at Unilever! The program introduces you to Unilever and its 400+ incredible brands through a challenging and rewarding experience that marries the business needs of the company with your learning and development. As an intern, you are assigned a key business project within a brand team to fully own for the duration of the summer. Skill sets utilized and further developed during the Internship are presentation skills, team working, leadership, analytics, strategic thinking, and building insights into action to deliver business solutions.  Who You Are & What You’ll Do  As a Marketing intern you will have the opportunity create solutions to real business challenges for your assigned brand team. Through their projects and teams, Interns are exposed to a wide array of brand marketing activities such as the development of new communication ideas, product development, market analysis, creation of sub-brands, consumer and competitor research, and advertising or creative executions. You’re a born leader: You individually take on projects and run with them. You’re a strategy guru: You create data-driven strategies and make plans to execute. You’re a dot connector: You can learn to navigate a big organization! You love to win, and have fun doing it. You’re a story teller: You craft compelling stories to obtain senior stakeholder buy-in. What You’ll Need To Succeed Current college junior level pursuing Bachelor’s degree, with a demonstrated interest in marketing and/or general management. The ideal candidate will need to possess strong leadership competencies, and strong team and analytical skills; strategic thinking skills; proactivity and enthusiasm for work in a fast moving, dynamic environment; the ability to communicate effectively, especially as part of a team; ability to be creative; and the ability to understand complex business issues and demonstrate consumer empathy. Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher Ability to relocate and willingness to work at sales office locations across the US Life at Unilever is a lot of fun – just like our application process!  Application - Start by completing our simple online application. You can import your details from your LinkedIn profile to speed up the process. You can only apply to one function, so carefully consider which role you would like to pursue before applying.  Assessment - After your application, if you meet the basic requirements, we’ll invite you to participate in a series of fun games that looks at different cognitive, emotional, and social traits. This will help us find the best fit for you and you will receive personalized feedback after completing the games.  Digital Interview – Upon successful completion of the assessment, you will be invited to participate in a digital interview where you can solve real-world problems using Unilever scenarios. This will give you insight into our company culture and how we do business. The interview is split into two parts – three short hypothetical questions followed by a business case. You can record and complete your video anytime, anywhere. All you need is a computer or mobile device with access to video recording (usually standard in most devices) and a stable internet connection.  Discovery Center – Once the interview is complete, we’ll invite our top matches to our offices in the Greater New York City or Toronto areas (depending on which job you applied for) for a truly immersive experience. You’ll get to experience a number of exciting activities and projects along with your peers, meet our leaders, and receive personalized coaching and feedback. The exercises are designed around a real business case study, enabling us to tap into your potential while giving you further insight into what it’s really like to work at Unilever.  What We Can Offer You  Culture for Growth | Top Notch Employee Health & Well Being Benefits | Every Voice Matters | Global Reach | Life at Unilever | Careers with Purpose | World Class Career Development Programs | Check Out Our Space | Focus On Sustainability  By applying for this vacancy, you are confirming that you have made your Line Manager aware of your application and that you are at a point in your career with Unilever where it is appropriate for you to be applying for other positions.  Unilever is an organization committed to diversity and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future every day for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business.  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Persons with Disabilities  Applicants and employees are protected from discrimination under Federal law. For more information, please see EEO is the Law  Employment is subject to verification of pre-screening tests, which may include drug screening, background check, credit check and DMV check.  If you are an individual with a disability in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at NA.Accommodations@unilever.com. Please note: This email is reserved for individuals with disabilities in need of assistance and is not a means of inquiry about positions or application statuses.  About Unilever  Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries. Our products are present in 7 out of 10 homes globally and are used by over 2 billion people on a daily basis. In the United States the portfolio includes brand icons such as: Axe, Ben & Jerry’s, Bertolli, Breyers, Caress, Clear Scalp & Hair Therapy, Consort For Men, Country Crock, Degree, Dove personal care products, Fruttare, Good Humor, Hellmann’s, I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter!, Just for Me!, Klondike, Knorr, Lever 2000, Lipton, Magnum, Motions, Nexxus, Pond’s, Popsicle, Promise, Q-tips, Simple, St. Ives, Suave, tcb, TIGI, TRESemmé, and Vaseline. All of the preceding brand names are trademarks or registered trademarks of the Unilever Group of Companies. Our ambition is to double the size of our business, whilst reducing our overall environmental footprint (including sourcing, consumer use and disposal) and increasing our positive social impact. We are committed to helping more than a billion people take action to improve their health and well-being, sourcing all our agricultural raw materials sustainably by 2020, and decoupling our growth from our environmental impact. Supporting our three big goals are more than 50 time-based targets. See more on the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan at http://www.unileverusa.com/sustainable-living/. Unilever employs more than 10,000 people in the United States – generating over $9 billion in sales in 2012. For more information, visit www.unileverusa.com  Unilever is an organisation committed to diversity and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future every day for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual and the talent they can bring. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

Title: Market Development Associate  Reporting To: Senior Director, Demand Generation  Location: Remote or based out of our Bethesda, MD office  Opportunity:  The Market Development Associate will support GetWellNetwork’s continued high growth and penetration of the healthcare market. We are looking for a high-energy, driven professional with strong customer service skills, sound business acumen, and strong technical aptitude to join our team. This individual will execute business development strategies for net new business by quickly assessing the business environment and needs of a prospect, then articulating and applying the business value of GetWellNetwork to that prospect. Success in the role will be measured by booking goals and pipeline development metrics.  This role offers exposure to executives in the healthcare space, deep insight into the healthcare industry and GetWellNetwork technologies, and an opportunity to work with a smart, innovative team. The position will require customer and client service skills as well as market or data analytics, similar to those required in the hospitality and tourism industries, along with many others. can prioritize and manage multiple work streams Perseverance; handles objections and rejection Thrives in a competitive team environment Intuitive with the capacity to hit the ground running Experience with Salesforce CRM a plus Consultative and solution prospecting/selling expertise a plus  About GetWellNetwork:  GetWellNetwork’s interactive solutions engage patients and families, empower clinicians and deliver outcomes that matter. The global digital health company has been helping to unite providers and patients as partners in the healthcare journey for 20 years. From inpatient to outpatient, our comprehensive cross-continuum platform bridges care settings to create a seamless experience for patients and their families.  With more than 300+ employees across the U.S., GetWellNetwork is dedicated to changing the lives of millions of patients and families every year. If you're passionate about working in a high-growth, dynamic and innovative environment that is changing an industry, then we want to hear from you!  GetWellNetwork is an Equal Opportunity Employer. description: At Spurs Sports & Entertainment (SS&E), we work in service of something bigger than ourselves, it’s so much more than the game or concert itself. It takes all members of our Spurs Family to harness the power of sports and entertainment to create memories that endure, memories that excite, and connections that strengthen our community. We are looking for motivated team members to join our family! As a Group Sales Intern, you will have the opportunity to see the business side of sports marketing first hand for the San Antonio Spurs. You will work directly with the San Antonio Spurs, dealing with various aspects of the day-to-day operations of the Team, such as marketing, community events, game nights and general office duties. Group sales interns are involved with the creative side as well, participating in brainstorming sessions and meetings where group sales ideas & events are discussed.  Assisting the Group Sales Department Assist with group event planning & logistics. Help set up group sales collateral for groups—vouchers, etc. Assistance with in-/out-bound phone traffic related to large group programs (incorrect credit card transactions, etc.) Share ideas and participate in brainstorming sessions for group events Process data basing flyers & maintain mailings and files. Assist Group Sales Department with game night duties. Assist with meetings and escorting groups. Help with set-up in designated group concourse performance areas. Help with redemption tables (group value-add item). Assist with Fan Experience packages (FEPs)—post-game free throws, pre-game courtside experience, etc. Minimum Qualifications Candidates who are able to earn college credit during a minimum of one semester during participation. Must be either a Junior, Senior, Graduate Level in college, or final year of a technical, vocational or associates program. Flexible schedule with the ability to work evenings, nights and weekends, holidays as needed. (20 -30 hours/week) Has the ability to work efficiently and in a timely manner in order to meet strict deadlines. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent computer skills. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite is necessary. Experience with ticketing systems is a plus. Must have reliable transportation. The ability to carry/move/handle boxes up to 25 lbs. Self-starter, highly motivated individual. Ability to work with all types of people. Ability to adapt to changing projects. Internships are paid positions (minimum wage), but are not guarantees of employment once the internship is completed. Internships last approximately one to two school semesters, summer, or in correspondence with a sports season and is based on successful completion of duties and fulfillment of all responsibilities. SS&E is an Equal Opportunity Employer Nothing contained in this job description is intended to be a contract of employment, nor does any information contained herein represent a guarantee of employment for a specific duration. Your employment with SS&E is “at will”, which means that either you or SS&E may terminate the relationship at any time.

description: Stripe is a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of all sizes—from new startups to public companies like Amazon and Salesforce—use our software to accept online payments and run technically sophisticated financial operations in more than 100 countries. By helping businesses accept payments from anywhere in the world and accelerating the economic shift from offline to online, we aim to increase the GDP of the internet.  The Field Communications team connects Stripes in our rapidly growing Sales & Marketing organization with the information they need to operate efficiently and better serve our customers. We’re looking for an analytical, creative, and intellectually curious someone to develop messaging that informs and inspires, while helping us build the infrastructure that will enable communication at scale.  The ideal candidate will be energized by working with a tightly knit team on a variety of projects at all levels of organization. You’re just as comfortable creating top-notch original content as you are building rigorous long-range communications plans or providing expert counsel to leaders. Most importantly, you know your audience and work backwards to produce compelling communications that elevate their experience. If this sounds like you, join us!  You Will Develop and execute on proactive communications strategies that amplify our vision and goals, as well as support reactive communications efforts Create and maintain communications vehicles that keep our growing organization informed, engaged, and connected Work with internal leadership to develop their messaging, whether through writing, live address, or digital media Build communications plans in support of major change initiatives Design and develop standards for measuring the success of communications We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of communications or marketing experience, preferably in the B2B technology space Exceptional written, verbal, and visual communication skills Experience developing effective communications strategies and/or change management strategies in a high-growth environment The ability to build relationships with employees in all functions and at all levels Strong judgment and a can-do attitude - capable of delivering high-quality results in a rapidly changing environment where much is unknown You Should Include These In Your Application Your resume and/or LinkedIn profile Any additional information you think will help us understand your background and accomplishments A writing or digital storytelling sample - show us your best work! description: WHO WE ARE/WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:  Hivewyre is an exciting, growing, digital advertising co-op in beautiful Tempe, AZ –We’re seeking driven, money-motivated Sales Development Intern to join our team immediately. You will have a chance to help build a company from the ground up, work with the latest technologies and be a guiding force in developing the company culture.  Junior and Senior Applicants Only!  WHAT OUR SALES TEAM DOES:  As a member of our Sales team, you'll handle prospecting, and sitting along side our trained sales team to learn how they pitch our company to clients.  Able to work remotely!  Requirements  ATTRIBUTES OF OUR SUCCESSFUL SALES DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVES: Any experience in inside sales Excellent analytic and communication skills  OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE: Isn’t a fan of big company structure and politics Comfortable with change and able to move quickly Likes a good game of cornhole, ping pong or pickleball Not afraid to pick up the phone and dial prospects Works well in a team environment Has a desire to create change and use their voice when they find a solution Has a strong conviction to personal growth and achieving goals, both inside and outside of the workplace Wants to work in a fast-paced, start-up environment Analytical skills Understanding of internet advertising models, ad optimization, audience trends and technologies (Not required, but definitely beneficial) LOVES dogs! Desires autonomy and authority Has a sense of urgency Unafraid of change (Did we say that already?) Not afraid by seeing co-workers in shorts in the office  Benefits  WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT? No micromanagement Our culture allows you to make your own rules, own your results and make plenty of $$ along the way Our advertising co-op/data sharing model is a fresh concept that's gaining momentum by the minute. We're early to this game and we're poised to win. We have a true start-up mentality, so your voice, actions and achievements will be instrumental in shaping our culture, values and overall impact on the ad industry  WHAT’S IN THIS FOR YOU? An energized, fun, modern workplace at Industrious Tempe where you can launch your sales career! Expand your knowledge in the world of Advertising Sales  CULTURE  Our culture is one that functions through autonomy and is collective, transparent and open. We love supporting the causes we believe in and, of course, having a great time! Just take a look at our culture map.  Our Company  This exciting, new company is based in the rapidly growing segment of internet advertising. We are looking for independent, entrepreneurial and self-motivated individuals with tremendous initiative who want to play a significant role in the future direction and success of this dynamic, fun organization. If you desire a culture where you’re excited about coming to work, we want you. If you like lots of structure, move along. If you want to feel like you really belong to a “work family,” please apply. If you love lots of rules that are developed by an individual who can’t do your job, this isn’t your gig. If you like rules for rule's sake, keep looking. If you like being surrounded by intelligent, driven individuals who work hard at creating value and solutions for clients, this could be the place for you. If you like setting goals, being held accountable and holding the organization accountable, working harder than you ever have, raising your hand to take on new responsibilities, don’t mind an occasional prank joke, consider joining the Hive.  Discover what it’s like to enjoy your job… again!  APPLY TODAY – JOIN THE HIVE!
