TRILLFIT® hosts two signature events a year, Brunch & Burn, a new year kick-off, and TRILLFEST, a music wellness festival. Past event partners include: Hulu, Google, Adidas, Revolve, Who What Wear, Complex Magazine, Primark, New Balance, Shoe Dazzle, and more. Additional responsibilities may include but are not limited to: Handle appointments, correspondence & subsequent follow-up with clients and partners Research on potential clients and partners Assist Sales department a variety of special projects as needed (Email, In-Studio Programming, Social Media) Support overall Sales goals, specifically in membership, private classes, and digital sales Ideal Candidate: Energetic, self-motivated, professional, passionate, creative, and outgoing Comfortable working independently, but able to function effectively as part of a team Savvy communicator with immaculate written, verbal, and inter-personal skills Flexible, multitasker, and a fast learner; willing to adapt to priority changes during event days Well organized, detail-oriented, and able to handle tasks under minimal to moderate supervision Experience and or interest in social media marketing, public relations, marketing, and or events management Above all: loves fitness + hip hop  We are looking for multiple interns. Opportunity to earn commission, learn, and grow!

About: Big data intelligence company offering a tokenized blockchain SaaS for commercial real estate asset management firms. Mitigate human error and save thousands of hours per year on manual data analysis with our proprietary Machine Learning algorithmic science. We make manual data analysis an arduous task from the past. Prebuilt algorithmic data will aide commercial real estate acquisition teams, mortgage brokers, lenders, and even developers in identifying key data discrepancies. Predictive analysis pinpoints property upside/risk due to our consistent and accurate underwriting product. Optimized investment strategy returns are no longer a 'best-case scenario'.  General Summary: You will lead the overall sales/marketing process. This includes-the development and use of professional marketing materials/digital content, lead generation, and developing client relationships.  Job Specifications: • Strong desire to learn and professional drive • Understanding of different marketing techniques • Excellent verbal and written communication skills • Excellent knowledge of MS Office • Passion for the marketing industry and its best practices • Ability to take direction and absorb information quickly  Basic role description:  1) Draft Cohort Analysis  2) Draft White pages (Blockchain Asset/Data Tokenization)  3) Market research  4) Social media marketing (IG, Twitter, Facebook)  5) Pitch SaaS (software) to prospective clients a) Which teams/divisions? Acquisitions, mortgage brokers, and lenders (asset management/hedge funds/private equity )

Job Description  The Sales Trainee position allows the employee to prepare for a role as an Account (Sales) Representative or a Customer Service (Sales) Representative. The training period is no more than 15 months. During this period, the Sales Trainee shadows account representatives and customer service representatives to gain experience in sales, company product lines, as well as customer base.  Additionally, the Trainee works in the branch's warehouse to become familiar with shipping and receiving, inventory, and delivery functions. The Trainee also participates in various online and satellite class settings that are conducted by the company's Training Department.  These classes include, but are not limited to: product, sales, and leadership training. Motion offers an excellent benefits package that includes options for healthcare coverage, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, vacation, sick, and holiday pay.  Responsibilities Train in all levels of a branch including, but not limited to: inside sales (customer service representative), outside sales (account representative), inventory, delivery, warehouse, and clerical Participate and succeed in company sponsored training classes Develop competent presentation skills Qualifications Bachelor's degree preferably in Industrial Distribution or related field. Customer service oriented Achievement oriented and self-motivated Proactive people skills Possess leadership qualities Effective communication skills Good analytical skills Able to follow through on tasks Organized Willing to travel on occasion

description: Already an employee? You must apply through our internal portal: click here  Field Sales Intern  Date: Sep 10, 2021  Location:  Atlanta, GA, US  Requisition ID: 17860  A Career In Beer  Our purpose at the Molson Coors Beverage Company is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people; we believe that an inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate people who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.  The Headlines  As a Field Sales Intern you will be part of our Early Talent Program. Our Early Talent Program is Molson Coors’ undergraduate summer internship program, where students are exposed to the beverage industry, engaged in real-world problem-solving, and immersed in social and educational opportunities with other interns. The internship is full-time, beginning in June through August. Housing assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements. Interns who successfully complete the Early Talent Program are eligible for full-time positions within Molson Coors Beverage Company, upon graduation.  The Responsibilities Gain experience within our field sales organization and the opportunity through collaboration with various stakeholders & teams Complete a robust project focused on a sales business need and present findings to senior sales leadership Participate in key sales activities within your assigned team/location Develop knowledge and understanding of the beer industry The Other Qualifications You are entering Senior year and pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or another related field Passion and interest in a career in sales Proficiency in Microsoft Office – including Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, and Teams Strong interpersonal and communication skills High energy team player with strong social skills Drive and a bias for action Must be willing to work occasional non-traditional hours (ie: attend events in evening/weekends) Must be 21 years of age or older at start of internship Work Perks That You Need To Know About Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages! Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. That’s why all offers of employment in the U.S. where legally permitted are contingent on the candidate showing proof of being fully vaccinated against Covid 19 (currently one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine) to pass the pre-employment requirements. Individuals with medical issues or religious beliefs or practices that prevent them from getting the vaccine may request an exemption from the vaccine requirement.  At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.  Nearest Major Market: Atlanta
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Financial Services

description: Stripe is a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of all sizes—from new startups to public companies like Amazon and Salesforce—use our software to accept online payments and run technically sophisticated financial operations in more than 100 countries. By helping businesses accept payments from anywhere in the world and accelerating the economic shift from offline to online, we aim to increase the GDP of the internet.  The Field Communications team connects Stripes in our rapidly growing Sales & Marketing organization with the information they need to operate efficiently and better serve our customers. We’re looking for an analytical, creative, and intellectually curious someone to develop messaging that informs and inspires, while helping us build the infrastructure that will enable communication at scale.  The ideal candidate will be energized by working with a tightly knit team on a variety of projects at all levels of organization. You’re just as comfortable creating top-notch original content as you are building rigorous long-range communications plans or providing expert counsel to leaders. Most importantly, you know your audience and work backwards to produce compelling communications that elevate their experience. If this sounds like you, join us!  You Will Develop and execute on proactive communications strategies that amplify our vision and goals, as well as support reactive communications efforts Create and maintain communications vehicles that keep our growing organization informed, engaged, and connected Work with internal leadership to develop their messaging, whether through writing, live address, or digital media Build communications plans in support of major change initiatives Design and develop standards for measuring the success of communications We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of communications or marketing experience, preferably in the B2B technology space Exceptional written, verbal, and visual communication skills Experience developing effective communications strategies and/or change management strategies in a high-growth environment The ability to build relationships with employees in all functions and at all levels Strong judgment and a can-do attitude - capable of delivering high-quality results in a rapidly changing environment where much is unknown You Should Include These In Your Application Your resume and/or LinkedIn profile Any additional information you think will help us understand your background and accomplishments A writing or digital storytelling sample - show us your best work! LI-KC5
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Internet

description: Soul, performance, and style take flight at Jordan Brand. With its deep roots in basketball, the Jordan Brand began as an homage to one player: Michael Jordan. Since then, Jordan has become synonymous with peak performance and an endless pursuit of greatness. Employees in merchandising, product branding, sports marketing, and sales bring creativity, innovation and audacious design to footwear and apparel, all with one mission in mind: help athletes fly on and off the court.  At the Jordan Brand, we win as a team and pride ourselves on being a family.  In the role of a Jordan Associate Merchandising Intern you will support the Merchandising team in driving integrated, profitable, relevant product assortments that express the category vision in the marketplace and meet revenue targets. You’ll provide merchandising execution within regional product merchandising at an intermediate professional level. You’ll provide line plan systems maintenance and help drive alignment throughout the merchandising process including model plan, flow plan, wholesale and suggested retail pricing strategies and gross pricing margin targets.  You’ll utilize market knowledge and internal data systems to provide assistance to the Merchandising team, collaborate with the Sales team on distribution strategies, and work with the Demand Planning and Operations teams to ensure optimal seasonal planning. You’ll conduct analysis of current business (including bookings, and sell-through by channel, age/gender/sport segments, size, color, etc.) You’ll drive the translation of consumer insights into relevant stories, collections and concepts to drive the business. You’ll prepare Merchandising tools such as consumer right assortments. In addition, you’ll also be responsible for sample management. Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in a Business, Retail Management, Retail and Consumer Science or retail relevant major 3.0 GPA or higher Graduation date of December 2022 or Spring/Summer 2023 Retail experience in a vertical retailer preferred General financial proficiency and analysis skills Effective verbal and written communication skills Application Deadline: October 8th, 2021 at 11:59pm PST  Please submit your resume as a PDF!  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

jobTitle: Healthcare Sales & Market Analyst Summer Internship - Work from home - Express Scripts
description: Looking for an internship program where you'll make a real difference – rather than just completing busy work? Then you've come to the right place. Cigna's Summer Internship Program is designed to assign you projects that have a lasting impact on our business – which touches millions of people across the globe.  As an intern, you'll get an inside look at your desired field, while working next to some of the best in the industry. Program activities, including an executive speaker series, volunteer events, and career development workshops, give you the opportunity to network with employees across the organization and prepare you for a full-time career.  Where You'll Work  Our summer intern will support the Department of Defense (DoD) team within our Government Markets & myMatrixx organization. The intern will focus on special projects specific to DoD including development and support of key business strategies and reporting. Project work can include one of three focus areas; provider engagement, sales coordination, and contract management support.  What You'll Do Develop and maintain strong relationships with our internal and external stakeholders Work with stakeholders to collect requirements and collaborate on analytics and reporting. Project management, document preparation, and data management support to a variety of teams. Other projects as assigned Qualifications Ideal candidate will be a 3rd or 4th year student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Project Management, or Communications. GPA of 3.0 or higher strongly preferred. Strong critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities and able to work with abstract information Strong time management and planning capabilities. Solid project management skills. General Info: Interest in analytical and conceptual thinking to find problems within patterns, assess possible causes and determine a course of action. Possess technical and innovative expertise that allows navigation within systems and data. Operate as a team-player when working with members of the organization. Project work can include one of three focus areas including provider engagement, sales coordinator support, and support the contract team.  Schedule: You must be available to work a 40-hour work week for 10-12 weeks summer 2022, beginning May 23, 2022.  This role can work from home however, geographical preference is for the incumbent to be located in St. Louis, MO area. Summer housing is not provided for this opportunity.  One goal of this internship program is to prepare and identify qualified candidates for roles with Cigna post-graduation. Therefore, this temporary internship is open only to individuals who are eligible for employment in the United States and who would not require visa sponsorship now or in the future.  This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado.  About Cigna  Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. When you work with us, or one of our subsidiaries, you’ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people’s lives. What difference will you make?  Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, childbirth (including pregnancy) or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.  If you require reasonable accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com for support. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

description: Sales and Marketing Internship | PAID INTERNSHIP  Job Summary:  Our Intern Program is a 3-month experience that will provide you an opportunity to gain in- depth knowledge about Wave’s business, mission, and culture while meeting with organizational leaders, networking with fellow intern colleagues at various social events, and presenting to teams, executives, and management. Buzz’s Internship Program is a key initiative in our high-performance culture toolkit. The program is designed to provide participants a world-class experience in an extremely dynamic and fast paced environment through collaboration and interaction with senior leadership, managers, cross-functional teams, and other interns.  Training throughout the Internship Includes: • Customer relationship building • Territory management • Managing accounts • Providing sales and marketing presentations • Reporting marketing data and feedback to the client • Relaying state of the art technology updates to customers • New customer acquisition • Consult priority customers given to us by the client • Client branding • Account updates • Contract overview  Requirements: • Relevant field of study at university • Sales and/or marketing experience is a plus, but not a requirement. • Competitive and proactive attitude. • Confident demeanor. • Strong student mentality. **Must be able to work from our Austin office** ⦁ Candidates must be eighteen years of age or older ⦁ For our international applicants, please keep in mind, we are unable to provide sponsorships  Ready to gain hands on experience? It's as easy as hitting the APPLY button and following us on LinkedIn!  Qualified candidates will be contacted to schedule virtual interviews.  Employment Type Internship

We are looking to recruit recent grads & early-career transitioners who are ready to kick-start a fast-paced career at a high-growth tech startup and make an impact while joining one of the fastest-growing career-obsessed communities in the country.  LaunchSource is changing the way recent grads break into modern business careers through one of the most demanded roles across the world: Business/Sales Development. In this role, you are at the forefront of a revenue generation process gaining valuable skills that will translate into vital skills that have helped hundreds of individuals progress in a modern career to roles not limited to senior management.  We give you the interview preparation, insider tips, and coaching to win the job at no cost to you. We've helped 10,000 candidates gain the skills and confidence to win their first jobs and start their careers. Check us out on glassdoor.com and feel free to visit our website at LaunchSource.com  In This Role, You’ll Get To Work closely and collaboratively with Sales Representatives to develop and implement appropriate strategies to identify new business opportunities Tactically execute on a plan that includes a combination of sales & marketing skills not limited to calling, research, emailing, and using social media Set yourself up for a successful career by learning the necessary fundamentals to be a great salesperson, leader, and executive Get a mini-MBA! You'll learn how a variety of businesses operate, what challenges they face on a daily basis, and how technology can dramatically improve their businesses and employees' lives We’re looking for people who have: Excellent written and verbal communication skills A strong desire to begin a modern sales career The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better The desire to meet and exceed measurable performance goals Are naturally curious and passionate A keenly developed competitive nature Who are able to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship either now or in the future Salary: Base Salary + OTE  Base Salary: $40,000-$50,000  OTE: $10,000-$25,000+  Here at LaunchSource, we don't just accept our differences — we celebrate them, we support them and we thrive on them for the benefit of our candidates, clients, and our community. LaunchSource and its clients are proud equal opportunity employers.  LaunchSource provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  By applying to this job, contingent on my acceptance to the LaunchSource process and platform, I consent to have my personal information, including my resume and other materials that I provide to LaunchSource or grant permission for LaunchSource to use, displayed to and accessed by LaunchSource's clients via the LaunchSource platform or other means of communication.

description: Filling Internship Immediately*  We are a fashion wholesale/retail jewelry company located in Brooklyn looking for Fall (September-December 2021) Interns.This position may be remote depending on the state's Covid-19 guidelines. Be prepared for in-person, remote or hybrid experience. This is not a paid position. We will reimburse you for train or MTA travel when you visit our NYC office in downtown Brooklyn. **This internship will be in exchange for school credit and you must be a student. Please do not apply if you do not live in the NYC Tristate area.**  We design/handcraft most pieces of Jewelry (Costume, Fashion and Fine 14k gold). Our brand focuses on empowering women, nourishing and promoting the inner beauty for the woman within. You will be working directly for the Founder & Creative Director. We need a sales marketing intern who can assist the owner at holiday trunk shows/popup shops. Part of this job will require travel to events in NYC, NJ, and Westchester to set up a trunk show table.  Sales & Marketing Responsibilities:  Aid with the implementation of marketing campaigns  Research possible partnerships  Researching possible retailers that align with the Bonnie Jennifer brand  Contacting these retailers to acquire information about their buyers  Pitching Bonnie Jennifer to these buyers with the end goal of being carried in their stores  Emailing and cold-calling retailers  Help plan giveaways every month and coordinate execution with the media intern  Come up with strategies to increase brand awareness and sales  Research possible partnerships with for profit and non-profit charities and organizations  Assist with potentially driving (not mandated) and setting up for trunk shows  Requirements Current undergraduate or graduate student*  Familiarity with marketing strategies and platforms  Ability to multi-task and take initiative  Flexible work schedule  Excellent communicator  **Must be available at least 2-3 days a week**  Benefits  Stipend: Public Transportation reimbursement with receipt; credit at an accredited University
industries: Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: Distribution Internship Program 2022  We're looking for analytical and innovative interns to join our Distribution division on our 2022 Summer Internship Program. These roles are part of our future leadership program where we are looking to build graduates with the skills and expertise fitting for a future leader within our Distribution business.  The department  Our Distribution teams manage our relationships with clients and help grow our business. So we're after people with strong communication skills who want to keep us ahead of our competitors. You'll need an inquisitive mind and an appetite for challenge, together with the tenacity and analytical ability to deliver the best service for our clients.  The programme  Our 2022 Summer Internship Program starts on Monday June 6, 2021 and runs for 9 weeks ending on Friday August 5, 2021. This Program will provide you with a unique introduction into the investment management industry and how Distribution operates within it. You'll be given introductory training and opportunities to network with people across the business.  Some Of Your Tasks May Include  During your internship you will be assigned to a distribution team where you will have the opportunity to work on live projects and shadow leaders across the business. Researching a project to identify a new market opportunity for Schroders, and presenting the findings Working with a senior colleague to improve the way we pitch a product to our clients Helping us make better use of the data in our customer relationship management system What We Look For Strong interpersonal and communication skills Intellectually inquisitive - be passionate about financial markets, global trends and economics and beyond Innovative and analytical – you're happy to think outside the box and look for a fresh perspective Happy to get involved in variety of tasks and projects The Knowledge, Skills And Qualifications We're Looking For Working knowledge of financial markets – gathered through reading and possibly activities/clubs on campus A strong work ethic and energy to learn the investment business and an intention to further your knowledge on your own time A collaborative approach to working as part of a team towards collective goals Recruitment process Online application form and CV Online assessments Video interview Assessment center ADA  Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.  EEO/Affirmative Action  Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, intellectual disability, mental disability or physical disability, including, but not limited to, blindness, or protected veteran status. jobTitle: Sales Intern - No Remote - Supplement & Beauty Brand
description: Obvi is a very fun and engaging brand in the fitness/supplement world. Our flagship product is our collagen protein. We have come first to market in this industry with flavored collagen. We have created the first cereal flavored collagen protein in the world and it is to help people fill their cravings and fall in love with all the benefits of collagen at the same time. We are looking for a sales intern to support our VP of Sales in daily tasks, as well as acquire new business. Ideal candidate is good at communication, collaborative, and passionate about health/fitness/wellness and the supplement industry. Long term/repeat work is in the scope. Work from Home or our office based out of Kearny. - Responsibility: Position Overview: In this unique intern opportunity, you will obtain experience within the VP of Sales by interacting with various accounts, gain customer experience interacting with our retailers and end-user customers. Learn and implement sales techniques. Generate potential customers list based on research. Develop client relationships and maintain & retain existing accounts. Maintain sales records. Support by providing inputs on sales literature, presentations, and customer briefs. Master product knowledge by participating in continuous learning activities. Collaborate with an amazing team of Health Enthusiasts Maintain regular contact with clients Be willing to perform additional duties as required. Job Qualifications Knowledge Requirements Undergraduates with major in Sales, Marketing, Business, or Advertising. A GPA of 3.0 or higher. Excellent interpersonal skills. Willing and ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Ability to use Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Preferred: Supplement & Beauty Industry Sales Experience - Compensation. Hourly with a evaluation post 60 days for a full time role.

Company Overview  Rev.io is a SaaS-based recurring revenue & customer management platform based in Atlanta, GA.  We are guided by our Mission, which is to help clients grow revenue efficiently.  Our Vision is to be the best billing and back-office software company in te world by providing innovative solutions and extraordinary service to our clients and end-users.  We are guided in all we do by our ACT TOP values:  Principle Duties And Responsibilities  The primary responsibility of the Sales Development Intern is to grow personally and professionally while assisting the Rev.io team through prospecting and pipeline management. We're looking for people who love to win, have strong business ethics and great communication skills. Lead effective cross-functional relationships between all other departments within Rev.io and upholding the integrity of Rev.io’s Mission & Values.  A Day In The Life Extensive sales training and presentation role play Work collaboratively with the Director of Sales and team of Sales Consultants to observe a deal throughout the entire sales cycle Learn Salesforce - track all prospecting, leads, meetings and daily tasks Maintain and expand the company’s database of prospects Learn Outreach - prospect for new clients via leading Sales Automation application Identify key decision makers and assist with developing strategic relationships to drive revenue Collaborate with Sales Consultants and Account Executives in a fast paced sales environment Meet and exceed quantitative and qualitative goals for prospecting, customer contacts, qualified leads and pipeline generation Demonstrate teamwork through sharing of best practices and collaboration with cross-functional teams to maximize territory and company success Communicate customer feedback back to the company to assist in vision and strategic planning Learn to forecast accurately - weekly, monthly and quarterly Maintain a high level of integrity, commitment, and trust to exceed expectations CANDIDATE PROFESSIONAL AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES Candidates must be able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week Demonstrate a passion for sales Be a self-starter and have demonstrated leadership experience Exhibit excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Demonstrate research and analytical skills Be involved in leadership roles on campus Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM preferred Demonstrate written and oral communication skills LOCATION: Atlanta, GA

description: About Little House of Flowers: Little House of Flowers is a full-service boutique flower business that is family-owned and operated. We offer beautiful floral and succulents arrangements special for weddings and special events. Location: (1) 6090 Friars Road, San Diego, CA 92108. (2) 1017 Rosecrans St. San Diego, CA 92106.  Learn more about us at our website: https://www.littlehouseofflowerssd.com/  What we are looking for: Little House of Flowers is on the lookout for an energetic and fun individual with a passion for business and an eye for design. This person will be included in all aspects of building a successful business - accounting, business development, lead generation, and all the practical aspects of small business operations. This internship will also provide an opportunity to learn the basics of the floral industry and floral design. Our goals for interns are twofold: to grow as individuals, professionally and personally; and to experience being part of a growing small business celebrating the accomplishments and taking on the challenges - real-life entrepreneur experience.  About the Position: This is a part-time internship (15 hours a week) with flexible times and option to work around existing school schedules. The candidate must have weekend availability. Start date: 8/3/21 - End date: 12/23/21 This internship can be taken for class credit. The individual will be working at both locations.  NOTE* This is an UNPAID INTERNSHIP  Responsibilities: Assist in accounting - revenue, tracking expenses, etc. (QuickBooks experience a plus). Database development. Assist with sales calls and vendor relations. Develop and post content to various social media outlets. Sales and marketing visits to local businesses. Marketing materials development. Assist with floral processing and deliveries. Provide excellent customer service. Community relations. Take care of website updates and maintenance. Assist in floral builds creating bouquets and floral arrangements. Assist in the day-to-day duties involved in running a flower shop.  Desired Skills & Experience: Friendly, honest, reliable with a positive attitude. Interested in business and becoming an entrepreneur.  Ability to work as part of a professional team.  High-energy, self-managing, and self-starter personality.  Strong multi-tasking, organizational, and time management skills. Customer service experience preferred but not required. Effective communication skills and eagerness to learn. Strong organizational skills and the ability to work independently.  Benefits: Gain valuable experience and professional references. Gain knowledge about the entrepreneurial world, including business development, management, marketing strategies and how to achieve competitive advantage and sustainability. Develop your sales skills, work ethic and team spirit. Build your resume or fulfill a class requirement. Get to learn about flowers and plants, including names and proper care for them.

description: Internships at UnitedHealth Group. If you want an intern experience that will dramatically shape your career, consider a company that’s dramatically shaping our entire health care system. UnitedHealth Group internship opportunities will provide a hands-on view of a rapidly evolving, incredibly challenging marketplace of ideas, products and services. You have a lot to learn. We have a lot to do. It’s the perfect storm. And even better? Join us and you may end up staying for a career in which you can do your life’s best work.(sm)  UnitedHealth Group offers a portfolio of products through two distinct platforms; United HealthCare (health benefits) and Optum (health services). At United HealthCare Medicare & Retirement, we serve the fastest growing segment of our nation's population – 50 and older. And we're doing it with an intense amount of dedication. Up for the challenge of a lifetime? Join a team of the best and the brightest to find bold new ways to proactively improve the health and quality of life of our 9 million customers. You'll find a wealth of dynamic opportunities to grow and develop as we work together to strengthen our health care system.  We offer a growth-based culture with extraordinary opportunities and succeed by staying true to our mission to make health care work effectively and efficiently for seniors. This is a full-time internship position and will be available starting June 2022** UnitedHealth Group is not able to offer visa sponsorship now or in the future for this position** Program Features Gain company and industry knowledge Enhance communication and presentation skills Learn and understand different work styles Learn and live our corporate culture and values Access a very comprehensive repository of online self-development tools and resources Primary Responsibilities Participate in a 10-week internship program that includes a comprehensive and structured training curriculum. This will include training on the Medicare business, systems, and sales processes necessary to serve Medicare eligible members and prospects looking for health care coverage. Drive sales/enrollments through effective handling of all telephone inquiries from prospects & members interested in UnitedHealthcare Medicare Solutions, with the intent of enrolling consumers in optimal plan(s)/product(s). Convert inbound calls to sales. Manage outbound calls and special campaign initiatives for assigned region. Conduct needs analysis across diverse consumer population. Sell across multiple product sets. Generate leads to optimal sales channels. Experience to include networking opportunities, basic technical skills training, speaker series, and additional enrichment activities throughout the summer program. You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university during the duration of the internship. Internships are not intended for graduating seniors. Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization (F-1 students with practical training and candidates requiring H-1Bs, TNs, etc. will not be considered) Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance. Preferred Qualifications Rising Senior status during the summer of 2022 Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint Minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 6 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary/hourly range for Colorado residents is $15.00 to $16.01 Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Keywords: sales, intern, internship, CO, Englewood, Colorado, Denver

description: About Zentap  Zentap is a SaaS (Software as a Service) company headquartered in Beverly Hills, CA that specializes in Digital Marketing for the real estate industry. Zentap provides the most effective all-in-one automated marketing solution to ensure real estate professionals stand out in today’s competitive landscape. Through our powerful dashboard, real estate professionals can automate, create, distribute, and advertise branded marketing collateral such as Local Market Reports, Listing Videos, Single Property Websites, Testimonial Videos, and much more. Join the fastest-growing real estate technology company in LA! Led by a Forbes 30-under-30 entrepreneur, Zentap is a disruptive threat to the real estate industry. Zentap is stable enough to build your career but young enough for the right person to come in and be promoted quickly by creating value.  Objective  To manage, support, and launch advertisements for client accounts at Zentap, one of the leading providers of real estate agent marketing services on Facebook & other social platforms. As a member of Zentap’s Account Management team, the ideal candidate will have a bachelor’s degree, and 1+ years of experience in marketing, advertising, communications, and/or social media, particularly Facebook business pages.  As a fast-growing company, we look for self-starters who thrive in a fast-paced environment—which means: wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises. In this role, you work with a collaborative team so excellent interpersonal skills are also a must.  Hours/Compensation  Full-time/ Base salary + quarterly bonus / $30-$32,000 + incentives (upsell/expansion sale bonuses, retention)  Responsibilities: Manage client accounts. Maintain regular contact with clients (real estate agents/brokers) to build relationships, provide support and increase customer retention Manage clients’ Facebook business pages Create, launch, and optimize Facebook advertising campaigns for clients through Facebook’s Ads Manager platform Offer existing clients upsells to advertising packages & long-term subscriptions Provide marketing consulting to agents Assist with task management for clients (ex: posting custom content to pages) Answer client inquiries via phone and email Interface with graphic design team regarding agent design requests (ex: custom cover photos) Design or edit custom graphics for page posts and advertising campaigns (Photoshop/Illustrator) Requirements/Eligibility:  Not all required, but the more the better! Bachelor’s Degree or demonstrated equivalent and related experience Excellent communication skills, verbal, written, and telephonic with the ability to relate to customers Knowledge of Facebook for businesses, including business page creation/management Knowledge of Facebook Business Manager/Ads Manager, or launching ad campaigns through other social platforms Proficiency with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or InDesign Advertising copywriting or blogging experience Must be detail-oriented, able to multi-task, and have good critical thinking skills Capable of handling and staying on tasks with little managerial oversight Prior experience in customer service Prior experience in sales Proficiency with MS Office applications Establishing and maintaining team communication Positive attitude and proactive with a willingness to learn High level of social media literacy Proficient listening skills and desire to interact with people Nice to have – Bilingual (Spanish)  In your cover letter please tell us: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this job? Actual experiences you have that make you a good fit? Powered by JazzHR  AOXZULADd9

We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people; we believe that an inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate people who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.  The Headlines  As a Field Sales Intern you will be part of our Early Talent Program. Our Early Talent Program is Molson Coors’ undergraduate summer internship program, where students are exposed to the beverage industry, engaged in real-world problem-solving, and immersed in social and educational opportunities with other interns. The internship is full-time, beginning in June through August. Housing assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements. Interns who successfully complete the Early Talent Program are eligible for full-time positions within Molson Coors Beverage Company, upon graduation.  The Responsibilities Gain experience within our field sales organization and the opportunity through collaboration with various stakeholders & teams Complete a robust project focused on a sales business need and present findings to senior sales leadership Participate in key sales activities within your assigned team/location Develop knowledge and understanding of the beer industry The Other Qualifications You are entering Senior year and pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or another related field Passion and interest in a career in sales Proficiency in Microsoft Office – including Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, and Teams Strong interpersonal and communication skills High energy team player with strong social skills Drive and a bias for action Must be willing to work occasional non-traditional hours (ie: attend events in evening/weekends) Must be 21 years of age or older at start of internship Work Perks That You Need To Know About Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages! Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. That’s why all offers of employment in the U.S. where legally permitted are contingent on the candidate showing proof of being fully vaccinated against Covid 19 (currently one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine) to pass the pre-employment requirements. Individuals with medical issues or religious beliefs or practices that prevent them from getting the vaccine may request an exemption from the vaccine requirement.  At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. description: About the job  About Storefront A Techstars Alumni, Storefront is the leading online marketplace for short-term retail. We match brands with spaces to power their short-term rental strategies. Everything from pop-ups to product launches and showrooms. Our platform offers over 10,000 listings, which represent more than 30 million square feet of retail space. We offer greater access to spaces in leading retail cities around the world, including New York, Paris, London, Milan, Hong Kong, Amsterdam, Los Angeles and Chicago. Our product and service team remove friction from short-term retail. Since our launch, we have helped thousands of brands all over the world, including Google, Samsung, L’Oréal, Everlane, Shopify, and Indiegogo open temporary retail stores. We’re a passionate team of 25+ with people based in New York, London, Paris, Amsterdam and Hong Kong. Committed to disrupting the way retail is experienced, we believe the nature of retail is changing.  Your Mission The Covid-19 epidemic has had a significant impact on the retail industry. While things may seem bleak for retailers, in reality the crisis will prove to be a catalyst for trends and changes the industry was already seeing. The retail market will see an even greater shift towards ‘flexible retail’ as brands make physical retail more theatrical and less transactional. These brands will need even more companies like Storefront in order to find new locations and reach new audiences.  We are looking to hire a Sales Support Assistant to play a key role in facilitating our customer acquisition and growth objectives. You will be the first point of contact for many inbound leads and help to redirect certain leads to more senior members of the Storefront team. You will work within the Sales team, but also closely with the Customer Success and Supply Team. Your role will be critical in developing and closing sales, shaping the future of the company and expanding the growth of an early stage start-up.  Responsibilities Qualifying inbound leads and building a pipeline of future business. Develop new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails. Collaborate with appropriate team members to determine necessary sales approaches. Ensure follow-up by passing leads to appropriate team members with calls-to-action, dates, complete profile information, requirements, etc. Educate prospective renters/listing owners on Storefront services. Research accounts, brands, identify lead job positions and log information accordingly. Make outbound follow-up calls to existing clients via telephone and email to cross-sell and up-sell. Contact and liaise with landlords of retail spaces. Assist in project management and throughout the complete sales cycle.  Requirements Experience in a sales or business development role. Experience with cold-calling and prospecting.  A passion for brands and retailers and an ability to understand positioning.  An understanding of the commercial real estate market. Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively. High-energy self-starter with a relentless, entrepreneurial work ethic. Competitive, numerate and commercially minded individual with a head for targets. Experience working towards targets and KPIs. Comfortable working remotely (especially in the short term). Experience with Salesforce, Asana, Hubspot or other CRM software is a plus.  Benefits Paid remote internship  Work side-by-side with sales team and get actively involved in the development of an internationally-backed venture company Have the opportunity to directly shape the company’s strategic direction and to shine in your own personal growth Be part of a fast-growing and international startup that changes every single day (We’re not just another digital platform, we are radically changing the face of retail and real estate worldwide). Work in a fun, collaborative, and stimulating environment with new challenges everyday (We’re looking for your personality as well).

Our Future Leaders Programme will ignite the leader in you. This unique programme is designed to develop Unilever’s Future Leaders (UFL) by providing challenging and purposeful opportunities that accelerate their readiness to take on business leadership roles.  Customer Development, or CD, is what we call our Sales organization at Unilever. Customer Development works closely with our customers to pioneer new products, build categories and deploy best-in-class retail and shopper capabilities. The Summer Internship role is the primary pathway to beginning a career in Customer Development at Unilever. The program introduces you to Unilever through a challenging and rewarding experience, which offers you the opportunity to contribute to business goals. As an intern, you are assigned a key business project to own within the Customer Development (Sales) function. At the conclusion of the summer, interns may be asked to present their findings to the CD leadership team. Successful interns could be offered an opportunity to join Unilever as a full time employee after graduation.  Who You Are & What You’ll Do You’re a born leader: You seek fresh opportunities, insisting on innovation and never settling for “good enough.” You take pride in delivering work to the highest standards. You’re a change-maker: You know there is always a way we can improve results and you are committed to helping others see those possibilities. You’re a strategy guru: You love to think outside the box and imagine new possibilities for the business. You are a visionary, creating strategies to drive business growth and inspiring others along the way. You’re a story teller: You use data to drive actionable insights to illustrate problem-solving and land compelling messages. You craft meaningful stories that resonate with a broad and diverse audience. You love to win, and have fun doing it: You believe in taking the lead in the marketplace versus following. You have a positive attitude about the company's future and a passion for winning. In Customer Development, teams are dedicated to one or more key customers (i.e. WalMart, Target, CVS), brands, or product categories. You will have an opportunity to develop proficiency in managing data using both Unilever systems as well as external Customer systems (i.e. Nielsen, AMPS planning tool, Hyperion/Merlin sales reporting systems, etc). These positions involve a high level of customer service and follow up in order to effectively meet the needs of both the internal and external customer base – interaction with multiple touch points internally and externally. What You’ll Need To Succeed Current college Junior level pursuing Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or other. The ideal candidate will need to possess strong leadership competencies, and strong team and analytical skills; strategic thinking skills; initiative and enthusiasm for work in a fast moving, dynamic environment; the ability to communicate effectively, especially as part of a team; ability to be creative; and the ability to understand complex business issues and demonstrate consumer empathy. Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher Ability to relocate and willingness to work at CD office locations across the US Life at Unilever is a lot of fun – just like our application process! Check out what you'll experience when you apply for one of our internships or co-ops: Application - Start by completing our simple online application. You can import your details from your LinkedIn profile to speed up the process. You can only apply to one function, so carefully consider which role you would like to pursue before applying. Assessment - After your application, if you meet the basic requirements, we’ll invite you to participate in a series of fun games that looks at different cognitive, emotional, and social traits. This will help us find the best fit for you and you will receive personalized feedback after completing the games. Digital Interview – Upon successful completion of the assessment, you will be invited to participate in a digital interview where you can solve real-world problems using Unilever scenarios. This will give you insight into our company culture and how we do business. The interview is split into two parts – three short hypothetical questions followed by a business case. You can record and complete your video anytime, anywhere. All you need is a computer or mobile device with access to video recording (usually standard in most devices) and a stable internet connection. Discovery Center – Once the interview is complete, we’ll invite our top matches to our offices in the Greater New York City or Toronto areas (depending on which job you applied for) for a truly immersive experience. You’ll get to experience a number of exciting activities and projects along with your peers, meet our leaders, and receive personalized coaching and feedback. The exercises are designed around a real business case study, enabling us to tap into your potential while giving you further insight into what it’s really like to work at Unilever. Please add careers@unilever.com to your safe senders list, and ensure your mobile phone number is correctly entered in your application. Please check your spam folder if you are expecting communication Unilever is an organisation committed to diversity and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future every day for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual and the talent they can bring. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

description: Are you a student in the Class of 2022-2024 interested in the lucrative field of Corporate Sales or Business Development? If so, read on.  We’re PathMatch. We exist because the outcomes of college graduates over the past 5-10 years have been horrendous. 63% of employers feel that recent college grads are generally unprepared for the workforce because they lack workplace skills and experience built through internships. But the current campus recruiting model makes it so difficult for students to land internships...especially when you don't know what you want to do. There’s a growing skills gap and the only way to close it is to help students understand what companies need so they can prepare. Did you know that in 2019, at the height of the market, 53% of college grads were still unemployed 9 months after graduation? We’re working to change this.  PathMatch is an early career talent marketplace matching students to careers, skills, and companies. We help you, the student, connect with your best-matched career and then make it easy for companies to find you through our searchable video-based Member Profiles. We're disrupting the antiquated campus recruiting model and making it easier for students to gain experience. We're also putting our efforts into creating more opportunities for students to build experience through our own internships.  WHAT YOU GET:  Learn the modern sales processes companies use to grow Build your resume and gain experience so you can land future internships and jobs Develop career-specific skills not taught in college classes Work directly with our CEO and CRO (Chief Revenue Officer) and receive mentoring so you can continue to improve and succeed Learn the tips and tricks we use to help students and grads land top-paying internships and jobs A flexible schedule that allows you to work when you can and get paid an hourly rate ($18/hr) + commission on leads you generate  WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING - You will: Learn sales processes, technologies, and tactics for lead generation Prospect for new business opportunities with great companies and also grow our student user base Identify and analyze opportunities with sales prospects Identify key decisions makers to engage in lead discussions Qualify inbound opportunities based on business needs and platform fit Develop and implement sales and growth strategies  WHAT YOU NEED: Have an interest in working in a sales role in the tech industry Part-time (10+ hours/week) availability Pursuing an undergraduate degree Driven, motivated, hard worker, open to learning  Interested in learning more, apply now. Interviews are taking place immediately.

This is an unpaid internship, with the opportunity to make commission. You can choose from an SDR or AE track to decide which type of commission you'd like to earn. You get access to a weekly SDR class and some hands on training with our CEO & Founder, Megan Killion.  Job Activities: Outbound messaging and calling CRM maintenance Building lists Learning sales and taking action on what's learned

THE ROLE  JBIER Inc. is looking for a Project Management Intern to join our rapidly-growing team. This intern will play an integral role by collaborating with the project management team and founder to optimize JBIER’s overall business operations, utilizing our project tracking system, while meeting strict deadlines. This is an unpaid, remote position.   RESPONSIBILITIES   Data Asset Management: organize and maintain all content on Google Drive, Shared Albums, Slack, and company website. Keep a record of all photographs, marketing content, and business documents. Partner with the founder, project management team, and team lead to manage the overall performance of the business and team through our project tracking system. Analyze current operational systems, processes, and policies in order to pinpoint opportunities to improve. Collaborate with the team to monitor the system daily, weekly, and monthly to ensure the business is running efficiently and optimize accordingly. Assist in creating meeting agendas, taking detailed notes throughout team meetings, and writing in-depth recaps for the team. Partner with the team leads to oversee the accountability document to ensure all members are participating in required business meetings. Oversee all financial responsibilities. Manage materials budgets, expedited schedules, and other variances aligning company financial targets. Analyze business operations to provide insight to maximize profits and increase revenue. Gather financial statement information, including income statements, statements of cash flows, and balance sheets.  Work closely with the founder on independent projects. Manage weekly team schedule, ensuring all high-priority tasks are assigned to hourly slots based on calendar availability document. Manage business emails, personal emails, and calendars.  Download all reports, relevant articles, upcoming webinars, and bring all priority emails to management’s attention. Sign up team members for webinars and online events. Partner with the founder to organize and assign recorded learnings to team members. Partner with the Project Management Team Lead in the delegation of reports, articles, and newsletters to team members appropriately. Manage monthly calendar availability document on Google Sheets, collect all schedules, and hold everyone accountable. Send iCal invites, Zoom links, and scheduling links. Write and publish blog posts for the company website, LinkedIn, and Facebook. Update “In The Know” with emerging trends and include all written blog posts/newsletters that would be of interest to our target audience. Engage in bi-weekly meetings by providing updates on assigned projects/tasks and actively participate in brainstorm sessions by sharing new ideas for campaigns, collections, incentives, sales, and promotions.      REQUIREMENTS  All majors will be considered for this opportunity. Administrative, project management, finance, and analytics experience are highly preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency in Microsoft and Google Suite platforms, especially Excel and Sheets. Highly organized and detail-oriented with a strong sense of accountability. Attend bi-weekly team meetings to discuss overall business operations, as well as progress and performance of projects. Ensure benchmarks are in place and goals are met according to timelines. Complete assigned learnings and achieve proficiency, including webinars and team recordings. Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively in a remote, entrepreneurial environment. Eagerness to lead projects and manage multiple tasks under strict deadlines. Clear and demonstrative understanding of how to manage competing priorities within a business setting. Commitment and passion for JBIER’s mission. A hunger to learn and a LOVE FOR FASHION!   BENEFITS  College credit eligible. Highly-collaborative team. Learning courses and certification opportunities. One-on-one career management mentorship opportunities. Connect and network with fashion and beauty industry professionals. Accelerated experience in the fashion, beauty, and retail industries within a startup setting. Develop a well-rounded understanding of retail, e-commerce, fashion, and project management operations. Opportunity to make an impact! Empowered to take risks, seek creative alternatives, challenge ideas, and solve complex problems. Potential early access to work full-time with JBIER post-graduation.   MISSION & OBJECTIVES  JBIER team members will:  Learn a collaborative approach to solving complex business problems in a fast-paced start-up environment. Develop an understanding of e-commerce platforms and business models. Collaborate with diverse team members to grow e-commerce platforms, such as our company website, Poshmark, Instagram Shops, and Facebook Marketplace. Identify current and emerging trends in fashion, beauty, and retail by reading industry reports, articles, newsletters, press, and publications. Present findings to the team and apply key learnings to the business. Analyze competition and internal performance of sales through data analysis and customer feedback. Utilize social media platforms, such as Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, LinkedIn, and Twitter, to raise brand awareness, boost engagement, increase revenue, and exceed sales goals.   BUSINESS STRUCTURE   Seeing as this is an e-commerce, remote business, we are unable to have in-person team meetings. We hold bi-weekly virtual meetings via Zoom. Management will assign tasks in order of priority and discuss regular business operations. Responsibilities will be delegated based on personal and professional skills. As a team, we brainstorm ideas for campaigns, collections, and specialized projects. Team members are encouraged to bring their ideas to the table. Projects will be completed based on priority; all team members are expected to collaborate on high-priority tasks.   RETAIL AND SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS  Company Website: jbierboutique.com Poshmark: @jbier Instagram : @jbierboutique Facebook: @jbier Pinterest: @jbierboutique Twitter: @jbierboutique  LEARN MORE ABOUT JBIER Inc.  About Us: jbierboutique.com/about-us Celebrate the One Year Anniversary of JBIER: jbierboutique.com/post/one-year-of-jbier Celebrating 60k on Poshmark: jbierboutique.com/post/celebrating-60k-on-poshmark-with-jessica-bierman Get To Know the JBIER Team: jbierboutique.com/post/get-to-know-the-jbier-team

Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around January of 2022 and continue through the entire Spring term and could possibly continue into early Summer 2022 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time, for most internships. Please consider before submitting an application.  International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week. Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.  Internship Program at Tesla  The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team’s success.  Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.  About The Team  The Tesla Energy team is committed, and fast moving. We are a group of engineers that sit at the center of business development, Tesla technology, and the deployment of stationary storage projects on the grid. As a member of our team, you will help to shape the success of our projects in various applications worldwide. You must have a genuine passion for engineering products that will fundamentally change the world’s energy infrastructure and must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.  Be a key technical member of the commercial team that focuses on evaluating and defining new Tesla Energy Storage Product sales opportunities and working to deploy product against them.  What To Expect Build internal analytical and software tools to streamline the sales engineering process to support large volumes of energy projects Work closely with Sales Engineer(s) to complete the financial and preliminary site design for customers Work with the sales team to evaluate new market segments and perform analysis of storage potential Understand regional energy markets and utilities, define, and disseminate functional requirements with internal business and engineering colleagues Participate in on-going proceedings related to tariffs and market mechanisms to inform / update modelling processes. Work with prospective customers to identify best commercial and technical fit of Tesla’s battery systems by creating and defining the business case This is a multi-faceted role where strong software-development skills and knowledge of engineering fundamentals – mechanical, electrical, and thermal – is expected. Besides a rock-solid work ethic and a strong team-oriented personality, members of our team display creativity, passion, and a desire to break new ground in a constantly shifting technology landscape.  Requirements Currently pursuing a BS or MS, in areas of Electrical, Mechanical, Civil, Environmental or Software Engineering or equivalent functional experience Demonstrated experience developing software tools to solve problems Ability to develop software in Python Knowledge of relational databases (SQL preferred) Proficiency in software engineering tools (Git, Atlassian Suite) Ability to document software requirements and specifications Superior knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel, Work, & PowerPoint) Knowledge of battery systems, power conversion, and grid systems Ability to keep track of quickly changing market conditions regarding storage funding, product development, and competitive landscape. Ability to prioritize and execute many tasks in parallel Familiarity with financial analyses Professional fluency in English and the language(s) of the assigned region, additional languages a plus Excellent communication and documentation skills Deep passion for changing the way we use energy on the electric grid Demonstrated experience related to energy markets and utilities Demonstrated experience working on energy solutions for commercial and industrial customers
industries: Automotive, Renewables & Environment, and Utilities

About Capvision:  Capvision is a global primary research platform connecting financial institutions, consulting firms, global enterprises, and high-net-worth individuals with subject matter experts across all industries and regions. Our goal is to provide clients with the necessary tools to gain the right insights for their research objectives. To achieve this, we conduct expert interviews, industry research, business consulting, marketing surveys, and in-person/remote conferences.  About Capvision:  Capvision is one of the fastest growing expert networks in the world, providing primary research and consulting services to some of the largest private equity funds, hedge funds and consulting firms across the globe. Capvision is currently looking for Business Development Interns to assist with their continued rapid expansion into the Americas and EMEA regions.  As an Intern, you will work with the Business Development team to identify, qualify, and build meaningful relationships with clients around the world. Our Business Development team is responsible for identifying Capvision users within new and existing accounts, as well as growing the relationship alongside our research team. This intern will join a growing team that works with some of the largest investment management firms and consultancies in the world, helping to discover our client's business initiatives and acting as the Capvision advocate.  As an Intern, you will gain direct exposure to client outreach, relationship management and strong communication skills.  Who You Are: Hard working and eager to learn in a collaborative environment Interest in financial services and market research Well-organized and detail-oriented Excellent verbal and written communication skills Self-starter, able to work autonomously as well as within a team Strong academic credentials Eligible to work in the US, including F-1 visa holders with Optional Practical Training (OPT) status of 3 years.  Available to work 40 hours per week for 10 weeks between June and August.  Website: www.capvision.com

description: Already an employee? You must apply through our internal portal: click here  Field Sales Intern  Date: Sep 10, 2021  Location:  Chicago, IL, US  Requisition ID: 17861  A Career In Beer  Our purpose at the Molson Coors Beverage Company is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people; we believe that an inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate people who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.  The Headlines  As a Field Sales Intern you will be part of our Early Talent Program. Our Early Talent Program is Molson Coors’ undergraduate summer internship program, where students are exposed to the beverage industry, engaged in real-world problem-solving, and immersed in social and educational opportunities with other interns. The internship is full-time, beginning in June through August. Housing assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements. Interns who successfully complete the Early Talent Program are eligible for full-time positions within Molson Coors Beverage Company, upon graduation.  The Responsibilities Gain experience within our field sales organization and the opportunity through collaboration with various stakeholders & teams Complete a robust project focused on a sales business need and present findings to senior sales leadership Participate in key sales activities within your assigned team/location Develop knowledge and understanding of the beer industry The Other Qualifications You are entering Senior year and pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or another related field Passion and interest in a career in sales Proficiency in Microsoft Office – including Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, and Teams Strong interpersonal and communication skills High energy team player with strong social skills Drive and a bias for action Must be willing to work occasional non-traditional hours (ie: attend events in evening/weekends) Must be 21 years of age or older at start of internship Work Perks That You Need To Know About Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages! Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. That’s why all offers of employment in the U.S. where legally permitted are contingent on the candidate showing proof of being fully vaccinated against Covid 19 (currently one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine) to pass the pre-employment requirements. Individuals with medical issues or religious beliefs or practices that prevent them from getting the vaccine may request an exemption from the vaccine requirement.  At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.  Nearest Major Market: Chicago

description: Curious about a career in sales and marketing? Aflac could be a perfect spot for you! The Aflac Jr Duck Program is unlike any other internship.
