Tom James Company - Internship Opportunity  POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Internship is 20+ hours and will be completed on Tuesday/Thursday with choice of 7:30 am – 11:30 am CST or 12:30 pm – 4:30 pm CST. Additional hours are set based on Intern and office availability. *This internship can start in any month of the year and lasts 8 weeks. Internship is $15/hour plus Commission Candidate must be graduating by December 2022 and live, or have housing, in the area of the internship and desire a career in sales in that location upon graduation. Candidate must be eligible to work in the US and not require sponsorship Visa status now or in the future.  OUR OPPORTUNITY:  The goal of the Internship program is to provide you with a real life glimpse into our full-time role of a Sales Professional and also to enable you to eventually complete the Tom James sales cycle process with a prospect from initial interaction through final delivery.  The primary areas of focus for our internships will be: No previous industry knowledge is required; just a desire to sell and succeed Prospect clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including Zoom Info & LinkedIn Sales Navigator to find and reach out to potential clients Direct/Indirect Referral Concepts: generate referrals through current and potential clients to create warmer leads Phone Skills & Dials: 50+ dials/week, with a goal to set around 5 appointments/week Access to Technology including a Chromebook, prospecting platforms, communication platforms, and CRM Independently develop clientele: build your clientele throughout the summer, with those prospected being returned to you, providing you return as a full-time hire. Field knowledge: follow your mentor as they go on appointments, measure clients, and prospect directly in the field. Work with your mentor to sell people whom you've prospected and set appointments with.  TRAINING:  Your first week is virtual, classroom training in the store that you were hired in. Additional training will continue on Tuesday and Thursdays throughout the remaining 7 weeks.  TOM JAMES:  Tom James Company has more than 50 years of direct selling expertise in the custom clothing industry. We have grown from a single store to stores throughout 4 continents and more than $500 million in sales.  Our sales force consists of highly motivated, service and sales minded professionals that strive for growth and leadership. By finding and developing long-term, loyal customers, our people build lifestyles to support their personal and professional goals. Our customers are highly successful, busy professionals who demand convenience, quality and excellent service in which we deliver to them.  We provide the training, opportunity and product to build a significant income through sales and leadership while establishing a strong net worth through our employee ownership and 401(k)/profit sharing programs.  We are vertically integrated which allows our Sales Professionals opportunities to grow their net worth and expand their careers.  Powered by JazzHR  pk5t2zkuyU

description: About the Job  Do you want to wake up every morning knowing your work is making a difference in people’s lives?  We do too.    At Stage, we’re on a mission to help women with breast cancer feel stylish, supported and confident during treatment so they can focus on what matters most - healing.  Our marketplace is filled with fashion, beauty and wellness products curated for each step in her journey.  We are a destination for information, real talk, uplifting stories and treatment/recovery tips, brought to you by women who’ve been there. We give back with every purchase, because paying it forward feels good.  Position Description  We’re on the hunt for a merchandising intern to help support the team with our assortment for launch. The ideal candidate will have an interest in merchandising and a desire to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment.   This individual will support the assistant merchant and founder with assortment strategies, vendor coordination, site merchandising and sales event coordination. The ideal candidate will be located in NYC with the ability to work remotely.  This role requires 10-15 hours per week.  Job Duties:  Account Management. Manage vendor onboarding in regards to vendor agreements and integration. Own vendor communication regarding assets, product details, delivery dates and samples.   Site Merchandising. Assist in the assortment of products to relevant categories, themes, and features. Leverage analytics tools to analyze customer browse behavior to inform strategies and testing to optimize conversion. Monitor collection pages regularly for sold out products and to ensure minimum presentation standards are met. Product Strategy. Assist with pricing and analysis for all categories (fashion, home, beauty, wellness). Track competition to assess new brand and product opportunities. Cross functional collaboration. Coordinate with operations/logistics/marketing to ensure successful launch execution. Trouble shoots issues as they arise.   Requirements:  College Junior or Senior standing preferred- ideally with an interest in fashion merchandising and buying  Self-starter, highly organized, and detailed oriented. Possesses great people skills and works with a sense of urgency Enjoys keeping up with fashion and beauty trends; passionate about health, wellness and paying it forward Enjoys problem solving and building new processes Thrives in fast paced environments and is flexible to changes in priorities as needed to drive the business forward Collaborates well with others and gives/receives feedback with grace Responsible and accountable to the team and for the work Familiarity with Shopify is a plus.

description: Westway Promotions is searching for a talented individual to fill the entry-level Business Development and Sales Associate role in our branch office as part of our Business Development team. Through extensive hands-on training, personal mentorship, and professional growth opportunities, we develop our entry-level Business Development and Sales Associates through our account management training program.  Once trained thoroughly as a Business Development and Sales Associate, you will have the opportunity to oversee new account managers and you will coach and lead a team of customer service and sales representatives to achieve sales goals and maintain our exceptional customer service standards. Those objectives are met by conducting team meetings and one-on-one coaching sessions. While working with your team, you will also evaluate and determine if delegation for the Account Managers is acceptable based on their learning abilities. By utilizing underwriting guidelines, you are empowered to make the appropriate decision as to which tasks the team can take on at their level.  What you’ll get out of this opportunity: Learn strategic business development and sales tactics through our daily meetings and how to effectively manage an account Effectively present the value of our clients’ renowned products and services to prospective clients. Partner with your Business Development Manager on how to create customized plans to support sales cycles and drive urgency for our clients’ products Execute skilled collection of business intelligence on companies, leads, and qualified potential customers. Develop, execute, achieve, and maintain sales initiatives/goals based on senior management feedback, territory performance, and organizational goals Collaborate with the operations team and customers to evaluate account performance, identify refinements and improvements and implement solutions Track and report to senior management on a frequent basis the status of all leads, proposals, pipeline performance, and negotiations  What you’ll need: A Bachelor’s degree (all majors welcome) is preferred, hands-on experience will also be considered The ability to thrive in a competitive environment alongside our other Account Managers Relevant work or internship experience in business development, sales or account management Unmatched ability to establish credibility with senior-level executives Advanced computer and internet search skills is an asset within our firm Varsity-level communication, writing, problem-solving, and time management skills  Why you’ll want it:  Our firm offers a clear career path for advancement highlighting a unique training curriculum specifically designed to foster a long-term career in our field. All team members enjoy competitive compensation, regular bonus opportunities, paid travel opportunities, and positive company culture.  Powered by JazzHR  80arNneT0d

description: PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play —it’s also the Best Place to Work. We’ve thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original PlayStation. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.  This internship is for Summer 2022.  Associate Strategy Manager Intern  San Mateo, CA  Sony Interactive Entertainment (SIE) seeks a highly qualified candidate for the position of Associate Strategy Manager Intern. Global Sales & Business Operations (GSBO) is the Sales & Operations division of SIE. The GSBO Strategy team resides within GSBO and is tasked with planning and directing strategic business initiatives within the organization based on the priorities of the organization's leader.  This is an exciting and challenging role! Our ideal candidate is expected to bring research and analytics, strategic problem solving, and strong communication skills. A strong interest in business planning, analysis, and modeling is required.  Responsibilities Generating complex analyses and scenario planning for executive recommendation and decision-making Evaluating new business models, as well as making recommendations on how to optimize existing business opportunities Generating, synthesizing and analyzing relevant research reports to inform mid and long-term strategy Partnering with internal & external stakeholders to identify business opportunities and inform long-term strategy Supporting strategic initiatives with rigorous data analysis Analyzing and interpreting large business intelligence data sets to discover key insights to drive business objectives Generating ad-hoc internal analysis and Power Point presentations, optimizing for salient information and flow Assisting in research of overall industry trends and qualitative/quantitative competitive analysis Required Experiences/Skills Experience performing research and data analysis to develop business strategy and plans Strong interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication skills Strong work ethic and ability to work under pressure to meet fixed deadlines Ability to multi-task, manage multiple projects at one time, and rapidly change priorities based on business needs Proactive, able to self-start, pitch and manage relevant projects with minimal supervision Video game industry knowledge Expert proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Functional proficiency with database driven analytics & visualization tools and techniques (e.g. SQL, Tableau, R, PowerBI, MicroStrategy) Additional Preferred Experiences/Skills 2-4 years+ of strategic planning, management consulting, or investment banking experience Passion for video games Knowledge of video game technologies & trends Knowledge of cloud computing & networking technologies for consumer services Experience in customer journey analysis & customer lifetime value analysis Tech, gaming or related industry experience Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, covered veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category. description: HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE  Your role as a Sales Analyst Intern would involve collecting and aggregating sales data from various external reports and analyzing the data over time. You would also be responsible for identifying and implementing the best-in-class data architecture system for future consolidation and analysis. Collecting, analyzing, and aggregating financial data Reporting financial data to team in an easily accessible format Assessing organizational needs and taking actionable steps to improve processes – including working with 3rd parties to identify and implement the best-in-class data architecture system for future use. description: Wyndsor Associates Inc., a brand development, sales, and promotional firm based in New York, has recently made plans to expand its entry-level team. We have openings for multiple outgoing, career motivated individuals to fill our Marketing Internship IMMEDIATELY.   Here at Wyndsor Associates Inc, our company holds four key values: Team Identity and Camaraderie: “Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence win championships.” -Michael Jordan Accountability and Responsibility: The ability to always be accountable for your own actions no matter how challenging it may be, shows the integrity of a true leader. Innovation and Feedback Loop: Innovation does not require some exotic new technology. It requires an innovative culture – one that is embraced by the people at the top and flows through the whole organization. By utilizing innovation with the input of our customers and our employees, we are able to create a better workplace and better results. Listen and Guide: People don’t care how much you know until they know how much you care. Listen to your teammates, clients, customers, and then your guidance and feedback will qualify.  We Are: Startup Incubator/Accelerators Branding/Marketing Agency that works with cutting-edge brands in the national and international market Extensively connected in the industry Startup/Marketing strategic consultants You Are: Entrepreneurial A face-to-face kind of communicator Love the startup world more than ANYTHING Positive attitude, willing to soak up knowledge about startups Can take constructive criticism and feedback Willing to work hard to achieve goals and deadlines Collaborative and a people person Organized, disciplined, and have a sense of humor!  Why Work with Us? We will help you build your startup (from scratch to market) Work directly with one of the Managing Partners You'll work with real clients and solve real problems If you are a great fit, we will offer you a full-time job You will learn more than you ever have in a real startup/startup incubator environment After the internship, you will have the knowledge to start, build, and sell your startup. jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our Co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), Co-chairman Erik Anderson (Chairman of Top Golf and Founder of West River Group), Board Member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisors Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay) and Scott Maw (CFO of Starbucks), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice Founder and Felicis Ventures), Mike Repole (Founder of Vitamin Water and Body Armor) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and Founders Fund), and other fun athletes and musicians including John Elway, Aaron Rodgers, Larry Fitzgerald, Nas, Charles Kelley (Lady Antebellum), Leann Rimes and Darius Rucker amongst many others.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits Paid vacation and holidays Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  Zxjm1bW3Qv

description: Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI) is advancing the world’s technology. As a leader in Memory, System, LSI and LCD technologies, our US teams contribute to breakthroughs in 5G, SOC, memory and display. With our global perspective and diversity of thought, we proudly serve our customers around the world. We are looking for team members who share our commitment to learning and growth and excel when collaborating within and across teams.  SSI is headquartered in the heart of Silicon Valley and is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. - the #1 employer in the world (Forbes, Oct 2020) and top patent-holder in the U.S. Want to advance the world’s technology with us?  JOB TITLE/REQ ID/LOCATION:  Title: Business Process Intern  Req ID: 40395  Location: San Jose, CA  Inside This Business Group  Summer 2021 internship applications are open September 2020. Samsung Semiconductor summer internships start in May/June 2021.  Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development. You’ll work with the teams that create new computing system architectures needed to support emerging machine learning applications, internet of things (IoT) and edge computing that benefit millions of users. This program will give you the opportunity work on complex solutions to that address some of the world’s most complex technological challenges.  Overview & Impact  Based in San Jose, California, Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. (SSI) is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, Ltd. and a world leader in Memory, System LSI and LCD technologies. We provide the widest range of memory, logic, storage devices, LED components and LCD/OLED panels to enhance the user experience in home entertainment, mobile devices, lighting and computing. SSI has advanced R&D labs focused on product design and research in memory, displays, logic, image sensors, and mobile technologies.  Job Responsibilities This position is with the Samsung Foundry group and will report to the Marketing group. The role will focus on documenting / developing the business processes and tool flows used by marketing and sales managers for marketing planning, promotion, customer engagement and long-term revenue and design award planning. This requires working with marketing and sales managers to identify and document existing processes, improve and refine existing processes, and define and add new processes that are needed to support marketing operations. Additional tasks include development of report templates, development of routines/macros/applications and updating databases to provide reports required. Qualifications & Required Skills Currently pursuing MBA This role would be applicable to Business and Marketing Management students. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Powerpoint, Excel). Knowledge of Salesforce.Com and Wrike project management tools would be beneficial. Additionally, we look for the following universal qualities in all candidates: Resourceful Achiever: self-motivated and proactive, you flex to try new approaches and creatively solve problems Avid Learner: you thrive with challenges, seek continuous growth and improvement, and seek data to prove your hypotheses Devoted Professional: you are diligent and deliberate in your work, leveraging your expertise to deliver results without ego Thoughtful Collaborator: you build relationships across teams, offering help and welcoming ideas from others to drive work forward in an inclusive manner Prefered Skills Technical/engineering focus Proficiency in Korean language Samsung Semiconductor Inc (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.- one of the largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays. SSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is SSI’s policy to comply with all applicable national, state and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity, and hiring decisions are made accordingly.  Learn more about Samsung Semiconductor here.  A day in the life Samsung Video  Samsung Semiconductor Career Page

Role Responsibilities: Receive pre-determined groups of prospects back from sales for further nurturing using both the telephone and email Process and qualify all inbound leads Educate the patient about the patient journey and next steps, including guidance on the company’s product and it’s components Provide accurate weekly forecasts on the volume of opportunities created Track and manage prospecting, qualification and nurture activities in Salesforce  Role KPIs: Number of appointments set Patients converted to initial evaluation from leads  Role Requirements: Bachelor’s degree preferred 6+ months job or internship experience in sales, patient facing, healthcare, or insurance industry experience desired; willing to train Comfortable making a high volume of calls on a daily basis Salesforce Experience preferred This person will be expected to work from our Brookline, MA office  Preferred Competencies: Strong verbal and written communication Active listening to assess prospect needs and opportunities Ability to articulate a reasonable premise for every call Ability to perform prospect and account research to prepare for calls; uses social media tools to monitor targeted accounts and identify trigger events for follow up Ability to interpret data to personalize outbound communications Discipline to maintain high call volumes (~40 or more outbound calls per day) Natural curiosity to interface with others and ask questions; not easily intimidated by lack of knowledge or the seniority of the prospect Exhibits empathy for other's problems and challenges Competitive and motivated; self-starter who takes initiative to achieve goals Team player who is coachable and has an eagerness to learn  Powered by JazzHR  8rl4YSg6UT

description: Position Summary  The intense 16-week rotational training program prepares you to become a contributing member of the Merchandising department. From day one you’ll have an immediate impact on our assortment that reaches 1,200+ stores nationwide. The Assistant Merchant Training Program is a combination of classroom training, field experience, cross functional and executive exposure, and working on the job.  Role Of An Assistant Merchant In The Training Program  When you join AEO in the Assistant Merchant Training Program, you will immediately begin influencing a three billion dollar business. By collaborating with your cross-functional partners in Pittsburgh, PA and New York, NY, you will help to move product development and create an assortment that affects millions of customers. You will also assist in trend forecasting, competitive shopping, and sales analysis. In this position, it’s not only important to have a creative understanding of trends and how to analyze them for the AEO, Inc. customer, but you must also have the ability to make sound, informed decisions in order to support those trends and the business at large.  Training Overview Trainees will have the opportunity to work within a Merchandising department of one specific brand/product category “On-the-Job” training with assignments guided by an individual Coach & Mentor Classroom learning that includes: retail math, reports, systems training, imports, department overviews, career path, presentation skills, trend/competitive shopping and product development Individual and group projects incorporating both product and financials Roundtables with top executives Bi Weekly self evaluations to understand progress throughout program Opportunity of being placed into an open Assistant Merchant role within any Merchandising team upon completion of the program Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Fashion Merchandising, Marketing, Business or equivalent Minimum 3.0 GPA required Passion for retail and knowledge of the AEO, Inc. family of brands Understanding of trends and how they relate to the AE/aerie customer Contemporary sense of fashion exhibited through personal taste Strong business acumen through classes, internships or prior work experience Ability to think strategically coupled with strong analytical skills Strong organizational, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, and presentation skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, specifically Excel, Outlook & Internet applications AEO, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Primary Location  United States-Pennsylvania-PITTSBURGH  Work Locations  77 Hot Metal  Job  Merchandising  Shift  Standard  Job Type  Full-time  Job Level  Day Job  Job Posting  Aug 26, 2021, 7:26:42 PM

description: Already an employee? You must apply through our internal portal: click here  Commercial Sales Intern  Date: Sep 14, 2021  Location:  Denver, CO, US  Requisition ID: 18033  A Career In Beer  Our purpose at the Molson Coors Beverage Company is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people; we believe that an inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate people who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.  The Headlines  As a Commercial Sales or Marketing Intern you will be part of our Early Talent Program. Our Early Talent Program is Molson Coors’ undergraduate summer internship program, where students are exposed to the beverage industry, engaged in real-world problem-solving, and immersed in social and educational opportunities with other interns. The internship is full-time, beginning in June through August. Housing assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements. Interns who successfully complete the Early Talent Program are eligible for full-time positions within Molson Coors Beverage Company, upon graduation.  The Responsibilities  You will develop skills and competency in the commercial function, to include Sales, Merchandising, Marketing and Category Management and build Distributor capabilities, expertise and knowledge to build bench strength for the full time Sales Management Program (SMP) at Molson Coors. The internship will be comprised of a curriculum that includes various introductory lessons to build expertise in the beer industry and distributor environment, hands on learning, classroom educational learning and other developmental opportunities.  The Other Qualifications You are a rising senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Sales or Marketing Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Teams Excellent written and verbal communication skills Work Perks That You Need To Know About Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages! Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. That’s why all offers of employment in the U.S. where legally permitted are contingent on the candidate showing proof of being fully vaccinated against Covid 19 (currently one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine) to pass the pre-employment requirements. Individuals with medical issues or religious beliefs or practices that prevent them from getting the vaccine may request an exemption from the vaccine requirement.  Job Posting Salary Range: $17.50 – $21.50  Job Posting Salary Range  At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.  Nearest Major Market: Denver

If you’re outgoing, determined and ready to take control of your future, a sales internship with Aflac could be the start of something big. Qualifications: • Full-time student in a related field of study with a preferred GPA of 2.5 or above. • Willingness to obtain a life and health insurance license; study resources provided. • Must be at least 18 years old and authorized to work in the United States without need of current or future employer-sponsored work authorization. Isn’t it time to get to know Aflac? Apply today to create your future, your way.  1Aflac sales interns are independent agents and are not Aflac employees. description: Full Job Description Remote (Part-Time Position) American-APN is the first professional “group practice without walls” that brings highly qualified nurse practitioners to those in need of health care under a collaborative care system that uses cutting-edge digital technologies. American-APN was created for and by Advanced Practice Nurses and Nurse Practitioners. It is owned and operated exclusively by its nurse practitioner membership with its own executive leadership and Board of Directors. Members of the network enjoy extensive economic, professional, and personal benefits due to the collaborative care opportunities and economies of scale that American-APN provides. For further information please visit: https://www.americanapn.com  Requirements Passionate about marketing Make calls, emails, and social media messages to prospects generated by variety of outside sources Drive attendance for virtual group presentations and demos, set meetings for conferences when applicable Set Discovery call or support deep dive/demos for the sales team when a lead reaches a qualified stage Executes a Discovery call to share American-APN’s value proposition, ask standardized questions, and secure a demo meeting or group presentation Collaborate with sales and marketing team members on strategic sales approach Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to learn new concepts quickly Must be proactive and self-motivated  Experience ·       Marketing and/or Sales experience is required to apply. Some digital marketing experience is preferred. Applicants who have a portfolio will be considered first. jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our Co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), Co-chairman Erik Anderson (Chairman of Top Golf and Founder of West River Group), Board Member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisors Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay) and Scott Maw (CFO of Starbucks), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice Founder and Felicis Ventures), Mike Repole (Founder of Vitamin Water and Body Armor) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and Founders Fund), and other fun athletes and musicians including John Elway, Aaron Rodgers, Larry Fitzgerald, Nas, Charles Kelley (Lady Antebellum), Leann Rimes and Darius Rucker amongst many others.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits Paid vacation and holidays Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  zhhjzxx8Ki

description: Already an employee? You must apply through our internal portal: click here  Field Sales Intern  Date: Sep 10, 2021  Location:  Irvine, CA, US  Requisition ID: 17858  A Career In Beer  Our purpose at the Molson Coors Beverage Company is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people; we believe that an inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate people who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.  The Headlines  As a Field Sales Intern you will be part of our Early Talent Program. Our Early Talent Program is Molson Coors’ undergraduate summer internship program, where students are exposed to the beverage industry, engaged in real-world problem-solving, and immersed in social and educational opportunities with other interns. The internship is full-time, beginning in June through August. Housing assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements. Interns who successfully complete the Early Talent Program are eligible for full-time positions within Molson Coors Beverage Company, upon graduation.  The Responsibilities Gain experience within our field sales organization and the opportunity through collaboration with various stakeholders & teams Complete a robust project focused on a sales business need and present findings to senior sales leadership Participate in key sales activities within your assigned team/location Develop knowledge and understanding of the beer industry The Other Qualifications You are entering Senior year and pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or another related field Passion and interest in a career in sales Proficiency in Microsoft Office – including Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, and Teams Strong interpersonal and communication skills High energy team player with strong social skills Drive and a bias for action Must be willing to work occasional non-traditional hours (ie: attend events in evening/weekends) Must be 21 years of age or older at start of internship Work Perks That You Need To Know About Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages! Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. That’s why all offers of employment in the U.S. where legally permitted are contingent on the candidate showing proof of being fully vaccinated against Covid 19 (currently one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine) to pass the pre-employment requirements. Individuals with medical issues or religious beliefs or practices that prevent them from getting the vaccine may request an exemption from the vaccine requirement.  At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.  Nearest Major Market: Irvine California  Nearest Secondary Market: Los Angeles
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Did you know that 40% of Fortune 500 CEOs had a sales background? Are you interested in starting a modern career where you will learn relevant skills to help you increase your career and earning potential?  LaunchSource is the leading hiring platform supporting a new, diverse generation of talent to break into one of the most sought-after roles at tech startups, changing the way early-career professionals start their careers in tech at some of the hottest tech startups in cities like Boston and New York City.  We have partnered with some of the most innovative, high-growth companies that offer incredible potential for advancement so we can provide you, recent college graduates, entry-level and early career candidates with the training and opportunities you need to really showcase who you are and why hiring managers should want to hire and work with you.  We focus on providing you, the opportunity to gain experience, interview preparation, career development, and access to our partners, high-growth tech companies that are modernizing their sales teams all at no cost to you.  Our process puts qualified applicants in front of the people that matter: sales managers and executives that are ready to bring you onto their teams in the next 30 days.  Responsibilities and Duties Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation for account executives and sales managers Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve a monthly quota of qualified opportunities Research and identify new business opportunities Call prospective clients in order to identify qualified decision-makers & generate awareness Build an effective pipeline, and schedule meetings for Account Executives Navigate company structures to get past gatekeepers and influence decision-makers Conduct research on prospective clients and maintain a database of business opportunities Communicate with potential customers via email and phone to effectively identify their business needs Do potentially 50+ outbound dials per day Follow-up on inbound inquiries via phone and email Adhere to company best practices. Perform all other duties as needed. Qualifications, Requirements, and Skills Bachelor’s degree Looking to begin a new job within the next 30 days Desire to work in sales and build a career in sales Persistent with overcoming obstacles and approaching challenges Intellectually curious with a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit Ability to learn and absorb new products quickly and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demand Excellent critical thinking, listening organizational, oral, problem-solving, and written communication skills Must be able to commute to New York City or be willing to relocate to New York City if you are not already based there Must be able to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship Job Type: Full-Time  Salary: Base Salary + Commission/On-Target Earnings (OTE)  Base Salary: $40,000-$55,000+  Commission/On-Target Earnings (OTE): $10,000-$25,000  Here at LaunchSource, we don't just accept our differences — we celebrate them, we support them and we thrive on them for the benefit of our candidates, clients, and our community. LaunchSource and its clients are proud equal opportunity employers.  LaunchSource provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  By applying to this job, contingent on my acceptance to the LaunchSource process and platform, I consent to have my personal information, including my resume and other materials that I provide to LaunchSource or grant permission for LaunchSource to use, displayed to and accessed by LaunchSource's clients via the LaunchSource platform or other means of communication.

description: Who we are At trufyx, we're building the Uber of phone repair. Instead of spending 3-6 (or days) going back and forth to the shop to repair your phone, we send a licensed technician to your home and fix your phone within 15-20 minutes. Our solution aims to help both consumers and technicians by bringing local talent available anywhere, anytime, using software. With a growing list of happy customers and the final steps of our pre-seed round, this is the perfect timing for the right candidate to join and get the experience of a real-world startup. We are looking for a high-performing, ambitious individual to help us scale across the US! This is an unpaid internship for 3-6 months.  WHAT WILL YOU DO? As a business developer, you'll be in charge of our future and how fast it will become our present. We offer terms of 3 months or 6 months, where you'll be able to gain experience and own projects. You will be working closely with the CEO and Head of Content to facilitate partnerships and acquire customers using the latest digital marketing strategies.  Responsibilities: Create connections and start conversations with prominent players in different verticals. Own relationships and growth plans with large business partners. Assist the marketing team with planning & execution. Work closely with key stakeholders and founders. Bring your voice and point of view to the table - not just about marketing initiatives.  Why join us: We're remote-first and intend on staying remote. It's not a "space"; it's a mindset. We're young and moving fast. We're growing and scaling. We believe in hiring from within - as we grow, you'll be offered to grow with us too. We're excited about trying and failing. We love it when our team members take initiative and lead ideas.  What it takes to perform: You're passionate about sales, relationships, and communicating with people in general. You're a hustler, a self-starter, and full of ambition. You have excellent written & verbal communication skills. You have decent+ Excel skills & know the basics of Google Suite apps. Minimum 1 year completed course work within Business, Marketing, Communications, or a similar program.  Skills you'll be able to shape on this job: Working with a CRM Marketing automation tools Market research Presentation & demo Content marketing & strategy Project management

description: The Compliance Risk & Diligence team is looking for a Latin America Business Development Intern that will work directly with the Head of Business Development for Latin America, Kroll Compliance Risk & Diligence (“CR&D”) remotely out of Miami, FL, Houston, TX, Washington DC, or Atlanta, GA. They will be performing entry-level duties in the sales and business development fields. The successful candidate will work as part of a team while earning valuable career experience and learning job skills. They will be an effective team player and contribute to our business development program performing and assisting with the following duties:  * Working within our CRM system to update and maintain data  * Prospecting to include creating email campaigns, cold calling and appointment setting  * Develop research analysis techniques to determine customer prospects where Kroll CR&D can meet specific business needs; contact prospects and targeted on learning how to qualify opportunities and identify client needs  * Assist with editing proposals and formatting documents  * Develop research analysis techniques to determine customer prospects where Kroll CR&D can meet specific business needs; contact prospects and determine the business needs and decision makers to penetrate new business relationships  * Maintain a current understanding of competitors’ offerings and effectively sell the advantages of Kroll CR&D offerings over those offered by competitors  QUALIFICATIONS:  Candidate will demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills with a requirement for bilingual language skills (Portuguese and / or Spanish) Currently pursuing undergraduate or graduate degree at an accredited university majoring in BS/BA or equivalent in Business or Marketing or relevant commercial experience Minimum Major GPA of 3.0 They will be well-organized, have excellent analytical skills and demonstrate an understanding of audience needs Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Knowledge of Salesforce or CRM systems (plus) Enthusiasm, passion and a commitment to mutually successful outcomes for the client and Kroll are a must Candidate will have the ability to multitask and prioritize For the Fall internship, availability to work a minimum of 20 hours per week, on a consistent basis is required Excellent written and verbal communication skills that help represent diverse communities Experience working with diverse teams  In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com. Kroll is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.  To apply: https://careers.kroll.com/job/reston/intern-compliance-risk-and-diligence/25499/12042653184

desktop research, networking internally and externally or any other means of initiating interest  Pinpoint business opportunities and maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions  jobTitle: Distribution, Sales, & Strategy Internships - Summer 2022 (Multiple Locations)
description: ViacomCBS (NASDAQ: VIAC; VIACA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.  In the ViacomCBS Summer Internship Program, interns will be working in a vibrant and inclusive environment alongside employees from different backgrounds. Through our in-depth offerings, interns gain exposure across our business while making significant connections for their future and accessing exciting career opportunities. In addition to hands-on experience our programs include networking, mentorship, resume workshops, speaker sessions, career development, visibility to top industry executives, and much more.  Our summer internship opportunities include (but are not limited to) the below. Interested candidates should submit their application no later than Friday, December 31st. If you’re selected for an interview, you’ll be notified by a member of the recruiting team. ViacomCBS Domestic Ad Sales is a leading innovative advertising organization that delivers the advertising revenue across all U.S. ViacomCBS media brands using cutting-edge research, data, partner marketing, and sales strategy approaches. Business Development & Strategy identifies growth opportunities and reaches out to new businesses, with the goal of driving new and incremental revenue across ViacomCBS networks. These teams handle all prospecting, strategic ideation and planning, as well as execution of all marketing programs for new clients. U.S. Networks Distribution is responsible for negotiating distribution deals with new and existing cable operators and digital and wireless distributors to bring ViacomCBS television programming to your TV, computer and mobile devices. USND employees are brand representatives to ViacomCBS’s portfolio of more than 20 industry leading television networks including Nickelodeon, CBS and Showtime. These teams maintain distributor relationships, maximize revenue and identify opportunities with our partners to ensure fans can discover and engage with ViacomCBS content. ViacomCBS is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) including disability/vet.  At ViacomCBS, the spirit of inclusion feeds into everything that we do, on-screen and off. From the programming and movies we create to employee benefits/programs and social impact outreach initiatives, we believe that opportunity, access, resources and rewards should be available to and for the benefit of all. ViacomCBS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, and Veteran status.  If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access. https://www.viacomcbs.com/careers as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by calling 212.846.5500 or by sending an email to viacomaccommodations@viacom.com. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned.

description: Job Title: Intern - Music Marketing  Job Description: Bancs Music & Media's cutting-edge label & music production house specializes in artist production, branding, music licensing, and commercials. We are a one-stop shop with a catalog that encompasses everything from pop, folk, hip-hop, trap, rock, top 40 and epic new-age, cinematic orchestral tunes. Some of our current and past clients/collaborators include Lil' Wayne, Britney Spears, Justin Bieber, Nipsey Hussel, Matisyahu, and Christina Milian.  This is a rare opportunity to take part in all aspects of the industry from A to Z. This internship is perfect for anyone interested in music, film, sales, PR, graphic design, and marketing.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  - Manage PR/Social Media projects  - Build and execute social media strategy through competitive research, platform determination, benchmarking, messaging and audience identification  - Generate, edit, publish and share daily content (original text, images, video etc.).  - Oversee content production (adverts, videos, social media, and online PR stunts)  - Devise marketing/PR strategies (content, etc.)  - Write press releases  - Write reports on media coverage data  - Set up and optimize company pages within each platform to increase the visibility of company's social content  - Serve as liaison between artists, sync managers, and clients  - Manage and maintain client relationships  Experience in the entertainment industry is a plus.  --------  Minimum Requirements:  * Currently pursuing college degree --- music-related field a plus but not necessary  * Sales/Marketing focus  * At least 6 months of work experience  * Desire to learn and highly motivated to succeed  * Team-player attitude (No drama)  Salary: This is an unpaid internship, selected applicants will have unique opportunities for growth within the music and marketing industries as well as various opportunities to earn bonuses.  Contact us: Please send email and cover letter outlining why you are a good fit for this job. info@bancsmedia.com @bancsmedia

MindPower is looking for a digital business development intern for the 2021-2022 school year. MindPower is a 501(c)(3) public charity with the mission to educate, raise awareness and provide support to students and student - athlete mental health. Job Description  Harley Capital LLC is a branch of National Securities Corp., one of the largest independent broker-dealers in the U.S. Our team is in Midtown Manhattan and is currently seeking highly motivated individuals who want to build their personal wealth alongside industry veterans and our experienced team.  Daily Tasks and Goals Generate prospective leads through networking, cold-calling, and other methods Establish and develop relationships with potential clients Learn from experienced brokers the art of sales, stock analysis, & alternative investment fundamentals Recommendation of financial products to clients upon becoming fully licensed  Requirements College degree from a 4-year institution with an applicable major A true desire to earn money and work inside an entrepreneurial business culture Team player, confident, and self-motivated Excellent communication skills and outgoing personality  At Harley Capital, we consider long-term, one-on-one training to be one of our key competitive advantages. We are committed to helping you grow, make money, and launch your own business within three years. We will sponsor you for your series 7 and 63 classes.   About National Securities Corporation: Established in 1947, National Securities Corporation is one of the nation’s largest independent broker-dealers and along with its affiliates, offers retail and institutional advisory, investment, insurance and tax planning services. The firm has corporate offices in New York, New Jersey, Seattle, Boca Raton, and Dallas, giving us a wide footprint across the U.S. National Securities Corporation is a member of FINRA/SIPC.

About AMEX  At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. Find your place in marketing on #TeamAmex.  As marketers at one of the most iconic brands in the world, we play a major role in building authentic relationships with customers who impact life and business around the world. Here, creativity and inspired storytelling combine with powerful data-based marketing and hyper-personalized digital communication to create a genuine human connection that drives business results. As a part of our diverse community of marketers, you can have a breadth of different marketing experiences and do virtually anything from connecting small businesses to new customers to uncovering insights that inspire the future of payments. Create a dynamic career while doing work that matters for people and businesses everywhere.  Business Unit/Role Specific Info  Where are these roles located within American Express? Global Commercial Services (GCS) seeks to change the world at work, so our customers can change the world. We aspire to serve all of our commercial clients, from the mom-and-pop store on Main Street to the largest global enterprises, Global Consumer Services Group (GCSG) comprises of local sales and marketing, travel and lifestyle services, and global consumer products including lending, cobrands, and premium products and benefits, as well as the teams which develop and support the digital, risk, and information management capabilities across American Express. Global Merchant & Network Services (GMNS) brings together the businesses that manage and evolve important partnerships for the company with key stakeholders including merchants, banks, and strategic and loyalty partners. Global Advertising & Brand Management (GABM) creates worldwide demand for American Express, driving business through innovative marketing, messaging, partnerships, and experiences. Teams within the group cover Brand management and planning, Brand Strategy, Brand Training, Enablement & Governance, Global Media, Brand Content & Communications, Global Experiential Marketing, Digital Brand Capabilities and Amex Insights (responsible for bringing the voice of the customer and competitive context to business decisions made across the enterprise). Consumer- Global Consumer Services Group (GCSG) is responsible for growing the American Express consumer business worldwide, strengthening our global leadership position in the premium space, and delivering exceptional, differentiated customer experiences. What type of work can you expect to do in Marketing at American Express? Analyze data and realize growth opportunities to help businesses improve performance and drive growth Be responsible for understanding how our business functions and how it might best be served using new and emerging digital products and/or services Build and track performance indicators to better understand customer behavior Develop cost-benefit analyses to determine feasibility of new opportunities Develop relationships with a variety of internal and external partners Share and leverage best practices and provide consultancy to team Manage end-to-end marketing initiatives or other customer-focused initiatives; develop and implement tests to measure effectiveness Find innovative ways to improve the customer experience Skills/Experience Passion for customer marketing, payments innovation, travel industry and new technology trends Ability to conceptualize and sell ideas Independent thinker who’s organized, has great attention to detail, and can multi-task Strong analytical, problem-solving/quantitative skills Willing to take risks and share fresh perspectives Be proficient with analytical and presentation tools, including Excel and PowerPoint Excellent written and verbal communication skills Requirements/Qualifications Currently enrolled in a full-time Graduate degree program Students must have a graduation date between December 2022 and June 2023 American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.  For more information, please visit our career website at https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/careers/.  Apply now!  Our team will review completed applications on a rolling basis. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application and will be in contact with you by April 30th.  Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our Co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), Co-chairman Erik Anderson (Chairman of Top Golf and Founder of West River Group), Board Member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisors Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay) and Scott Maw (CFO of Starbucks), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice Founder and Felicis Ventures), Mike Repole (Founder of Vitamin Water and Body Armor) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and Founders Fund), and other fun athletes and musicians including John Elway, Aaron Rodgers, Larry Fitzgerald, Nas, Charles Kelley (Lady Antebellum), Leann Rimes and Darius Rucker amongst many others.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits Paid vacation and holidays Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  aoI2mSXqqL

Pacific Office Automation is one of the largest independently-owned document imaging and technology dealers in the nation. Since 1976, we have grown to twenty-eight branches located in nine western states. With over 40 years of success in office equipment and technology sales/service, our growth and reputation have afforded us great relationships with top manufacturers such as Canon, Sharp, Konica Minolta, HP, Ricoh, Lexmark, and many more.   At Pacific Office Automation, you’ll find an amazing technology company full of growth opportunities, great benefits, and passionate coworkers who aim to help you succeed. Among our company goals, we aim to be a long-term employer. That means providing employees with the training and certification they need to keep up with the fast-changing technology of our office machines, devices, and software. At POA, we believe that all voices can and should be heard, regardless of seniority or tenure.      Position   We are looking to hire a Sales Intern at our office in Beaverton, OR. If you are a competitive and driven individual looking for exposure to sales, we would like to hear from you! All majors welcome to apply, as well as individuals that are involved in Sales/Marketing Clubs, Fraternity/Sorority Members, and Student-Athletes are highly desired.   The purpose of this position is to shadow a successful outside sales representative/manager to learn how to prospect new accounts, learn solution selling techniques, build lasting rapport with accounts, and close deals.      Essential Job Duties    Learn how to develop new business and reach decision-makers  Support outside sales representatives with developing and executing cutting-edge prospecting and networking solutions  Shadow sales representatives on appointments with accounts  Learn what it takes to establish long term business partnerships       Qualifications    Must be enrolled in a 4-year college  Interested in a career in sales  Entrepreneurial spirit and team player  Competitive background – aggressive, highly motivated individuals  Strong work ethic       What we offer    Thorough full cycle sales training  Fun and fast-paced work environment  A new challenge every day  Hands-on mentorship by veteran sales reps  We are flexible about the duration and time frame of the internship  Paid Internship – Full Time or Part-Time       Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion   Pacific Office Automation is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, age, religion, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate our employees’ differences because we know that diversity makes us stronger.
