description: Discover a professionally and financially rewarding career in an exciting, fast-paced growing industry! By providing a high level of service to our customers, our sales-oriented Account Management Trainees create strong, lasting professional relationships. The extensive training provided enables Account Management Trainees to use their solid interpersonal skills and drive to manage existing accounts as well as bring in new business. Our most successful candidates have gained leadership experience through internships, athletics, and participation in various philanthropic organizations. Most have held positions in sales or marketing; whether it be in a corporate or retail environment. We are seeking highly motivated, success-focused individuals with strong communication skills who excel in a team setting. This opportunity is best for people who thrive in a results-oriented, competitive, social, and fast-paced environment.  Why you’ll like working with us: An unprecedented intensive 16-week training program designed to provide all the knowledge and skills necessary to become a successful Account Management Trainee Continuous one on one mentorship and coaching after initial training to ensure that you never stagnate in your professional education and development Opportunity for advancement every quarter through peer and performance reviews Company culture centered on giving back and personal investment  As an Account Manager Trainee you will: Be responsible for managing the business development of the assigned campaign and achieving sales goals set with the client in a given time frame. Grow sales and profitability by penetrating market share across all categories of services, and by monitoring and increasing client presence across the assigned territory. Conduct daily meetings with the team to evaluate campaign progress and focus on growing and maintaining an existing client base while developing new relationships. Be in constant communication with prospective clients/customers via community outreach, calls, networking events, and CRM tools. As part of your training, be a part of our client support team: Build a pipeline of potential customers for repeat business. Responsible for targeting which customers to pursue and when; manage a list of accounts and will prioritize based on their own knowledge and understanding of the business.  Requirements:  The best candidates for our company have gained leadership experience through internships or organizations on campus, held positions in sales/marketing, have a competitive drive, and love working with people. Candidates must have strong communication and time management skills, and be able to work well with a team. This opportunity is best for people who thrive in a results-oriented, competitive, social, and fast-paced environment. 1-3 years of successful customer service or sales experience Strong ability to develop and deliver presentations Experience and proven track record of leadership or a strong desire to become a great leader Strong business, financial, operations and technology acumen Ability to function independently with minimal daily supervision  Powered by JazzHR  ag592nBGw1

description: Tom James Company - Internship Opportunity  POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Internship is 20+ hours and will be completed on Tuesday/Thursday with choice of 7:30 am – 11:30 am CST or 12:30 pm – 4:30 pm CST. Additional hours are set based on Intern and office availability. *This internship can start in any month of the year and lasts 8 weeks. Internship is $12/hour plus Commission Candidate must be graduating by December 2022 and live, or have housing, in the area of the internship and desire a career in sales in that location upon graduation. Candidate must be eligible to work in the US and not require sponsorship Visa status now or in the future.  OUR OPPORTUNITY:  The goal of the Internship program is to provide you with a real life glimpse into our full-time role of a Sales Professional and also to enable you to eventually complete the Tom James sales cycle process with a prospect from initial interaction through final delivery.  The primary areas of focus for our internships will be: No previous industry knowledge is required; just a desire to sell and succeed Prospect clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including Zoom Info & LinkedIn Sales Navigator to find and reach out to potential clients Direct/Indirect Referral Concepts: generate referrals through current and potential clients to create warmer leads Phone Skills & Dials: 50+ dials/week, with a goal to set around 5 appointments/week Access to Technology including a Chromebook, prospecting platforms, communication platforms, and CRM Independently develop clientele: build your clientele throughout the summer, with those prospected being returned to you, providing you return as a full-time hire. Field knowledge: follow your mentor as they go on appointments, measure clients, and prospect directly in the field. Work with your mentor to sell people whom you've prospected and set appointments with.  TRAINING:  Your first week is virtual, classroom training in the store that you were hired in. Additional training will continue on Tuesday and Thursdays throughout the remaining 7 weeks.  TOM JAMES:  Tom James Company has more than 50 years of direct selling expertise in the custom clothing industry. We have grown from a single store to stores throughout 4 continents and more than $500 million in sales.  Our sales force consists of highly motivated, service and sales minded professionals that strive for growth and leadership. By finding and developing long-term, loyal customers, our people build lifestyles to support their personal and professional goals. Our customers are highly successful, busy professionals who demand convenience, quality and excellent service in which we deliver to them.  We provide the training, opportunity and product to build a significant income through sales and leadership while establishing a strong net worth through our employee ownership and 401(k)/profit sharing programs.  We are vertically integrated which allows our Sales Professionals opportunities to grow their net worth and expand their careers.  Powered by JazzHR  e20kVkbGma

This internship is full time during the summer of 2022.  Position Summary  This position will provide operational, project and and analytical support to the domestic franchising department which works with approximately 350 franchisees operating approximately 800 GNC retail locations in the continental United States.  Job Responsibilities Ability to research and document current strategies or practices and evaluate the impact on the profitability of the franchise department. Research strategies used by other franchisors to improve the profitability of the franchise department. Present documented recommendations based on the above research. Research and update, or create, documentation regarding daily process flows. Gather and analyze data to create documented recommendations on process improvements. Collaborate with other corporate departments to execute process improvements. Identify KPIs that can be used to measure impact of process improvements on franchise ordering, reporting capabilities available to franchisees, and wholesale and retail sales. Qualifications Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning) Strong computer skills, especially programs used to store and manipulate data to evaluate current and future strategies Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. Ability to read, write, and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos Ability to work overtime as necessary GNC Holdings, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description: s are responsible for helping our sales team achieve sales objectives, territory management, selling current and new products, promotions, in-store tastings, and servicing accounts. This also includes merchandising activities such as: shelf placement, maintaining cold boxes, building displays and stocking inventories.  Job Description  A Sales Consultant for Johnson Brother's is expected to carry out the following and some additional tasks.  Territory Management Ensure consistent customer contact Properly plan and execute sales initiatives Handle all customer related issues in a prompt and friendly manner Selling Full understanding of products and pricing schedules Make effective sales presentations Achieve assigned company objectives and successfully grow business Identify and nurture new accounts Understand account focus and who their customers are Understand competitive sets Stay up to date on regions, vintages, and market trends Merchandising Use all available POS to enhance selling efforts Focus on merchandising basics such as display size and location, shelf position and standards, cold boxes, counters, windows, and anywhere else consumers can be impacted Utilize resources for on-premise i.e., wine list printing, table tents, staff training cards Understand value-add opportunities with accounts as permissible- tastings, wine dinners, seminars, staff trainings Servicing Follow necessary steps when making sales calls Perform reliable inventory checks and communicate properly to minimize order mistakes Properly rotate products on shelves, cold boxes, displays, etc. Ensure vintage accuracy on wine lists Administration Adhere to all company policies and procedures Handle all paperwork issues in a proper and timely manner Position Qualifications BA/BS college degree or related industry experience Prior route sales experience (highly preferred) Excellent verbal and written communication skills Goals and results driven Valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record Reliable transportation and proof of insurance Local candidates preferred (no relocation package) Johnson Brothers is an equal opportunity employer. description: In this hybrid Business Solutions Student Support and Sales Intern role, you will be developing your analytical skills and collaborating across multiple team players within our Sales organization. You will support Category Management and the Customer Team as you work to drive effective business insight solutions. We’re a company that can nourish your career as well as your appetite.  As a Sales Intern at Kellogg for Summer 2022 (May – July), you’ll experience what it’s like to be part of our U.S. Sales organization as you join a dedicated team of people who are passionate about Kellogg and our delicious brands! You will be accountable for applying key learnings to successfully assist and execute sales programs to satisfy our customer needs and help drive sales. Excited for what lies ahead? We are too.  Below Highlights The Timeline And Responsibilities For Each Assignment Business Solutions Student Support Assignment – January-May 2022 Sales Intern Assignment – May-July 2022 HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING – Business Solutions Student Support (Jan-May 2022) Cutting-edge Technology – You will be identifying and integrating innovative tools to analyze and visualize sales data and insights with Tableau, Excel, Access and more! Ready to shape the future? Information solutions are at your fingertips. Break the Mold – You will help create standard procedures for effective data usage and tools to simplify the process. Asking questions and challenging the status quo is your recipe for success. #OwnIt Let’s Get Analytical – You’ll be utilizing Nielsen programs to analyze and interpret data, while creating and analyzing efficient assortment using Kellogg tools. And with your self-starter, go-getter, team-player work ethic, we’re positive you’ll fit right in. Category Management – It’s all in the name – you’ll be helping the team manage our Kellogg categories from baked goods to breakfast greats leveraging Big Data to help develop insights on Category results and trends, and more. It’s about having fun & Playing to Win. Delivering Success – And of course, as you work you’ll be gaining meaningful business experience as you exhibit professionalism in your interactions and communication with Kellogg Category Management team and our Kellogg Company personnel. Excited for what lies ahead? We are too. HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING – Sales Intern (May-July 2022)  Hands-on Sales Experience – your role as a Sales Intern will combine the following assignments: Partnering with the Retail Sales Team to gain experience in retail stores by performing sales and customer connection techniques (Pop-tarts, Cheez-Its, Kashi, oh my!) Assisting our Account, Category Management, or Business Planning Teams with customer business plans and processes Hungry to learn more? Your assignments will include: Selling, negotiating, and executing business plans –The data doesn’t lie. You’ll utilize tried and true fact based selling techniques to grow Kellogg’s in-store sales, develop business communication skills and learn our go-to-market strategies. Patience + Persistence = Profit – It’s time to put your can-do attitude to the test. You’ll be a champion for Kellogg by implementing creative ideas and innovative solutions to overcome roadblocks, analyzing customer business and performance, and selling within the landscape of America’s largest retailers. Drive Results – You will be accountable for delivering on key metrics and demonstrating leadership skills, while helping create compelling sales stories as you work on our iconic brands. It’s about having an Owner’s Mindset and Playing to Win. Your seat at the table – Our interns are the future of our organization and this is your opportunity to have your voice heard. You will be contributing meaningful work to the Kellogg business by leading your own projects and reporting out on key business solutions to executive leadership. And this is only the beginning! YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS  Required Enrolled in Bachelor’s degree program from an accredited college or university Valid driver’s license and clean driving record Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) Ability to conduct physical work, frequently lifting 20 -25 pounds Willing to accommodate up to 20% travel (at least 2 overnight trips required) Flexible to be relocated to multiple geographies for the internship & post-graduation full-time opportunities Experience working with databases, spreadsheets and other computer programs Bonus Points Major and/or minor in a related subject, such as, Marketing, Economics, Data Analytics or Business Student at a Junior status Minimum of 3.0 GPA (cumulative) Work-related experience preferred, but not required Experience working with Tableau, Nielsen and/or Access WHAT ELSE DO I NEED TO KNOW?  You should be available to work for a minimum 7-month commitment at our Kellogg offices in Battle Creek, Michigan starting in January 2022. Please note – should the COVID-19 pandemic continue to impact the in-person work environment, this student experience will be moved to a virtual platform.  In this role, having an owner’s mindset paired with your initiative and curiosity will take you a long way. You will be encouraged to “follow your nose” (as Toucan Sam would say) and pursue opportunities to engage in a team environment, while sharping your business acumen. And did we mention there’s plenty of snacks?  What’s Next  Come join our Kellogg Family! It’s best to apply today, because job postings can be taken down and we wouldn’t want you to miss this opportunity. To learn more about what’s next, click on one of the links below: Kellogg K-Values Kellogg’s Internship Video THE FINER PRINT  The ability to work a full shift, come to work on time, work overtime as needed and the ability to work according to the necessary schedule to meet job requirements with or without reasonable accommodation is an essential function of this student position. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Where required by state law and/or city ordinance; this employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. For additional information, please follow this Link for English or this Link for Spanish.  LET’S CREATE THE FUTURE OF FOOD  Kellogg Recruitment

description: About the Role:  As the Sales Enablement Intern, you are responsible for helping drive net new sales and revenue growth with the largest US merchants by ensuring that the revenue team has the appropriate stories, data, and materials to drive success.  In this role you will play an integral role in the sales cycle. You will assist in the creation of custom sales assets, sales pitch materials, internal presentations, RFP documents and work across multiple departments within the revenue team.  This position is extremely strategic as it supports one of the largest drivers of Sezzle’s growth – onboarding new enterprise merchants and brands. This internship is very visible across the org and you will have the opportunity to be very creative and hands on. This role starts immediately and reports to the Head of Sales Enablement.  Our Company  Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose mission is to financially empower young consumers. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the hundreds of eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.  As the first and only B-Corp in the payments space, Sezzle’s goal is to help everyone pursue financial freedom, and to invest in social good and ethical initiatives that shape a better world.  At Sezzle, we’re committed to putting purpose alongside profitability. We work hard to maintain rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency to build a better world. The employees at Sezzle lean into significant societal and cultural shifts, ensuring internal and external focus on positive impacts that benefit our community.  Responsibilities: Create and manage deliverables to aide in the success of the sales cycle including pitch decks, case studies, trade show content and sell sheets. Establish strong collaborative relationships with cross-functional stakeholders including Product, Analytics, Marketing, Partnerships, and Merchant Success Lead ad-hoc projects for the Senior Leadership and Enterprise teams Iterate on current sales materials and approach to ensure alignment with the sales cycle and improve how the brand story is communicated Ideal Skills & Experience: Pursuing a bachelor’s degree with at least 2 years of coursework completed (Junior) Strong storytelling skills and creative execution Preferred GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale Strong sense of design and familiarity with basic design programs including: Canva, Figma, G Suite, Photoshop is a bonus About You: A+ character. We are team-first here at Sezzle. A hard-working mentality. It’s early and there is still a lot to build. An excellent communicator. A fun attitude. Life’s too short. We can have fun while we work hard on cool things. Smarts. We need people that are smart enough to make decisions on their own and also smart enough to know when they need input from others. Perks & Benefits: Competitive pay Option to work remotely Collaborative fun workspace with optional remote work Impactful and meaningful work projects The opportunity to join Minneapolis’s fastest growing startup alongside a team of motivated and driven individuals What Makes Working at Sezzle Awesome?  At Sezzle, we are more than just brilliant engineers, passionate data enthusiasts, out-of-the-box thinkers, and determined innovators; we are skilled musicians, yogis, cyclists, chefs, golfers, dog-lovers, and rock-climbers. We believe in surrounding ourselves with not only the best and the brightest individuals, but those that are unique and purpose-driven in all that they do. Sezzle recognizes and values the importance of diversity and inclusion in enriching the employment experience of its employees and in supporting our mission.  Our culture is not defined by a certain set of perks designed to give the illusion of the traditional startup culture, but rather, it is the visible example living in every employee that we hire.  Sezzle provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, familial status, veteran or military status, status regarding public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

description: Job ID  29192  Posted  26-Aug-2021  Service line  Advisory Segment  Role type  Full-time  Areas of Interest  Valuations/ Appraisal  Location(s)  Los Angeles - California - United States of America  About CBRE  With broader and deeper capabilities than any other company, CBRE is the leading full-service real estate services and investment organization in the world. A CBRE internship gives you a unique opportunity to get a head start in the commercial real estate industry by working alongside some of our top producing professionals. Our associates will gain valuable real-life experience and learn the business by working on CBRE projects.  CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm (based on 2020 revenues) with more than 100,000 employees (excluding affiliates). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #128 in 2021. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 20 consecutive years and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” in the real estate sector for nine years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE”.  The company serves real estate investors and occupiers through approximately 530+ offices worldwide (excluding affiliates). CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services.  Responsibilities  This internship is designed for current college students, undergraduate or graduate seeking a career in commercial real estate. Recent graduates are also eligible and encouraged to apply. Participation in the program is intended to provide a well-rounded knowledge of the commercial real estate business and valuable skills, earned by working alongside talented professionals in the largest and most successful global commercial real estate services firm.  The internship accelerates your learning and development by providing you with a strong foundation upon which to build your commercial real estate valuation career. As a program participant, you will also partake in learning and development activities designed especially for you.  Responsibilities May Include  Assisting licensed appraisers with the preparation of appraisal reports  Conduct rent comparable surveys of apartment properties  Confirm sale transactions with local brokers and enter data into our database  Conducting market research of overall multifamily trends in the local market and produce Market Analysis reports  Researching local zoning laws and ordinances and summarizing these findings  Assisting in automating or streamlining labor-intensive tasks  Underwriting projected income and expense forecasts  Qualifications  This internship is designed for candidates with a strong academic background, preferably in business, economics, real estate, computer science, or a quantitative field of study. Applicants should be disciplined, self-motivated, seek to learn about commercial real estate valuation, have excellent listening skills, and be able to work equally well individually or in group environments. Interest in the multi-family property type is preferred.  To be considered for a position with CBRE, please apply online at http://cbre.com/careers. Click on “Search and Apply” on the left side of the screen. If a pop-up window does not open, please check your browser’s settings. On the login window either login with your existing username and password or click on “Register Today” to create one. Once you are logged in you can either apply for specific jobs or submit your general application using the link at the bottom of the page.  EOE & AA Employer M/F/D/V  CBRE is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.  NOTE: An additional requirement for this role is the ability to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing.

description: Job Description  The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply button at the top or bottom of this page. You'll be required to create an account or sign in to an existing one.  If you have a disability and need assistance with the application, you can request a reasonable accommodation. Send an email to  Regular Or Temporary  Regular  Language Fluency: English (Required)  Work Shift  1st shift (United States of America)  Please Review The Following Job Description  Drive sales and build strong relationships with producers to generate revenue and meet sales quotas. The Internal Sales Consultant proactively calls agents and recruits new agents to build a book of business. This position ensures constant communication with all members of the team as well as with the producers working to develop strong relationships and promoting agent recruiting and retention through sales ideas, marketing campaigns, illustrations and effective management and utilization of Hanleigh resources.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities  Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time. Successfully build relationships with key producers to discuss complex sales concepts, marketing campaigns, and product information. Coordinate with aligned team and producers to run insurance illustrations and suggest and implement creative solutions. Assist to incrementally grow book of aligned business to reflect strategic organizational business plan requirements. Maintain proactive sales relationships with aligned producers/agents/brokers and/or assigned accounts through ongoing producer profiling, constant relationship-building, and refining and refreshment of their agent/broker base Develop new business by recruiting new agents and growing existing agent groups to maximize revenue potential Partner with External Sales Consultants on all aspects of producer development and maintenance of business. Be able to call on tier 2 & 3 agents in a sales capacity (defined as those generally not serviced in-person) Maintain a proactive and supportive relationship with the Sales, Underwriting, and Operations teams and internally aligned corporate solution centers. Lead regular team meetings and establish team priorities with the sales team. Prepare monthly forecast, discuss hot list of cases each month, and ensure that each team member is aware of their responsibilities. Maintain a working knowledge of pending priority cases and be able to close those cases as necessary. Develop expert knowledge of core Hanleigh products, carriers, and corporate resources. Required Skills And Competencies  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Bachelor's degree in business or equivalent education and relevant experience Effective interpersonal and written communication skills Ability to provide excellent customer service to both internal and external customers Effective time management skills Ability to prioritize and accomplish multiple tasks simultaneously Capable of working independently as well as in a team environment Ability to work in a self-directed fashion Experience with PC's in a Windows environment Detail oriented, take-charge person with excellent relationship building skills and strong technical (computer) skills Well-developed life insurance product knowledge Understanding of sales concepts, corresponding illustrations, and the underwriting process helpful Understanding of commissions and client service process Proficient skill in use of Microsoft office applications, with specific skill applied to Excel and Access including programming and advanced knowledge of functions, data transformation to deliver unique insights Experience with database management Excellent organizational and time management skills; ability to manage multiple priorities Strong negotiation skills with the ability to use advanced judgment in problem solving Ability to travel, occasionally overnight Desired Skills Two years of work experience in the Disability or Life insurance industry Exposure to either Group Insurance solutions or Executive Benefits consulting State Insurance Licenses This role is benefits eligible. Please visit to learn more.  Salary Range is $45000 to $55000 Depending on experience.  Truist supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer who does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other classification protected by law. Drug Free Workplace.  Thank you for your interest in Truist! BB&T and SunTrust have come together in a transformational merger of equals to create Truist, the premier financial organization in the country. You may notice references to our legacy company names, BB&T and SunTrust, in places throughout this site. All such references should be understood to refer to Truist moving forward while we continue to transition to the Truist name.

description: Company  Description  LingoAce is a global leading EdTech (education technology) company, headquartered in Singapore, that currently focuses on providing a quality and immersive Chinese language learning experience to students aged 4 to 15 years old. In addition to its headquarters in Singapore, LingoAce also has a presence in Beijing, Wuhan, Chengdu, Silicon Valley, Bangkok and Jakarta and will continue to expand into other parts of the world to meet the growing demand for language learning.  Founded in 2017, LingoAce leverages its experienced teaching team, AI-powered tools, gamification features and research-backed methodology to provide students with the best learning experience and results.  LingoAce has raised several rounds of venture funding from leading global investors, including Sequoia, Tiger Global and Owl Ventures, to support its vision for revolutionizing learning across the world.  Today, LingoAce has a total registered student base of 300,000 students across 80 countries – coming from families of different nationalities including international expats, Chinese immigrants, and local parents. The company has more than 3,000 teachers and 1,250 employees globally.  The Role  We are looking for a Product Intern who is passionate about building products that customers love. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company's vision and strategy.  You’ll working closely with designers, software developers, sales, and business leaders, and dig into impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate.  Responsibilities Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth Solve ambiguous problems and remove barriers that prevent engineers, designers, and business stakeholders from shipping products fast and efficiently Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact Drive product feature launches including working with executives and other product management team members Define and analyze metrics that inform product decisions and strategy Requirements A background in Human Computer Interaction, Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related field Ability to work with ambiguity and willingness to roll up one's sleeves to make things happen Intrinsically motivated, results driven and detail oriented Well organized with the ability to prioritize tasks and lead time effectively Excellent written and verbal communication skills Additional Qualifications Project/product management and analytical skills Experience executing digital marketing campaigns Experience working with global teams is a good to have

description: About AMEX  At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.  Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.  The core of our company is not just the products we offer, but the personal connections our customers have with our brand. You can create digital experiences– from payments to rewards to servicing– that keep us connected to our customers and serve them at every touchpoint. From digital servicing and lifestyle features to secure, frictionless payment options, you can make a meaningful difference in our customers’ lives and help set us apart in the industry.  Where are these roles located within American Express? Enterprise Data & Digital Services: This team offers a unique opportunity to build the digital connection with our prospects and customers. We drive innovation, delivering products and platforms across the entire lifecycle of Cardmember partnership, partnering with other Business Units and Centers of Excellence, advancing our goal of becoming an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Enterprise Digital Member Experiences team is responsible for deepening Card Member engagement through our digital experiences, with a primary focus on Membership mobile app, web, commerce and push channels. Amex Digital Labs: This team is responsible for catalyzing digital innovation at American Express by originating, incubating and managing emerging products and platforms that can be essential to our customers’ digital lives. We strive to emphasize creativity, customer centricity, and innovation. Focus areas include creating industry-leading digital payment solutions, using our first-class servicing network and lifestyle assets to create digital experiences, and defining new products and services based on emerging technologies and trends. This is a fast-paced team driving the development of digital solutions and partner experiences at American Express. Credit Fraud Risk Capabilities: This team brings risk strategies to life by enabling customer focused capabilities for Card and Non-Card products. You will collaborate with partners in other Risk teams, Marketing, Finance, Global Servicing Network, Legal/Compliance, Banking, and Technologies to create world-class analytical capabilities and solutions to minimize credit and fraud risk and improve customer experience. Consumer- Global Consumer Services Group (GCSG) is responsible for growing the American Express consumer business worldwide, strengthening our global leadership position in the premium space, and delivering exceptional, differentiated customer experiences. GCSG comprises local sales and marketing, travel and lifestyle services, and global consumer products including lending, cobrands, and premium products and benefits, as well as the teams which develop and support the digital, risk, and information management capabilities across American Express. Skills/Experience Demonstrated interest in digital technologies and customer-driven design Independent thinker who’s organized, has great attention to detail, and can multi-task Strong analytical, problem-solving/quantitative skills Willing to take risks, experiment, and share fresh perspectives Proficient in analytical and presentation tools, including Excel and PowerPoint Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to present ideas clearly Requirements/Qualifications Currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s degree program Students must have a graduation date between December 2022 and June 2023 Our team will review completed applications on a rolling basis. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application and will be in contact with you by April 30th.  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.  Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. description: Copper Compression Internship: Planning & Marketing Analyst September-December 2021 20 hours/week. We offer a full range of copper-infused targeted compression apparel and accessories that help professional athletes, weekend warriors and anyone dealing with injury, chronic pain or normal wear and tear. Our products help with pain management, reducing inflammation, muscle recovery and joint stability. Please visit www.coppercompression.com or our store on Amazon.com to discover our products and our story.  Position Overview Join our NYC team and work with our demand planning and marketing teams in support of our growing Direct-to-Consumer businesses. Tom James Company - Internship Opportunity  POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Internship is 20+ hours and will be completed on Tuesday/Thursday with choice of 7:30 am – 11:30 am CST or 12:30 pm – 4:30 pm CST. Additional hours are set based on Intern and office availability. *This internship can start in any month of the year and lasts 8 weeks. Internship is $12/hour plus Commission Candidate must be graduating by December 2022 and live, or have housing, in the area of the internship and desire a career in sales in that location upon graduation. Candidate must be eligible to work in the US and not require sponsorship Visa status now or in the future.  OUR OPPORTUNITY:  The goal of the Internship program is to provide you with a real life glimpse into our full-time role of a Sales Professional and also to enable you to eventually complete the Tom James sales cycle process with a prospect from initial interaction through final delivery.  The primary areas of focus for our internships will be: No previous industry knowledge is required; just a desire to sell and succeed Prospect clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including Zoom Info & LinkedIn Sales Navigator to find and reach out to potential clients Direct/Indirect Referral Concepts: generate referrals through current and potential clients to create warmer leads Phone Skills & Dials: 50+ dials/week, with a goal to set around 5 appointments/week Access to Technology including a Chromebook, prospecting platforms, communication platforms, and CRM Independently develop clientele: build your clientele throughout the summer, with those prospected being returned to you, providing you return as a full-time hire. Field knowledge: follow your mentor as they go on appointments, measure clients, and prospect directly in the field. Work with your mentor to sell people whom you've prospected and set appointments with.  TRAINING:  Your first week is virtual, classroom training in the store that you were hired in. Additional training will continue on Tuesday and Thursdays throughout the remaining 7 weeks.  TOM JAMES:  Tom James Company has more than 50 years of direct selling expertise in the custom clothing industry. We have grown from a single store to stores throughout 4 continents and more than $500 million in sales.  Our sales force consists of highly motivated, service and sales minded professionals that strive for growth and leadership. By finding and developing long-term, loyal customers, our people build lifestyles to support their personal and professional goals. Our customers are highly successful, busy professionals who demand convenience, quality and excellent service in which we deliver to them.  We provide the training, opportunity and product to build a significant income through sales and leadership while establishing a strong net worth through our employee ownership and 401(k)/profit sharing programs.  We are vertically integrated which allows our Sales Professionals opportunities to grow their net worth and expand their careers.  Powered by JazzHR  EqGukxdFXv

description: If you are a current employee, please STOP and apply through the Careers Application in Workday  Job Description Summary:Want to break into sales in the Wine Industry? Join our Portland Sales Team at Republic National Distributing Company / Young’s Market Company. This is an entry-level Sales Associate role supporting the sales team. You will work closely with Account Managers and Sales Representatives to maximize the sale of supplier brands to high image beverage accounts through effective selling execution, account management, and communication - resulting in the achievement of company and supplier objectives.Job Description:  Key Responsibilities  Account Management  Sales Representative Trainees Plan Time And Activities To Ensure Achievement Of Company And Supplier Established Goals And Sales Objectives Within Assigned Accounts By Effectively executing distribution and volume through various qualitative drivers -- distribution, displays, pricing, point of sales use, wine lists, promotions, banquets, and special events. Conducting staff training and education in all assigned accounts. Identifying opportunities, developing and implementing 'Account Action Plans'. Developing monthly, weekly and daily written plans for execution. Creating customer business building concepts to increase company share and volume. Working collaboratively with supplier personnel to develop product knowledge, assist with presentations and accounts. Participate in work-with’s with sales reps to better understand market conditions in each individual sales territory. Participate in sales trainings to better the knowledge of brands we carry. Selling  As a Sales Rep Trainee, you will obtain company and supplier quotas and revenue growth by: Selling concepts by consulting with the customer on strategies that will collectively enhance both business models. Building relationships and an effective partnership with the ultimate decision maker in assigned accounts. Utilizing pricing and promotion strategies, marketing opportunities, servicing, merchandising and category management skills. Merchandising Work product from store back stock or delivery loads. Fill cold boxes and shelves with appropriate merchandise. Build displays in stores and maintain POS (point of sale) as necessary. Rotate product on an ongoing basis. Maintain back stock areas so that they are clean and organized. Communicating  Sales Rep Trainees serve as information resources for, and conduits between, the field and the company by: Communicating issues, opportunities and market intelligence through effective written, electronic and verbal means. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: 1+ years of sales experience. Proven track record of successful selling Solid communication, negotiation, analytical and objection handling skills. Ability to work with management, colleagues, and customers throughout the business and industry at every level. Key attributes: entrepreneurial self-starter, ambitious personality, accountable and action oriented. Ability to lift 50 pounds repeatedly. Walk, stand, climb, balance, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl daily. Valid driver's license, reliable vehicle, and clean DMV record. 21+ years of age. DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  Sales Tasks & Activities: Knowledge of processes, tools, techniques and theory behind selling the organization's products or services.  Knowledge of Customers & Sales Channels: Knowledge of specific customer's business operations and ability to coordinate multiple and diverse options for selling the organization's products and services to each. Knowledge of and ability to utilize customer profile and information.  Knowledge of Product Line: Knowledge of specific products and associated development process and strategy.  RNDC has sold fine wines since the end of Prohibition. Our long history and emphasis in the wine business can be attributed to our family roots; focused on family-owned wineries that share many of the same values and goals. Our robust portfolio of fine wines spans the world’s most prestigious wine-making regions, from Australia, Chile, and the Rhone Valley of France, to Oregon. We believe that the wine business is a people business, and with each wine there is a story, a wine maker and a sales team that delivers on each and every bottle. We are dedicated to providing our customers valuable wine expertise. We are dedicated to delivering best in class service and value to our customers.  EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability  Enjoy a career with us!
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: We're looking for a Sales Intern to help support our team's growth initiatives and provide value to our Sales Team! This is a 3-month paid internship for Fall 2021.  Fleetio is a modern software platform that helps thousands of organizations around the world manage their fleet operations. Transportation technology is a hot market and we’re leading the charge, with raving fans and new customers signing up every day.  What you'll be doing 10-15 hours per week working with our Sales and Sales Operations Teams Collect new data on Prospective Companies, Contacts, and Industries and consolidate information into Salesforce.com Enrich existing data with updated information, new intel, changes, etc to ensure our Sales Team has the latest information and is equipped for success Create a better demo experience for prospective customers by creating data files that produce comprehensive sample fleet data that helps Fleetio Account Executives tell a compelling narrative Support general initiatives across the Sales Organization  What's in it for you Gain exposure and experience by having the opportunity to shadow critical functions at Fleetio including Sales Development, Account Management, and Customer Success Learn the basics of Salesforce, the world's leading CRM, and use it in pragmatic ways that are transferrable to any sales organization Improve your analytical and technical skills through data research and compilation Increase your knowledge of how fleets are maintained and operated at companies critical to the U.S. supply chain Be a part of an incredible team of “A” players who go above and beyond to make Fleetio a successful company. We’re a customer-centric team with a great product, excellent support, and countless happy customers. Work from our awesome HQ located in downtown Birmingham We will provide you with your own Mac laptop & any other tools you need  More About Our Team And Company Watch our culture videos: https://fleet.io/culture Fleetio overview video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IlvIbwZT3oU More about the Fleetio platform: https://www.fleetio.com/features Our careers page: https://www.fleetio.com/career  Requirements You enjoy solving problems - you use your creativity and strategic thinking skills to troubleshoot issues and overcome objections You're a go-getter - you work hard to deliver consistent results and contribute to the success of the entire sales team You're resourceful - you know how to leverage a variety of technologies and resources to hit your goals You're a team player - you value your team and work well with others toward a common goal You have strong attention to detail - you take great notes and are mindful of all of the information that will help us close a deal You love technology - you enjoy learning new tools and software that increase efficiency in your work Be sure to mention coffee in your cover letter so we know you actually read this  Considered a plus Previous sales or fleet-related experience Experience with Salesforce, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Slack, Asana, Excel/Sheets  Fleetio provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibits discrimination and harassment. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.  This application is not intended to and does not create a contract or offer of employment. Employment with Fleetio is at will.  If you have a disability or a special need that requires an accommodation to fill out the online application, please let us know by calling (205) 718-7500 or emailing recruiting@fleetio.com.

description: Job Description  Start date: Tuesday, January 18, 2022, (January 17 is MLK Holiday) and Monday, June 13, 2022  Location: CT - Hartford, PA - Blue Bell, GA - Atlanta, NE - Omaha, CA - Concord  CVS Health is the nation's premier health innovation company helping people on their path to better health. We are building a new health care model that is easier to use, less expensive, and puts the consumer at the center of their care.  You Will Gain Valuable Work Experience And Participate In Formal classroom and on the job training Projects that contribute to the success of our business Community service and culture initiatives Mentoring and coaching throughout your career development What This Business Area Supports Positions are available across a variety of business units including Commercial and Government businesses What You Will Do Price new and existing business with the goal of selling and retaining profitable customers Act as a strategic partner to support overall management of your book of business Work with internal partners in sales and account management to negotiate pricing, create benefit plan designs and cross sell additional products/programs in support of our customers Collaborate with actuarial to refine pricing based on changes in future medical costs, trends, and customer specific data Participate in department solution-focused business projects Required Qualifications Meet educational requirements (see education section) Demonstrate commitment to our core values: Innovation, Caring, Collaboration, Accountability, and Integrity Have a willingness to relocate to one of our Underwriting offices located in Hartford, CT, Blue Bell, PA, Atlanta, GA, Omaha, NE, or Concord, CA Preferred Qualifications Be able to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines Demonstrate inclusive leadership through educational, professional, organized sports, clubs, or life experiences Have experience with analytical and technical programs such as Microsoft Excel and/or other data analysis/coding software Strong written and verbal communication skills Internship or work experience in related fields such as business or healthcare Possess strong analytical and problem resolution skills Encourage teamwork and a positive environment to improve team effectiveness Be resourceful and can quickly and successfully adapt to change Education Currently be pursuing a bachelor's degree Preferred majors in the following related degrees, Risk Management & Insurance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics Have a college graduation date between May 2021 and August 2022 Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our Co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), Co-chairman Erik Anderson (Chairman of Top Golf and Founder of West River Group), Board Member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisors Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay) and Scott Maw (CFO of Starbucks), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice Founder and Felicis Ventures), Mike Repole (Founder of Vitamin Water and Body Armor) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and Founders Fund), and other fun athletes and musicians including John Elway, Aaron Rodgers, Larry Fitzgerald, Nas, Charles Kelley (Lady Antebellum), Leann Rimes and Darius Rucker amongst many others.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits Paid vacation and holidays Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  XC8Aj6M4aB

description: THE PROFILE  Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a leading global specialty retailer of high-quality, casual apparel for men, women and kids with an active, youthful lifestyle under its Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, and Hollister Co. brands. A&F was founded in 1892 and is based in New Albany, Ohio. A&F sells merchandise through retail stores in the United States, Canada, Europe, Asia, Mexico, and the Middle East. The Company also operates e-commerce websites at www. abercrombie.com, www. abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com  THE JOB  The Hollister associate is truly engaged. They provide great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer needs. An individual who is outgoing, stylish, and helpful. They demonstrate a keen awareness of the store environment by ensuring they always remain approachable and warm. They are able to initiate conversations and connect with the customer by communicating in a genuine and articulate way; that ensures the customer is always the first priority. Demon- strates relatable, confident and highly social behaviors on the sales floor that translate into closing the sale.  What It Takes Adaptability / Flexibility Stress Tolerance Applied Learning Attention to Detail Multi-Tasking Work Ethic  What You’ll Do Customer Experience Store Presentation and Sales Floor Communication Asset Protection and Shrink Policies and Procedures Training and Development  Powered by JazzHR  RUVDJGE5QG

description: Sales and Marketing Intern We are looking for an experienced and creative person to join the sales and marketing team of a fast-growing, sports-related, startup tech company.  You will be responsible for assisting and developing sales and marketing strategies to help us grow among our various audiences - college sports fans, college athletes and local/national brands/small businesses.   Job duties and responsibilities . Contributes information, ideas, and research to help develop marketing strategies Develops sales strategies and approaches for various products and services, such as special promotions, sponsored events, etc. Analyzes and creates a plan for engaging the target market Execute the brand image of the company Perform other duties and projects as assigned  Job requirements and qualifications  <2 years of experience in marketing/sales Knowledge of collegiate sports world Excellent multitasking and self motivation skills Critical thinker and problem-solving skills Team player yet self governed and motivated Good time-management skills Great interpersonal, communication and writing skills Creative thinker willing to suggest new ideas for increased engagement   Job will begin as an internship with the opportunity to turn into a full time role.

description: Tom James Company - Sales Internship Opportunity  SPRING 2022 SALES INTERNSHIP REQUIREMENTS: Internship is 20+ hours/week for 8 weeks. It will be completed on Tuesday and Thursday with choice of AM or PM option: AM option is 7:30 am – 11:30 am CST (adjust based on your time zone) PM option is 12:30 pm – 4:30 pm CST (adjust based on your time zone). Additional 12 hours per week are set based on Intern and office availability Internship is available to start in any month Internship is $15/hour plus Commission Candidates must be graduating by December 2022 and live in the area of the internship and desire a career in sales in that location upon graduation. Candidates must be eligible to work in the US and not require sponsorship Visa status now or in the future. SUMMER 2022 SALES INTERNSHIP REQUIREMENTS: Internship is 28 hours and will be completed Monday - Thursday 7:30 - 3:30 each day. 8 weeks long and can begin in June or July Internship is $15/hour plus Commission Candidates must be graduating by May 2023 and live, or have housing, in the area of the internship Candidates must have a desire for a career in sales in that same location upon graduation Candidates must be eligible to work in the US and not require sponsorship Visa status now or in the future. OUR OPPORTUNITY:  The goal of the Internship program is to provide you with a real life glimpse into our full-time role of a Sales Professional and also to enable you to eventually complete the Tom James sales cycle process with a prospect from initial interaction through final delivery.  The primary areas of focus for our internships will be: No previous industry knowledge is required; just a desire to sell and succeed Prospect clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including Zoom Info & LinkedIn Sales Navigator to find and reach out to potential clients Direct/Indirect Referral Concepts: generate referrals through current and potential clients to create warmer leads Phone Skills & Dials: 50+ dials/week, with a goal to set around 5 appointments/week Access to Technology including a Chromebook, prospecting platforms, communication platforms, and CRM Independently develop clientele: build your clientele throughout the summer, with those prospected being returned to you, providing you return as a full-time hire. Field knowledge: follow your mentor as they go on appointments, measure clients, and prospect directly in the field. Work with your mentor to sell people whom you've prospected and set appointments with. TRAINING:  Your first week is virtual, classroom training in the store that you were hired in. Additional training will continue on Tuesday and Thursdays throughout the remaining 7 weeks.  TOM JAMES:  Tom James Company has more than 50 years of direct selling expertise in the custom clothing industry. We have grown from a single store to stores throughout 4 continents and more than $500 million in sales.  Our sales force consists of highly motivated, service and sales minded professionals that strive for growth and leadership. By finding and developing long-term, loyal customers, our people build lifestyles to support their personal and professional goals. Our customers are highly successful, busy professionals who demand convenience, quality and excellent service in which we deliver to them.  We provide the training, opportunity and product to build a significant income through sales and leadership while establishing a strong net worth through our employee ownership and 401(k)/profit sharing programs.  We are vertically integrated which allows our Sales Professionals opportunities to grow their net worth and expand their careers.  Powered by JazzHR  5O4i0NSvie

description: Overview  ERT is hiring a Sales Operations Intern who will assist with the Proposal Management, Pricing, and Solutions teams with projects as needed to support the Commercial organization. This position will provide support through independent and team projects.  ERT is a global data and technology company that minimizes uncertainty and risk in clinical trials so that customers can move ahead with confidence. Since 2014, more than half of all FDA drug approvals came from ERT-supported studies. Pharma companies, biotechs and CROs have relied on ERT solutions in 10,000+ studies spanning more than three million patients to date. By identifying trial risks before they become problems, ERT enables customers to bring clinical treatments to patients quickly — and with confidence.  Responsibilities  As an Intern with our Sales Ops team, you will Assist with data gathering and metric reporting for Proposal Operations teams. Using a proposal management system and content database, prepare draft proposal documents and responses to requests for information. Complete budget creation as needed. Maintain data integrity and consistency, including product entry and file uploads to CRM tool. Assist with pricing tool testing as part of the development life cycle, as needed. Participate in departmental meetings. Interact with Business Development, Project Management, and Sales Associates in order to complete new project and Change Order estimates and budgets. Perform other duties, assignments, or special projects as needed. The duties and responsibilities listed in this job description represent the major responsibilities of the position. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned, as required. ERT reserves the right to amend or change this job description to meet the needs of ERT. This job description and any attachments do not constitute or represent a contract.  Qualifications  What we seek - Must have strong attention to detail with strong analytical and interpersonal skills. Exceptional computer skills (MS office suite minimum). Exceptional organizational skills. Excellent communication with the ability to work as a part of a team as well as individual contributor. Be in prsuit of Bachelor’s degree in business, communications, marketing, or a closely related field is strongly preferred. However, any equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform job duties may be considered. Experience in fast-paced environment with an ability to work independently and cross-functionally as needed is considered a plus. ERT is a growing and rewarding place to advance your career, especially for those who are passionate about finding solutions that improve lives – or save lives – for millions of people around the world. Our success starts with caring and collaborative people, from the recent college grad who’s just getting started to the seasoned professional with a wealth of knowledge, skills and experience. Together, we’re making a difference.  ERT is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. All are welcome - join us!

description: Founded in late 2019, Sperax is a global technology firm building modern money with blockchain technology. With the Sperax token (SPA) at its core, Sperax is building a yield bearing stablecoin, USDs, that synergizes the best of all widely-adopted stablecoin strategies. In addition to USDs, we are developing a suite of DeFi products which will be integrated with our mobile app, Sperax Play. As a one-click portal for the general masses to elevate their financial well-being through crypto products, Sperax Play will serve as a bridge for the world to access the cryptoverse all in one place!  Sperax has received $7 million in early funding from a suite of investors who envision global impact. Members of our team work and communicate on an international schedule, blending our personal lives with the rich enthusiasm and vigor to grow Sperax. We currently have offices in New York, San Francisco, Michigan, Chicago, Singapore, India, and China, and Sperax is also expanding in Europe.  Roles And Responsibilities Execute marketing plans with various marketing channels Be familiar with Sperax’s products and information To be involved in Sales and promotion activities Deliver new concepts, ideas, technologies, and themes to expand key digital metrics such as reach, engagement and conversion Conduct in-depth market research & sales analysis Qualifications / Skills: Undergraduate students or fresh graduates in Business or other related disciplines Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast paced, deadline driven environment Passionate to outreach Blockchain/ Cryptocurrency products  What We Offer  Competitive salary and token plan  Medical, dental, and vision insurance  401k plan  Work visa (H1B etc.) applications  Multicultural work environment  Beautiful office space in NYC Soho  Equal Opportunity  We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. What makes us different, makes us special. Apply today and let us know what makes you unique!

description: Internship  EMS LINQ is a software company that offers comprehensive financial and operational management for school systems in a single software package. We are looking for a team of superstar Interns to help us build a database of Customer and Prospect information. We are seeking sharp, marketing-minded individuals with data analysis and/or research skills. Primary duties of this paid internship include utilizing a variety of techniques to collect and analyze large amounts of data. The database will be used to identify sales and marketing opportunities and aid our product management by providing key competitive insights.  This position is a paid internship. Qualified candidates who demonstrate proficiency and willingness to take on other responsibilities may be offered a full-time position in our Sales/Marketing department or might have other opportunities based on our hiring needs. Preferred Skills Strong entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to be flexible and part of a growing and empowered team Strong communication and interpersonal skills; highly motivated, able to handle adversity and client rejection Must be self-motivated and open to learning and sharing new ideas Strong follow-up skills - obtaining data from customers may take several attempts Must be organized with follow-up techniques to collect as much data as possible with the least amount of effort from the customer. description: Company Description  Who We Are  Now in our 14th year, inSegment is a Boston-based full service digital marketing agency that covers every base for our clients. From lead generation to SEO, PPC to ABM strategies, web development to content and much more, our team is a creative and collaborative powerhouse. We bridge the gap between pristine data-driven strategy and brilliant invention in an industry too often bogged down by incomplete, imbalanced approaches. As we continue to expand, we're looking for a Sales and Development Intern to make a difference in our ongoing development projects and keep our business pipeline active and engaged. No prior marketing experience is necessary, and you'll be able to work fully remotely with team members from all over the world.  Job Description  Are you a recent graduate looking to sharpen your sales skills in a dynamic, supportive environment? Are you interested in gaining valuable experience in digital marketing but aren't sure where to start? If this applies to you or you're simply looking to make a positive step in a new direction, we're eager to hear from you.  What You'll Do You will play a key role in driving leads, profiling prospects, and contributing directly to company growth Hone your sales skills within a supportive and informative team that will bend over backwards to help you succeed Identify and analyze challenges to come up with concrete solutions Sharpen your sales prospecting and customer advocacy skills Work with passion and positivity to support both your fellow team members and clients alike What We Offer Hands-on, resume-building work experience at an award-winning agency A dedicated and incredibly talented team that will help you learn the ins and outs of digital marketing, lead generation, and client support in a fun and collaborative environment Unlimited growth potential - if you're a good fit and eager to move into bigger roles within the company we'll support you 100%. Although entry-level, our Sales and Development Intern role is a fantastic way to start putting down roots in a company with long term vision and a proven track record. A permanently and fully remote workplace that will never ask you to trudge into an office. No pandemic office policies to juggle, no transit slogs, just work and communication from the comfort of any location you choose. If you have a sales hunter mentality and a passion for making a positive and measurable impact on a daily basis, we want to meet you.  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Tom James Company - Internship Opportunity  POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Internship is 20+ hours and will be completed on Tuesday/Thursday with choice of 7:30 am – 11:30 am CST or 12:30 pm – 4:30 pm CST. Additional hours are set based on Intern and office availability. *This internship can start in any month of the year and lasts 8 weeks. Internship is $12/hour plus Commission Candidate must be graduating by December 2022 and live, or have housing, in the area of the internship and desire a career in sales in that location upon graduation. Candidate must be eligible to work in the US and not require sponsorship Visa status now or in the future.  OUR OPPORTUNITY:  The goal of the Internship program is to provide you with a real life glimpse into our full-time role of a Sales Professional and also to enable you to eventually complete the Tom James sales cycle process with a prospect from initial interaction through final delivery.  The primary areas of focus for our internships will be: No previous industry knowledge is required; just a desire to sell and succeed Prospect clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including Zoom Info & LinkedIn Sales Navigator to find and reach out to potential clients Direct/Indirect Referral Concepts: generate referrals through current and potential clients to create warmer leads Phone Skills & Dials: 50+ dials/week, with a goal to set around 5 appointments/week Access to Technology including a Chromebook, prospecting platforms, communication platforms, and CRM Independently develop clientele: build your clientele throughout the summer, with those prospected being returned to you, providing you return as a full-time hire. Field knowledge: follow your mentor as they go on appointments, measure clients, and prospect directly in the field. Work with your mentor to sell people whom you've prospected and set appointments with.  TRAINING:  Your first week is virtual, classroom training in the store that you were hired in. Additional training will continue on Tuesday and Thursdays throughout the remaining 7 weeks.  TOM JAMES:  Tom James Company has more than 50 years of direct selling expertise in the custom clothing industry. We have grown from a single store to stores throughout 4 continents and more than $500 million in sales.  Our sales force consists of highly motivated, service and sales minded professionals that strive for growth and leadership. By finding and developing long-term, loyal customers, our people build lifestyles to support their personal and professional goals. Our customers are highly successful, busy professionals who demand convenience, quality and excellent service in which we deliver to them.  We provide the training, opportunity and product to build a significant income through sales and leadership while establishing a strong net worth through our employee ownership and 401(k)/profit sharing programs.  We are vertically integrated which allows our Sales Professionals opportunities to grow their net worth and expand their careers.  Powered by JazzHR  fVKXqQoMRk

Location: Hershey, PA  Duration: Spring 2022  What is a Customer Strategy & Sales Planning Full Time Intern?  This position works with Customer Strategy & Sales Planning managers and senior managers on developing sales strategies and plans to achieve annual sales and profitability objectives.
