description: Additional Locations:  Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance  At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.  Internship Overview  The purpose of the Medical Device Sales Internship is to introduce students to our exciting and fast-paced Endoscopy Commercial Organization. The goal of the internship is designed to give participants exposure and to obtain an understanding of the diverse functions across the organization including Marketing, R&D, Sales Training and Healthcare Economics. This internship is based out of our Marlborough, MA corporate headquarters.  Key Responsibilities Assist the team in developing objectives to maintain market share and increase the quality of service to customers. Advance our mission of transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients around the world. Participate in hospital visits, on-site and field training workshops alongside Field Sales Representatives. Maintain accurate records of sales expenses, customer files and field sales reports required. Conduct all sales activities according to Travel & Entertainment (T&E) guidelines, Industry and Integrity Policies. Research, develop and present a project solution at conclusion of internship. This internship will begin Mid-May and conclude August 2018.  Qualifications: Successful candidates meet the following minimum qualifications: Rising Junior or Senior students currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program in Business / Engineering, or other technical / relevant coursework Strong record of academic achievement and leadership experiences Demonstrate analytical, technical, communication and problem solving skills Able to build and maintain strong customer relationships Must be energetic, enthusiastic, determined and goal oriented Legally authorized to work in the U.S. on a full time basis  Requisition ID: 505937  As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.  So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!  At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve. Boston Scientific is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.  Boston Scientific maintains a drug-free workplace. Pursuant to Va. Code 2.2-4312 (2000), Boston Scientific is providing notification that the unlawful manufacture, sale, distribution, dispensation, possession, or use of a controlled substance or marijuana is prohibited in the workplace and that violations will result in disciplinary action up to and including termination.
industries: Medical Devices

description: APPLICATIONS WITHOUT A COVER LETTER WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.  Real Estate Acquisitions Analyst - Intern, Fall/Winter 2021  In this role, you will be an integral part of the transactions team at Clear Capital, LLC and participate in all facets of underwriting and acquiring multi-housing real estate investments. Our values are Excellence, Integrity, Transparency, Truth, and Growth so you will be challenged to improve both professionally and personally every day you are working alongside our tight-knit team. The transaction team’s mission is to put the firm’s investors first and approach every investment it makes with an in-depth understanding of how each investment will deliver real economic profit as well as preserve capital while improving the community in which the property sits. If you want to be part of a team that is collaborative, invested in your success and growth, and that will help you take your skills to the next level, apply to our Fall/Winter 2021 Internship.  Important Application Information  Compensation: $18.00-$22.00 Per Hour.  Program Length: The approximate dates of this internship are October 2021- March 2022.  Availability: Interns must be available to work full time hours (approximately 40 hours per week) and be fully available for the duration of the internship.  Housing: Interns must provide their own housing for the duration of their internship program.  Transportation: Interns must have reliable transportation to get to and from work for the duration of their internship program.  Hybrid Format: This internship is not a fully remote position. Interns will be expected to work from Clear Capital, LLC’s Los Angeles office in Westwood for training and then may work remotely after the training is completed. Exceptions may apply.  Required Materials: PDF Version of Resume, Cover Letter  APPLICATIONS WITHOUT A COVER LETTER WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.  Company And Program Background  Clear Capital is a private equity real estate investment firm specializing in direct equity investments in multi-family real estate. We focus on identifying, acquiring, improving, and monetizing apartment assets throughout the West and Sunbelt regions of the US. Clear Capital currently owns over 4,500 units spread across over 25 communities in 6 states on behalf of its investors’ and the company’s funds.  Clear Capital is seeking a Real Estate Acquisitions Intern that is passionate about multi-family real estate, hungry to learn, and that wants to grow with our company. We take a mentorship approach with our Interns and teach our talented team members the entire process we use to successfully acquire properties on behalf of our investors. Through this role, you will gain the skills, understanding, and expertise to analyze and underwrite acquisitions and you will be exposed to transactional due diligence, capital raising, financing, and the closing process.  During your time here, you will support the transactions team by performing market research and sourcing and maintaining information in key databases. You will also underwrite prospective acquisitions, assist during the due diligence and closing process, and provide ad-hoc support for special projects across the company’s various departments. Interns are expected to be quick thinkers with excellent communication and interpersonal skills that can solve problems, overdeliver on all expectations, and maintain a genuine positive attitude.  Responsibilities  Property Identification and Underwriting Complete transaction screening, and contact investment sales professionals to gather key data to utilize in creating property and investment summaries Assist the Analysts and VP of Acquisitions in underwriting new acquisitions by researching property comps, analyzing financial statements, building operating and capital budgets, conducting submarket research, and sourcing other relevant information within target markets Apply standard analytical processes to create detailed financial investment cash flow models to determine whether opportunities meet/exceed the company’s investment criteria Property Acquisition Assist in the coordination of the due diligence process for new acquisitions, including assisting in the review of third party reports, compiling market analyses, completing rental surveys, assisting during property inspections, and helping with other items as required Maintain and update acquisition pipeline reporting and other exhibits for team meetings Review key financial exhibits and provide complete analyses to senior management for prospective acquisitions Prepare summaries of market research, financial analysis, and due diligence in preparation for all individual and team acquisition meetings Other Database management Market research Ad-hoc financial modeling Basic Qualifications Passion for or strong demonstrated interest in multi-family real estate Hardworking, analytical, detail-oriented and organized Track record of personal, educational, and professional success Excellent organizational skills with the ability to work on multiple projects in an efficient manner to meet all deadlines Excellent innovative thinking and problem-solving skills A “get it done now” approach with a “whatever it takes” mentality Excellent skills in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Excellent internet research skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent management communication skills with the ability to "manage up" and seek help, clarification, and prioritization of tasks from senior members of the firm Ability to work independently and with guidance from senior management Ability to work under pressure and in a time sensitive environment Required Education Or Experience Junior or Senior pursuing an undergraduate degree with coursework in Business, Finance, Economics, and/or Real Estate Recent graduate with a bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, and/or Real Estate; Graduate degree a plus Real estate financial analysis and underwriting experience a plus Excel financial modeling experience a plus 1-2 years of real estate or finance (equivalent) experience a plus Skills Strong interpersonal skills and team oriented with a positive attitude Desire to learn new skills and take on challenges Creative problem solver with great learning agility Good communication skills Attitude Passion for Clear Capital's mission Responsible and Independent Committed to Excellence Committed to Growth Integrity Transparent Communicator Passionate and Driven Professionally Mature Entrepreneurial Approach with an Ownership Mentality An understanding that every single detail matters Sense of Humor Clear Capital is a real estate private equity investment firm headquartered in Los Angeles, CA. The company is focused on acquiring, managing, repositioning, and monetizing multi-housing assets across the United States. At present, the company owns and operates 4,500+ units spread across 25 communities in 6 states. The company is in full growth-mode and will be acquiring new assets annually providing advancement opportunities for all strong team members.
industries: Commercial Real Estate, Financial Services, and Real Estate

description: LINQM, top Inc 5000 Company 2020 (fastest growing companies). We are looking to add Interns that are looking for careers in recruiting or looking to learn about sales.  Someone that is hungry for more, someone that wants to help business find solutions The right person will want to work hard to grow in their career - we offer quick growth for those that are able to keep up. Wants to come into an office right we are in Mission Viejo. Ability to commute to Mission Viejo (less than 30 minutes) Someone that wants to enter the business world as we have the opportunity to work with multiple companies on multiple positions  The Position  This person will spend the bulk of their day on technical platforms researching and messaging local and relevant professionals. You will be responsible for building out networks of talent that our recruiting staff will utilize during their day to day. Daily will be working with companies and candidates making matches and finding solutions Make calls. Don't worry we believe Cold Calling is DEAD - We don't do it! We are glad to show you why it's less impactful than our other methods. You will average 10 - 50 calls daily max. We get through extreme volume however protect our time and get on the phone when we feel very confident there is something there worth calling for.  What We Offer  Hourly - Salary Pay Business casual working environment, fun environment, opportunity to learn about the best business!!! Company issued laptop (dual screen set up for when you are in the office) Company issued cell phone Flexible work from home/office as needed once you are hitting minimum quota. Unlimited PTO policy. Get to profitability and take all the time off you need as long as your numbers remain profitable

description: A CourseCareers partner company is hiring a sales development intern with a high likelihood to transition into a permanent sales development rep making $60,000+. This company is in the  property data industry. This is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door in an entry-level technology sales position.  The internship is remote and pays $15-20/hr based on location and experience. Monday-Friday 40 hours/week.  Our partner company requires that you must first go through our technology sales program where you will learn everything about technology sales before having access to their internship opportunity.  On average people who go through our program make about $60,000 in their first year once they complete their internship and potentially $100,000+ in the following years. If you’re interested in this internship or starting a career in tech sales then click the apply button to go through our free introduction course to learn how you can start your career in tech sales! You can live in any city in the US. Click the apply button above to get started.

description: Tom James Company - Sales Internship Opportunity  SUMMER 2022 SALES INTERNSHIP REQUIREMENTS: Internship is 28 hours and will be completed Monday - Thursday 7:30 - 3:30 each day. 8 weeks long and can begin in June or July Internship is $12/hour plus Commission Candidates must be graduating by May 2023 and live, or have housing, in the area of the internship Candidates must have a desire for a career in sales in that same location upon graduation Candidates must be eligible to work in the US and not require sponsorship Visa status now or in the future. OUR OPPORTUNITY:  The goal of the Internship program is to provide you with a real life glimpse into our full-time role of a Sales Professional and also to enable you to eventually complete the Tom James sales cycle process with a prospect from initial interaction through final delivery.  The primary areas of focus for our internships will be: No previous industry knowledge is required; just a desire to sell and succeed Prospect clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including Zoom Info & LinkedIn Sales Navigator to find and reach out to potential clients Direct/Indirect Referral Concepts: generate referrals through current and potential clients to create warmer leads Phone Skills & Dials: 50+ dials/week, with a goal to set around 5 appointments/week Access to Technology including a Chromebook, prospecting platforms, communication platforms, and CRM Independently develop clientele: build your clientele throughout the summer, with those prospected being returned to you, providing you return as a full-time hire. Field knowledge: follow your mentor as they go on appointments, measure clients, and prospect directly in the field. Work with your mentor to sell people whom you've prospected and set appointments with. TRAINING:  Your first week is virtual, classroom training in the store that you were hired in. Additional training will continue on Tuesday and Thursdays throughout the remaining 7 weeks.  TOM JAMES:  Tom James Company has more than 50 years of direct selling expertise in the custom clothing industry. We have grown from a single store to stores throughout 4 continents and more than $500 million in sales.  Our sales force consists of highly motivated, service and sales minded professionals that strive for growth and leadership. By finding and developing long-term, loyal customers, our people build lifestyles to support their personal and professional goals. Our customers are highly successful, busy professionals who demand convenience, quality and excellent service in which we deliver to them.  We provide the training, opportunity and product to build a significant income through sales and leadership while establishing a strong net worth through our employee ownership and 401(k)/profit sharing programs.  We are vertically integrated which allows our Sales Professionals opportunities to grow their net worth and expand their careers.  Powered by JazzHR  YWXsTgp8OC

You will be expected to lay out a plan with your individual project sponsors and decide on a final deliverable  You will have the opportunity to work closely with one of the following GE Healthcare businesses or functions:  Magnetic Resonance (MR), Computed Tomography (CT), Molecular Imaging (MI), Ultrasound, X-ray, GEHC Partners/Consulting, Healthcare Digital, Maternal Infant Care, Patient Monitoring, Anesthesia, Service Sales, Interventional, Marketing, Commercial Operations. In addition you will be expected to attend roundtables with influential GE executives, gain exposure to sales professionals and skills, and present your project work to managers and peers.  Qualifications/Requirements   Current Sophomore or Junior classification Must be enrolled full-time (the semester after you work) at an accredited college or university Able to work for a minimum of 10 weeks Relocate for summer 2022 to one of GE Healthcare Regional Hubs; typically Milwaukee  Desired Characteristics   Demonstrated leadership, communication and analytical skills Desire to work in the Healthcare industry Demonstrated interest in a sales career within the healthcare industry Coachable and focused on personal development Results oriented Strong time management skills Ability to adapt Proven self-starter  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our Co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), Co-chairman Erik Anderson (Chairman of Top Golf and Founder of West River Group), Board Member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisors Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay) and Scott Maw (CFO of Starbucks), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice Founder and Felicis Ventures), Mike Repole (Founder of Vitamin Water and Body Armor) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and Founders Fund), and other fun athletes and musicians including John Elway, Aaron Rodgers, Larry Fitzgerald, Nas, Charles Kelley (Lady Antebellum), Leann Rimes and Darius Rucker amongst many others.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits Paid vacation and holidays 401K Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  8P547GU0pF

We will arm you with the best products, support personnel, and tools to ensure long-term success with Affinity Integrated Solutions.  Affinity Integrated Solutions, Inc. is one of the largest dealers of home security and home automation in the country. We are expanding our sales team. description: We believe smarter technology takes a global mindset with trust and respect for one another, enabling us to do exciting and rewarding work that intelligently transforms our world. LASR is looking for passionate and driven individuals that are willing to learn!  Are you ready to take the next steps to accelerate your career growth? If so, the LASR (Lenovo Accelerated Sales Rotational) Intern Program is the right opportunity for you! Are you a top university student who is tech-savvy and wants to pursue a career in the tech sales industry? Are you competitive and entrepreneurial in spirit? If so, it is no better time than the present to apply today for this dynamic internship program that will jump-start your career.  The LASR internship will allow you the opportunity to be placed in one of the following areas of Lenovo’s business: Customer Experience, Sales Support, Marketing, Technical Client Advisory, Categories (Product/Programs/Partners), Finance or Supply Chain. The position responsibilities will vary based on the area of the organization your internship resides. You will have an opportunity to work and collaborate with various groups within the sales organization to solve real business problems.  Throughout the internship, you will have great on-the-job learning and mentorship. This internship also offers exposure to full-time opportunities with Lenovo upon graduation.  Multiple positions are available.  Position Requirements: • Ability to live or commute to Lenovo, Morrisville, NC for the duration of the summer internship. (June 1st-Aug 7th {Dates may be flexible}) • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a graduation date of December 2021 - May 2022  Preferred Requirements: • GPA that is above 3.2 is strongly preferred • Preferred Degree/Majors: Business Analytics, Marketing, STEM related, Marketing & Sales, Finance, Economics, Entrepreneurship, Communications, Human Resources, Business Administration, and Supply Chain Management • Excellent analytical abilities • Demonstrated leadership capabilities in professional, academic, or volunteer environments • Exceptional verbal and written communications and presentation skills • Professional maturity, strong work ethic and the ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing business needs  Some of the benefits of interning at Lenovo include competitive compensation, enrichment and development programs, and access to a global network of peers and mentors. Learn more by following us on social media @LenovoLASR on Instagram and Twitter, and by searching Lenovo LASR on Facebook and LinkedIn!  Aren’t ready to apply or have additional questions? Feel free to connect with us on LinkedIn or reach out to campushiring@lenovo.com.

description: Tallo is looking for an organized, and motivated sales support intern to help make our business development process more efficient and help increase the number of future Tallo partners.  In this role, you will collaborate with Tallo's Business Development Team to find new business, collegiate, and organizational partners. You will also help improve the overall sales funnel and support individualized projects to drive demand. You will learn, work hard, gain experience, and get paid. Oh, and did we mention that you would get to work for a cool tech company that’s making a difference in the world?  Tallo is an online platform that connects talent (e.g., you) with opportunities (e.g., colleges, companies, and organizations who want to pay you for being awesome). Go to tallo.com to learn more.  Location: Remote or in Charleston, SC  Duration: September - December 2021 (flexible)  Hours: Max 40 hours/week, Monday – Friday  Responsibilities Here is a list of things you might work on. Maybe you will work on all of them, maybe you won’t. If any of these responsibilities sound like something you are interested in, please apply!  ●    Build and manage prospecting lists and projects in CRM, as needed ●    Conduct industry research and identify areas of opportunity for BD team ●    Prospecting and manage initial outreach as well as meeting coordination and scheduling ●    Participate in sales meetings to document next steps and assist sales reps with follow-up ●    Participate in strategy development for new areas of opportunity ●    Provide other general support for our team  Requirements We are looking for a college upperclassmen or recent college graduate who can commit to 40 hours a week…or someone with similar experience.  Must Have: ○    An awesome attitude and personal drive ○    Amazing attention to detail and appreciation for standardization and organization ○    Excellent listening and communication skills ○    Enjoys helping others when they are in need ○    A team mentality and works well with others. We are a family at Tallo and only as good as our relationships with each other ○    Loves to create processes and looks for any way something can be done easier or better ○    Desire to gain experience in a fast-paced start-up environment with a growing tech company ○    Solution oriented mindset ○    Proactive rather than reactive  Preferred: ○    Experience in marketing, business development, sales or customer service ○    Experience in database management and data optimization ○    A good sense of humor (We work hard…but we also like to have fun and laugh a lot)

Job Description Summary  The Commercial Leadership Program Internship (CLPi) is a 10-week summer program designed to recruit top students from a wide range of majors with a strong interest in sales and the healthcare industry. The internship is used to retain promising students by promoting them into the full time CLP program upon graduationGE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job DescriptionEssential Responsibilities  As a Commercial Leadership Program Intern you will be assigned various projects that pertain to different parts of the business at GE Healthcare. You will be expected to lay out a plan with your individual project sponsors and decide on a final deliverable  You will have the opportunity to work closely with one of the following GE Healthcare businesses or functions:  Magnetic Resonance (MR), Computed Tomography (CT), Molecular Imaging (MI), Ultrasound, X-ray, GEHC Partners/Consulting, Healthcare Digital, Maternal Infant Care, Patient Monitoring, Anesthesia, Service Sales, Interventional, Marketing, Commercial Operations. In addition you will be expected to attend roundtables with influential GE executives, gain exposure to sales professionals and skills, and present your project work to managers and peers.  Qualifications/Requirements   Current Sophomore or Junior classification Must be enrolled full-time (the semester after you work) at an accredited college or university Able to work for a minimum of 10 weeks Relocate for summer 2022 to one of GE Healthcare Regional Hubs; typically Milwaukee  Desired Characteristics   Demonstrated leadership, communication and analytical skills Desire to work in the Healthcare industry Demonstrated interest in a sales career within the healthcare industry Coachable and focused on personal development Results oriented Strong time management skills Ability to adapt Proven self-starter  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes

description: MINT MOBILE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM  We’re looking for a rock-star Intern, Strategic Finance to join our dynamic and amazing Finance Team . If you excelled in your statistical analysis courses and love to identify themes in large data sets, we wanna talk to you!  This is a paid internship starting in September 2021 and ending in December 2021 with potential conversion to Full Time employment based on performance and business needs. This role will sit out of HQ Costa Mesa, CA office, must be local /commutable.  We are looking for candidates who are available to work 20-40 hours per week - we are ﬂexible with schedule and hours.  We are one of INC’s top 500 fastest growing companies and it’s an incredible time to be a part of our awesomeness. A-list celeb ✓ , Superbowl TV spot ✓ , Twitter battles ✓ Award-winning creative ✓  What You Can Gain  In this pivotal support role you will be exposed to all aspects of Finance including: building ﬁnancial data, learning to problem solve while building ﬁnancial models such Margin Analysis, Net Present Value, Internal Rate of Return, Pricing, Lifetime Value, and Discount/Promo analytics.  You will work collaboratively and will support our core teams in Sales, Channel Development, and Product for even more ﬁnancial well rounding! You will have an amazing opportunity to work directly with high level leaders including CFO to shape ﬁnancial initiatives for the company. This role oﬀers excellent career growth potential for an eager to learn and hands-on candidate.  YOU’LL GET TO Understand the fundamentals of modeling: you’ll get a high dosage of diﬀerent modeling disciplines - everything from statistical modeling to product mix analysis. Conduct market research to identify which products and services we should be oﬀering to our clients. This also includes reviewing what our competitors are doing and how we stay 2-steps ahead of them. OUR ROCK-STAR SHOULD BE Problem Solver: brings new innovative perspective and breaks down barriers with their solutions and ideas. Proactive: acts without being told what to do and provides an outline project plan of "what if" scenarios with problem solving abilities. Execution and follow through: moves quick while producing quality work, lives up to verbal and written agreements and gets work done. Project Management - can achieve goals, meet deadlines, and drive proﬁtability. Communicating with others to exchange information. Qualifications Currently Pursuing an undergraduate degree in Finance or related ﬁeld. Previous experience in Finance or related experience reviewing ﬁnancial data, building reports from diﬀerent sources. Ability to compile and create reports.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About ROCS Grad Staffing: We help businesses throughout the Northern VA and Washington DC Metropolitan areas find the top recent grad talent to fill all entry to junior level positions. We work with hundreds of the top businesses in the Northern Virginia and DC metro area and have helped thousands of recent grads find great opportunities to start their careers. We are growing fast and need some great people to join the ROCS Team - that's where you come in.  We been named on the 'Best Places to Work' by the Washington Business Journal for the past 4 years and named on the Inc. 500 list of fastest growing companies 5 times.  Working at ROCS Grad Staffing and why you'll love it: We only promote from within, you will have ample opportunity to grow and succeed. You'll get to be in our comprehensive training program; which gives you the opportunity to work with our founders, the ROCS team, clients, and students/grads We're a tight-knit group at ROCS, everyone truly supports each other. We strive to create a workplace that encourages community, impact, and growth. Competitive salary, uncapped commission, great benefits and perks.  What you'll do: We have multiple career paths in recruiting and sales. Most of the ROCS Team who start as a Recruiter advance into our Account Manager sales path.  Starting as a Recruiter You'll get to be in our hands-on training program; which gives you the opportunity to work with our founders, the ROCS team, clients, and students/grads Conduct the full-cycle interview process: review resumes, initial phone screens, check references, formal interviews, and job order closing Source candidates through various social media outlets (indeed, LinkedIn, etc.) Assist with our job fairs, recruiting kiosks, and tents Make new connections with your peers and faculty to recruit the best students on campus  Advancing into Account Management Communicate with clients and prospective clients through a variety of methods including: networking, cold calling, sales presentations, social media outlets, etc. Use a vast array of industry tools to identify prospective clients including: job boards, media outlets, etc. Consult with clients to assess their recruiting/hiring needs Provide communication between the client and ROCS Recruiter to obtain job orders, gather feedback, and fill open positions Create a daily quota plan tailored to meet telephone and client meeting activity metrics to ensure first-year success  Who We're Looking For: Bachelor's Degree from a four year university Highly driven individuals Someone who wants to help contribute in developing one of the fastest-growing startups in the Country Ability to develop strong relationships and interface with professionals Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills No unearned ego. Can take direction well and work independently for periods of time Outgoing, friendly, and approachable Eagerness to learn and willingness to jump into anything You have a positive “can do” attitude while assuming best intentions and aligning with organizational goals and team members  Some of the Benefits and Perks of Working at ROCS: We just moved into our awesome new office (check it out: https://www.instagram.com/p/B9VHR4OHLXd/) Everyone gets the latest and greatest gear and tools to work with - including a new MacBook Stocked pantry full of healthy foods, drinks, and other snacks Office Kegerator with Nitro Cold Brew Coffee and Local IPA's Have fun with your co-workers. Company lunches and Outings (https://www.instagram.com/rocsjobs/) Work at a young, award-winning company Your work will be meaningful- what you do actually matters Named one of the Best Places to Work by the Washington Business Journal 5 years in a row Huge career growth opportunities On-going Training and Career Development Unlimited PTO Great Health Benefits Great 401K plan with company match contributions  ROCS Grad Staffing is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis race, color, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, gender (including gender expression and gender identity), sexual orientation, age, weight, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, marital status, veteran status, political affiliation, or any other factor protected by federal, state or local law.  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: $45,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

THE PROFILE  Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a leading global specialty retailer of high-quality, casual apparel for men, women and kids with an active, youthful lifestyle under its Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, and Hollister Co. brands. A&F was founded in 1892 and is based in New Albany, Ohio. A&F sells merchandise through retail stores in the United States, Canada, Europe, Asia, Mexico, and the Middle East. The Company also operates e-commerce websites at www. abercrombie.com, www. abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com  THE JOB  The Hollister associate is truly engaged. They provide great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer needs. An individual who is outgoing, stylish, and helpful. They demonstrate a keen awareness of the store environment by ensuring they always remain approachable and warm. They are able to initiate conversations and connect with the customer by communicating in a genuine and articulate way; that ensures the customer is always the first priority. Demon- strates relatable, confident and highly social behaviors on the sales floor that translate into closing the sale.  What It Takes Adaptability / Flexibility Stress Tolerance Applied Learning Attention to Detail Multi-Tasking Work Ethic  What You’ll Do Customer Experience Store Presentation and Sales Floor Communication Asset Protection and Shrink Policies and Procedures Training and Development  Powered by JazzHR  LTooMDgTIu

description: K2 Integrity is seeking a marketing specialist to join the marketing department. The marking specialist will assist the marketing and business development teams in programming, helping to coordinate, support and execute marketing strategy and activities. This role will work on a global basis, closely coordinating with marketing teams in New York and London, as well as practitioners in other offices on marketing needs related to opportunities and selling support. We are seeking an energetic, highly organized, and creative individual to join our growing team.  Responsibilities: Manage maintenance of the firm’s website, including updating content, ensuring biographies, practice descriptions and thought leadership are updated, error free and within the firm’s style guidelines. Liaise with the firm’s website development vendor to implement site updates, design new content pages, and engage in quality control of the website. Coordinate part of the firm’s digital marketing strategies by developing, testing, sending, and reporting on email marketing campaigns. Support the management and maintenance of the firm’s client relationship and opportunity management platform, including maintaining and updating of marketing lists; providing support for data analytics and reporting projects; researching company and relationship data to support practitioners in their business development activities. Assist senior manager in drafting and collecting matter descriptions for use in pitches, proposals and rankings submissions. Maintain, update, and deliver business development materials and marketing collateral for pitch meetings and events, including brochures, practitioner bios, client newsletters and alerts, representative matters, etc. Oversee inventory of firm’s branded materials and maintain relationship with vendors to develop and order new materials as needed. Collaborate across the full marketing team as well as outside consultants and vendors to execute priority marketing campaigns, providing project management and creative input as needed.  Requirements Bachelor’s degree with proven academic excellence. Three - five years of experience working in marketing and/or business development within professional services industry. Extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office tools with an emphasis on Excel and Power Point capabilities. Experience working with website CMS platforms (Sitecore) and email marketing platforms (Concep) strongly preferred. Experience in marketing technology and CRM platforms such as HSO a plus. Self-starter, analytical and solution oriented, with strong organization, multi-tasking and time management skills. Excellent communication skills and a strong team ethic. Ability to interact professionally with office leadership and clients.
industries: Management Consulting

jobTitle: Sales, Trainees, Salary Plus Commission, $3500 Training Pay Plus
description: 5501 Market Street, Wilmington, NC 28405  AUTOMOTIVE SALES CONSULTANT  Guaranteed $3500 for 90 days!  Earnings Expectation to $100K+!  Sales experience in any field may qualify you!  Walk-In Applicants are Welcome!  Capital Nissan is proud to be one of the leading dealerships in Wilmington, NC. Formerly Nissan of Wilmington, NC, Capital Nissan is the go-to dealership for drivers from Wilmington, Wrightsville, Conway and Jacksonville, NC. Our general manager, Noah Woods, boasts nearly 20 years of experience in the automotive industry. He and the dedicated professionals at Capital Nissan continually maintain the positive reputation that Capital Automotive Group has built based on courteous, honest service.  At CAPITAL NISSAN of WILMINGTON sales are booming and we are hiring additional sales people to keep up with high consumer demand! As a new and pre-owned Automotive Sales Consultant, your income will match your efforts! A sales career at Capital Nissan is an excellent career choice for the right individuals with motivation and discipline to be the best!  We believe culture makes a difference and we strive to build lasting relationships with our employees, customers, and the community. We value our employees and invest in their success.  We Offer Guaranteed $3500 for 90 days! Base salary + Commission - Potential Income: $100K+ Medical and dental Insurance 401(k) Retirement Plan Paid Vacation 5-day work week! Weekend off once a month. Management Track Opportunity! Almost all of our managers are promoted from within our staff! Responsibilities - Sales Consultant Greet customer and determine make, type, and quality of vehicle desired. Explain features and demonstrate operation of vehicle. Compute and quote sales price, including tax, trade-in allowance, and discount. Arrange for delivery and registration of vehicle. Research availability of models and optional equipment. Ensure a satisfactory guest experience! Qualifications/Requirements - Sales Consultant Previous Automotive Sales Experience not required. If you have sales experience from other industries such as Restaurant industry, retail sales, insurance sales, or rental car associates, we would like to hear from you! Professional appearance and strong communications skills. Strong record of positive customer service results with customer focused attitude. Team oriented. Valid driver's license with good driving record. Resume must be uploaded, and online assessment completed for immediate consideration. Must pass pre-employment testing to include background checks, MVR, and drug screen. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

description: Job ID  27823  Posted  13-Aug-2021  Service line  Advisory Segment  Role type  Full-time  Areas of Interest  Valuations/ Appraisal  Location(s)  Newport Beach - California - United States of America  About CBRE  With broader and deeper capabilities than any other company, CBRE is the leading full-service real estate services and investment organization in the world. A CBRE internship gives you a unique opportunity to get a head start in the commercial real estate industry by working alongside some of our top producing professionals. Our associates will gain valuable real-life experience and learn the business by working on CBRE projects.  CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm (based on 2020 revenues) with more than 100,000 employees (excluding affiliates). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #128 in 2021. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 20 consecutive years and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” in the real estate sector for nine years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE”.  The company serves real estate investors and occupiers through approximately 530+ offices worldwide (excluding affiliates). CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services.  Responsibilities  This internship is designed for current college students, undergraduate or graduate seeking a career in commercial real estate. Participation in the program is intended to provide a well-rounded knowledge of the commercial real estate business and valuable skills, earned by working alongside talented professionals in the largest and most successful global commercial real estate services firm.  The internship accelerates your learning and development by providing you with a strong foundation upon which to build your commercial real estate career. The program provides you with a unique perspective on our integrated service lines. As a program participant, you will also partake in learning and development activities designed especially for you.  Responsibilities May Include  Conduct company, property and industry-specific research Manage and update prospects in an internal tracking database  Assist in developing and preparing commercial real estate appraisal reports.  Track local and regional activity, e.g., economy, employment statistics, major company activity, industry trends and demographics that affect the local real estate market  Contribute to special projects in support of business development  Provide ongoing support with current deals, including market surveys, proposal reviews and summaries, lease reviews, financial analysis  Qualifications  This internship is designed for candidates with a strong academic background, preferably in business or real estate. Applicants should be self-motivated, creative and disciplined, seeking to excel in the commercial real estate industry.  Current college junior, senior, or graduate level student Desire to work in the commercial real estate industry  Experience with MS Office with preferred experience in Excel & Word  Strong writing skills  Ability to network and develop strong relationships Detail-oriented and highly organized  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Solid written and oral communication skills Ability to work independently and collaboratively  To be considered for a position with CBRE, please apply online at http://cbre.com/careers. Click on “Search and Apply” on the left side of the screen. If a pop-up window does not open, please check your browser’s settings. On the login window either login with your existing username and password or click on “Register Today” to create one. Once you are logged in you can either apply for specific jobs or submit your general application using the link at the bottom of the page.  EOE & AA Employer M/F/D/V  CBRE is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.  NOTE: An additional requirement for this role is the ability to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing.

description: Aruza is a competitive direct sales internship that specializes in training and growth of our interns. Our philosophy is to constantly coach our interns throughout the summer so they can fully maximize their time with us. We believe in a growth mindset and learning from experience and mistakes.  Aruza has hosted over 150 interns in the past 5 years and is one of the fastest growing companies in the service industry.  We offer housing, a competitive pay scale with bonuses and incentives, as well as a sport like season competition period throughout the summer.  We are looking for extremely motivated and hard working individuals that excel in competitive atmospheres. No experience is necessary. Work hard and we will teach you to succeed. Earn $15,000+ in a summer.  Message me for details.

jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits 401K Paid vacation and holidays Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  PR16ZIw0C3

description: The Company  Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (NYSE: ANF) is a leading, global specialty retailer of apparel and accessories for men, women and kids through five renowned brands. The iconic Abercrombie & Fitch brand was born in 1892 and aims to make every day feel as exceptional as the start of a long weekend. abercrombie kids sees the world through kids’ eyes, where play is life and every day is an opportunity to be anything and better anything. The Hollister brand believes in liberating the spirit of an endless summer inside everyone and making teens feel celebrated and comfortable in their own skin. Gilly Hicks, offering intimates, loungewear and sleepwear, is designed to invite everyone to embrace who they are underneath it all. Social Tourist, the creative vision of Hollister and social media personalities, Dixie and Charli D’Amelio, offers trend forward apparel that allows teens to experiment with their style, while exploring the duality of who they are both on social media and in real life.  The brands share a commitment to offering products of enduring quality and exceptional comfort that allow consumers around the world to express their own individuality and style. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. operates approximately 730 stores under these brands across North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East, as well as the e-commerce sites  The Job  The Hollister associate is truly engaged. They provide great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer needs. An individual who is outgoing, stylish, and helpful. They demonstrate a keen awareness of the store environment by ensuring they always remain approachable and warm. They are able to initiate conversations and connect with the customer by communicating in a genuine and articulate way; that ensures the customer is always the first priority. Demonstrates relatable, confident and highly social behaviors on the sales floor that translate into closing the sale.  What You’ll Get Merchandise Discount Flexible Schedule Opportunities for Career Advancement Opportunity to Become a Brand Affiliate Training and Development A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU  The hourly pay range for this position is $12.30 to $14.75 per hour  What It Takes Adaptability / Flexibility Applied Learning Attention to Detail Multi-Tasking Work Ethic  What You’ll Do Customer Experience Store Presentation and Sales Floor Communication Asset Protection and Shrink Policies and Procedures Training and Development  FIND A STORE IN YOUR AREA & APPLY AT CAREERS.HOLLISTERCO.COM  SEE WHAT IT’S LIKE TO #WORKATHCO - FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM @WORKATHCO (AND @WORKATANF)  Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer  Powered by JazzHR  FioSgErJAz

description: As a Temporary Student Support on the Military Sales team, you will be performing a mixture of administrative duties and ongoing project support work. Intrigued yet? Because it only gets better! In this role, having an “owner’s mindset” paired with your initiative and curiosity will take you a long way. You will be encouraged to “follow your nose” (as Toucan Sam would say) and pursue opportunities to engage in a collaborative environment, sharpening your business acumen. And did we mention there’s plenty of snacks?!?  You will be working remotely with our team based out of Battle Creek, MI. Now lets achieve something great together!  HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING The Daily Grind – Working with team Account Executives and external partners to develop customer-specific marketing events You’re Part of a Team – And communication will be important! In supporting Military Sales, you will partnering with external vendors, such as industry publications and graphics companies, to assist the Team with in-store activity. Collaboration is Key – In this role, you will be partnering with Print Services to manage the timely execution of quarterly coupons and point-of-sale. Reporting - You will be responsible for learning internal reporting systems and Nielsen to support team with daily, weekly, monthly reports. Special Projects – Take ownership by managing the setup of purchase orders, and the processing and tracking of invoices. By communicating with external partners and Order-to-Cash to ensure timely processing of payments. And you have to be able to juggle – Multiple and conflicting priorities will come up under specific time constraints. You have to be quick to act when these issues arise. YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS  Required Must be currently enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours at an accredited college or university working toward a degree in a business-related field. Available to start working in October/November 2021, commitment of 12-24 months in role Available to work part time during the school year for 20-25 hours per week (during business hours) with flexibility for additional hours during the summer and holidays Sophomore or Junior status Ability to handle multiple and conflicting priorities with great attention to detail Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite – Excel, PowerPoint, and e-mail Persistence, strong problem solving and decision-making skills Bonus Points Previous internship experience Student seeking a bachelor’s degree. Project management and/or group project experience What’s Next  It’s best to apply today, because job postings can be taken down and we wouldn’t want you to miss this opportunity. To learn more about what’s next, click on the links below: Kellogg K-Values THE FINER PRINT  The ability to work a full shift, come to work on time, work overtime as needed and the ability to work according to the necessary schedule to meet job requirements with or without reasonable accommodation is an essential function of this position. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Where required by state law and/or city ordinance; this employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. For additional information, please follow this Link . If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, please reach out to USA.Recruitment@kellogg.com  LET’S CREATE THE FUTURE OF FOOD  Kellogg Recruitment

description: FLAGDream is an education technology corporation founded by an elite team from top tech companies in Silicon Valley. Our mission is to help students join the world's leading companies, relying on our strong resources, networks, and mentor teams throughout Silicon Valley and Wall Street. FLAGDream provides students with career development, consulting, and vocational skill training services. As a result, we send thousands of trainees to Silicon Valley and top companies in various industries around the world every year.  FLAGDream is an affiliate of one of the top human resource consultancies, IntelliPro Group, based in North America and founded in 2009. IntelliPro Group has provided career advice and opportunities to 100,000+ talents to help them develop in all aspects of their career. IntelliPro has become a top partner for technology companies in the United States and the Asia-Pacific region. With high-tech methods leveraging AI and big data, IntelliPro Group has established a large-scale talent database of over 160 million, which can quickly meet the needs of business for elite talent.  Job Summary:  We are looking for a Business Development Intern to assist in business development and strategies. BD Interns will have the opportunity to get hands-on experience, put forth and see their ideas in action, and contribute to a dynamic organization.  What You’ll Do: Continually sourcing, identify, build and develop new mentors and potential partners Identify business opportunities with strategic targets and cultivating relationships with existing mentors Manage the development plan with the manager for generating new strategic partnerships by proactively reaching out to and engaging the LinkedIn Write up results of analysis and prepares presentations as needed Develop and maintain business relationships with strategic partners including mentors and companies Explore and establish corporate partnerships with different companies Collaborate with other departments to conduct market analysis on industry trends, job market trends and competitors Represent the team in client-facing meetings, communication with clients (mentors and company management team) on partnership projects, and present to internal and external audiences. Conduct introductory calls and meetings to identify business challenges What You’ll Have: Excellent communication, English skill in both writing and speaking Optimistic attitude and strong people skills Strong business acumen and critical thinking skills Ability to work under pressure Be good at navigating interpersonal relationships, and be able to identify and handle sensitive issues Job type:  Intern  Full-time opportunity:  Yes  Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s in a Business major or other related fields Languages: Fluent in both Chinese and English Experience:  0-1 Year Experience In Sales (preferred)  Work location:  Remote  What You‘ll obtain: Build a high-level network Perfect opportunity to join a fast-growing company Work in a high-energy, fast-paced environment that is both competitive and fun Exclusive FLAGDream events Practical knowledge learning What we can offer:  CPT/OPT/H1B Visa opportunity  Company’s website: www.falgdream.com

description: INTERNSHIP  WHO ARE WE? Legacy Consulting Agency, Inc. works on helping the everyday business to the early stage start ups. As a business consulting company we have worked on mastering 3 different aspects of business which include (Business Funding, Web Development & Marketing).  Helping companies take on the next level of business and growth. We have happily helped 100s of business during the onslaught of the business closures due to COVID 19 in 2020. Our success is derived from the outreach of doing the absolute best things for our clients. The company was founded by Mario Mireles and Chris Flores, and has been based in Long Beach.  THE ROLE Legacy is looking for a Marketing Intern to support the marketing team coordinating & building out content for Legacy's websites and digital media. This position will report to the CEO & Marketing team. The position does require one day in house and so ideas and projected goals can be shared and expressed with the team.                   RESPONSIBILITIES Create content for Social Media (Youtube, Instagram, TikTok) Email Marketing (WIX, Hubspot, Mailchimp) Make quick on the spot decisions regarding certain content with the Marketing team. Tell the company culture through social media post Work cross-functionally with multiple internal departments, including sales & marketing. Work on-site at festivals, as needed, to support marketing teams.  QUALIFICATIONS Exceptionally high attention to detail Proficient in grammar Ability to manage a fast-paced calendar of key dates and field requests from different teams simultaneously Adaptability to execute tasks off-hours at short notice if needed  WORK ENVIRONMENT Must be able to tolerate loud noise levels & busy environments Be part of our family.  Create a great environment of growth with the office team Unlimited Coffee & Tea Office view with availability to listen to music Office with a View of the Long Beach coast and Signal Hill  EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY We at Legacy Consulting strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.  HIRING PRACTICES The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of interns assigned to this job.  Legacy Consulting recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. We pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, Internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.  Employment Type: Internship

Attention New Grads!!!  Are you looking to build a career with a stable and successful company? Are you ambitious, creative, personable, resourceful and hard working? Are you willing to roll up your sleeves and work in the warehouse one day and in the office the next? Do you have a strong desire to be a leader in the distribution and building materials industry? We are a growing organization looking to develop top talent to fuel our continued successful growth.  Beacon Building Products is one of the largest distributors of residential and non-residential roofing and complementary building products in North America. Beacon currently has over 500 locations in 50 US states and 6 Canadian provinces and more than 6,000 employees. We are known throughout the building supply industry for having quality people, quality service and quality building products. Beacon Building Products is publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock market under the symbol BECN. In June of 2006 Beacon Building Products was named to the NASDAQ Global Select Market. Beacon is a FORTUNE 1000 company.  Built on a solid foundation of prior success, our Distribution Leadership Program (DLP) provides training, development opportunities and guidance for DLP participants to advance into sales or management positions in 18-24 months from their entry date into the program. The program is designed to teach via a mentoring program. Participants need to be high performers with the willingness to relocate within our geographic footprint for development and career opportunities. Participants must demonstrate leadership qualities, be flexible and be eager to drive a forklift one day, and present to the leadership team the next!  As a DLP, you’ll receive a customized learning and training plan that will enable you to learn our business from the ground up. You’ll learn how to run a multi-million dollar business while developing a strategy for continued growth. You’ll have the opportunity to work with people as motivated and driven as you and you’ll be empowered to influence change from your first day on the job. We offer a competitive compensation package and an outstanding benefits package including a 401(k) Plan with matching company contributions.  Requirements Will have graduated within two years of obtaining a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year institution with a major in Business, Management, Supply Chain, Marketing, or a related field of study. Professional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Strong problem solving and creative skills. The ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analysis. Strong ability to work in changing environment and see through complexity. Ability to effectively communicate with and influence all levels of the organization and help drive change. Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word tools. Willingness to relocate within the company's geographic footprint. Authorization to work in the United States. BEACON is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description: Job ID  33064  Posted  08-Oct-2021  Service line  Advisory Segment  Role type  Part-time  Areas of Interest  Interns/Graduate, Sales & Leasing, Sales Support, Sales/Brokerage  Location(s)  San Antonio - Texas - United States of America  About CBRE  With broader and deeper capabilities than any other company, CBRE is the leading full-service real estate services and investment organization in the world. A CBRE internship gives you a unique opportunity to get a head start in the commercial real estate industry by working alongside some of our top producing professionals. Our associates will gain valuable real-life experience and learn the business by working on CBRE projects.  CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm (based on 2020 revenues) with more than 100,000 employees (excluding affiliates). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #122 in 2021. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 20 consecutive years and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” in the real estate sector for nine years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE”.  The company serves real estate investors and occupiers through approximately 530+ offices worldwide (excluding affiliates). CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services.  About The Internship Program  The CBRE National Sales Internship accelerates your learning and development by providing you with a strong foundation upon which to build your commercial real estate sales career. This eight-week summer intern program will introduce you to our company, our fast-paced industry, and our world-class professionals. Program participants will receive real-world training and participate in networking and learning opportunities.  The summer internship will begin in June 2022 and end in August 2022.  Responsibilities May Include  Conduct company, property and industry-specific research  Manage and update prospects in an internal tracking database  Assist in developing and preparing marketing and presentation materials  Track local and regional activity, e.g., economy, employment statistics, major company activity, industry trends and demographics that affect the local real estate market  Contribute to special projects in support of business development  Provide ongoing support with current deals, including market surveys, proposal reviews and summaries, lease reviews, financial analysis  Qualifications  The internship is designed for results-oriented and entrepreneurial candidates with a strong academic background, preferably in business or real estate. Applicants should be self-motivated, creative, disciplined ad exhibit a demonstrated interest in the commercial real estate industry.  Current college junior, senior, or graduate level student  Desire to work in the commercial real estate industry  Experience with MS Office with preferred experience in Salesforce and Tableau  Strong presentation skills  Ability to network and develop strong relationships  Detail-oriented and highly organized  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Solid written and oral communication skills  Ability to work independently and collaboratively  Work authorization  Application Process  We are accepting applications now and will begin our formal selection process for the internship program in December 2021. Qualified applicants will be contacted in January 2022 if they have been selected to move forward in our process.  CBRE is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.  NOTE: An additional requirement for this role is the ability to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing.

description: Overview Looking for an internship to maximize your personal and professional growth as much as possible? Make anywhere from $8,000-$25,000 in Aruza Marketing's Sales Summer Internship. Aruza Marketing Aruza Marketing is a company that runs a competitive summer sales internship program out of Charlotte, NC, Greensboro, NC, Raleigh, NC, Charleston, SC, Greenville, SC, Orlando, FL, Houston, TX, Austin, TX, and San Antonio, TX.  From May-August, our sales reps receive extensive training, sales incentives like the opportunity to have your summer housing paid for, an extremely competitive commission schedule, off-season perks like a team cruise through the Bahamas, and REAL revenue numbers to put on your resume! The intern will work with the BD and Sales associates to gain familiarity with the DOLFIN product, while learning the tactical aspects of the DOLFIN sales cycle, with the goal of helping maintain pipeline accounts to try to convert leads to trial users and subscribers. Continuous review of CRM lists to identify highly engaged leads. Draft personalized emails to high-priority leads promoting upcoming events and with CTAs to sign up for demos.
