description: To partner with a Regional Director to strategically develop and drive new business within a specific territory. To represent Vanguard and act as an ambassador through phone, in person, and virtual communications.  This individual is responsible for providing outstanding high quality service to internal clients, as well as external clients and prospects. This individual will be responsible for building deep relationships with small-market Regional Directors, internal and external Centers of Influence, and an outsourcing vendor. The information imparted by this individual may directly influence and impact the decision making process of prospective clients to award business to Vanguard. This representative will serve the small-market client-base and be responsible for retirement plan sales activities for plans with less than $50 million in assets.  Please note, this Crew member will likely serve Northern California, however applicants from all three U.S. sites (Malvern, PA, Scottsdale, AZ, Charlotte, NC) are encouraged to apply.  Duties and Responsibilities  Aligned to a Regional Director's geographical territory and supports both Advisor and other Center of Influence relationships and qualified prospective clients. Professionally responds to new leads/inquiries for retirement plans. Conducts research, provides information on Vanguard products and services and any other necessary follow-up information to prospects/clients.  Collaborates with the Regional Director and is a key contributor in the development and execution of a strategic business plan to generate assets and grow share in aligned geographic territory. Achieves established sales and retention goals through personal direction of sales activities within aligned geographical territory.  Develops and maintains in-depth expertise related to the capital markets, asset management, the financial services industry, marketplace developments, and defined contribution retirement plans. Utilizes this expertise, along with product knowledge, to be a trusted advisor to prospective clients. Assess the needs of each prospect by asking targeted, high impact questions and positions the appropriate Vanguard product and/or service that meets those needs.  Develops and maintains strong relationships throughout the organization. Works extensively with external Vanguard vendor in order to ensure timely delivery of proposals to prospects.  Collaborates with aligned Regional Director in all aspects of the sales process including implementing and maintaining a territory management program and using Miller Heiman methodology in order to generate sales leads, managing prospective client relationships with the purpose of winning new business and providing subject matter expertise on Vanguard’s Retirement Plan Access product and services offerings. Conducts in-depth research on aligned territory, focusing on increasing the number of sales opportunities and Advisor relationships and developing strategies and tactics to assist Regional Directors.  Develops new relationships and maintains existing relationships with Third Party Administrators and Financial Advisors in assigned geographical territory. Responds to inbound inquiries from Third Party Administrators and Financial Advisors seeking guidance on Vanguard investments and Vanguard Retirement Plan Access services.  Provides full coverage for aligned Regional Director's geographic territory, as necessary. Responds to Financial Advisor inquiries with the poise, knowledge and initiative.  Serves as a role model for junior crew on the team.  Provides analyses of Vanguard's relative fund performance using Morningstar and other databases, and conducts market research on competitors with emphasis on comparative fund offerings, product and services analysis, fees, competitive analysis data requests and marketing approaches. Identifies competitor strengths and weaknesses and assists sales teams in formulations of sales strategies.  Tracks and monitors sales leads and identify trends in win loss data and provide subject matter expertise to Regional Directors for delivery to prospective clients, including consultative guidance, creative solutions to prospect challenges and the positioning of Vanguard's products to win.  Supports Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Principles and Strategy.  Embraces NWOW (New Ways of Working) and understands, supports, and encourages change and continuous improvement.  Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Master’s degree (MBA) or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) preferred.  Minimum five years general experience or five years industry/technology with some experience working with defined contribution plans preferred.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Excellent Analytical Abilities And Organizational And Research Skills.  Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.  Ability to interact effectively with all levels of internal and external personnel.  Exceptional computer skills.  Excellent interpersonal skills.  Professional presence.  FINRA Series 7 & 63 licenses preferred or the ability to complete within 90 days.  Basic knowledge of investments, especially Vanguard funds.  In-depth knowledge of Vanguard investment products and services preferred.  Broad knowledge of investment principles and concepts preferred.  Ability to develop a deep network of contacts and subject matter experts.  Ability to develop strong relationships with prospects and outsourced partner's sales team.  Experience With Endowments, Foundation And Defined Benefit Plans Preferred.  Special Factors  This is considered a covered department under Vanguard's Political Contribution and Fundraising Activity Policy and may be subject to greater restrictions than those set out in the policy. Prior to moving into this position you will be required to disclose all political contributions made within the last two years.  Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this role.  Based on Corporate guidance and CDC guidelines, limited business travel <25% per year.  Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.  About Vanguard  We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.  For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.  We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.  Inclusion Statement  Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”  We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.  When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.  Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.
industries: Financial Services

description: About Us  The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.  No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do join our table and let’s make life delicious!  Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration  We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.  As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.  Description & Requirements  Trainee Program  The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies- with more than 200 brands created and loved globally. You know the icons like Heinz Ketchup- Kraft Mac and Cheese- and Philadelphia Cream Cheese. And you’ve heard the buzz about breakthrough sensations like Just Crack an Egg and Primal Kitchen.  No matter the brand- we unite under one vision To Sustainably Grow by Delighting More Consumers Globally. Bringing that vision to life are our 38-000-plus teammates worldwide- who make not just food but a real impact. Together- we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. And we stand committed to sustainability and the health of our planet and its people. If you're passionate and ready to shape the future — there's one thing to do Join us!  Why us?  Challenging the status quo takes talent! We're transforming the food industry by growing a global team of food lovers- creative thinkers- and high performers. You'll not only work with and help grow some of the world's most iconic and beloved brands- but you'll have the chance to leave your mark on them. As part of the Kraft Heinz family- you're recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance. Seize the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. Count on others to live our values alongside you. This is where teamwork thrives- and collaborative spirit fuels every day.  Bring your appetite for more!  Our Kraft Heinz trainees are hand-selected and sponsored by the Executive Leadership Team. This 10-month rotational program is designed for those who are highly ambitious and have a desire to be future leaders of Kraft Heinz. You’ll join a Trainee class filled with fellow high achievers to learn and partner with Kraft Heinz leaders- explore all areas of our organization- and have multiple opportunities to work directly in our business. As a Kraft Heinz Trainee you will add value as a full-time employee from day one- doing real work- and delivering real results.  Program Tracks  The Kraft Heinz Trainee Program is divided into 4 function-specific tracks from which you can launch your career journey at Kraft Heinz. These tracks are designed to guide placement following the program. Marketing / Sales Track - you could be a part of Brand Management- Category Management- Shopper Marketing- Retail Sales- Innovation- and Consumer Insights R&D/Quality Track – this could include Quality- Food Science- Engineering- Research & Development- and Packaging Operations Track - you could work in Procurement- Supply Chain- Logistics- Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP)- Quality- Food Safety- Engineering Corporate Track - you could make an impact in Finance- Accounting- Human Resources- and Learning & Development You should join us at our table if You are pursuing a Bachelor’s degree and are a graduating Senior eligible to start in Summer 2022 You have an excitement for setting and delivering against personal goals and massively over-delivering You bring positive energy to every interaction and project Being hungry- yet humble comes naturally Working hard and being driven is what has gotten you where you are Your goal is to join a company with a culture of learning and growth Join us in achieving our purpose to Make Life Delicious!!

description: INTERNSHIP  WHO ARE WE? Legacy Consulting Agency, Inc. works on helping the everyday business to the early stage start ups. As a business consulting company we have worked on mastering 3 different aspects of business which include (Business Funding, Web Development & Marketing).  Helping companies take on the next level of business and growth. We have happily helped 100s of business during the onslaught of the business closures due to COVID 19 in 2020. Our success is derived from the outreach of doing the absolute best things for our clients. The company was founded by Mario Mireles and Chris Flores, and has been based in Long Beach.  THE ROLE Legacy is looking for a Marketing Intern to support the marketing team coordinating & building out content for Legacy's websites and digital media. This position will report to the CEO & Marketing team. The position does require one day in house and so ideas and projected goals can be shared and expressed with the team.                   RESPONSIBILITIES Create content for Social Media (Youtube, Instagram, TikTok) Email Marketing (WIX, Hubspot, Mailchimp) Make quick on the spot decisions regarding certain content with the Marketing team. Tell the company culture through social media post Work cross-functionally with multiple internal departments, including sales & marketing. Work on-site at festivals, as needed, to support marketing teams.  QUALIFICATIONS Exceptionally high attention to detail Proficient in grammar Ability to manage a fast-paced calendar of key dates and field requests from different teams simultaneously Adaptability to execute tasks off-hours at short notice if needed  WORK ENVIRONMENT Must be able to tolerate loud noise levels & busy environments Be part of our family.  Create a great environment of growth with the office team Unlimited Coffee & Tea Office view with availability to listen to music Office with a View of the Long Beach coast and Signal Hill  EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY We at Legacy Consulting strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.  HIRING PRACTICES The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of interns assigned to this job.  Legacy Consulting recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. We pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, Internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.  Employment Type: Internship

The opportunity  Marketing BI team is a team under BIO, with 4 people now, working closely with Marketing team on different initiatives like campaign strategy and optimization, product/market research, customer engagement NLP and sentiment tracking, and external dataset enablement.  Our goal is to help Product team to make product strategy and decisions based on data, help Marketing team to do campaigns from data that help make the best customer experience, and to truly understand our customer from all internal and external quantitative and qualitative datasets we have.  This role will help with the team to develop more self-serve tools like a website to host research findings, and voice of customer visualization frontend, and coordinate with team members to categorize and convert existing work into templated market segment analysis, or campaign targeting suggestion.  With the tool design by this role, workloads can be cut down for team members since business end users now have a place to explore before making requests to us. Moreover, for business users, these tools will be invaluable as they will provide easily accessible data insight before them make any decisions and/or strategies.  Through this internship, you will grow on both technical and leadership skills. For technical growth, you will access to a whole Google Cloud Platform, and countless dataset to explore, the chance to create a website for company wide usage, and time to learn from teammates to understand the frequently used methods and codes for daily BI operation. For leadership training, the collaboration needed and scope covered in this job will help you get a fundamental understanding about what is required for a BI role, what the industry and different department needs are, and most importantly, how to best roll out your work across teams.  What You’ll Be Doing  Learn, understand and absorb existing data support provided by the team Teamwork with others to categorize repeatable process for self-serve tool design Innovatively identify possible front-end choices for tool design and roll out Create a HTML UI for qualitative customer engagement research and data analysis, make it a one-stop-shop for end users easily navigate through stuff of interest What We’re Looking For  Website development Data analysis (eg. proficient in SQL) Data visualization You might also have Data engineering Ability to learn new skills and systems Good team worker with collaboration and alignment skills Life at Unity  Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.  Unity is at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.  Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

description: Date Posted  2021-08-10-07:00  Country  United States of America  Location:  OT052: CHN - CHICAGO, IL 651 W WASHINGTON SUITE 1N, CHICAGO, IL, 60661 USA  Start your sales career with an industry leader that offers excellent development & growth opportunities!  We are seeking candidates interested in starting a sales career in our Sales Trainee/Account Management program. The comprehensive training program provides development opportunities that consist of classroom instruction, as well as hands-on field learning. Sales Trainees will shadow Sales Reps/Account Managers, Field Supervisors, and Technicians to obtain business and industry knowledge as well as product training.  Potential training locations within the Western Region include, but are not limited to, California, Arizona, Washington, Las Vegas, Colorado and Illinois. Positions are available throughout North America. Candidates should be geographically mobile and location flexible to help ensure a fit can be made between individual preference and business necessity/requirements.  In this capacity, Sales Trainees perform various duties including product quality surveys of existing customers’ elevator and escalator equipment; schedule necessary field resources to ensure customer satisfaction, based on survey results; identify benefits to the customer and opportunities to upgrade/replace products involved; and work to improve current and develop new business relationships. Following success in the 4-6+ month training program, Sales Trainees will be assigned a Sales role with a portfolio of accounts in a defined geographic territory, which may require relocation.  This is a salaried position and offers additional incentive compensation, along with excellent benefits!  Essential Responsibilities Selling Otis products and/or services upgrades Developing and expanding the sales territory through cold calling and familiarity with local market conditions and competitor dynamics Servicing existing accounts to ensure retention of business Building and maintaining customer relationships Achieving or exceeding planned sales objectives Providing technical support to current and prospective customers Maintaining up-to-date technical knowledge of Otis products Monitoring and managing the collection of accounts Education BA/BS degree or currently pursuing degree, which must be awarded by start date Basic Qualifications Customer focused and results-driven Self-motivated with excellent communication, organizational and prioritization skills Time management skills with the ability to manage simultaneous duties and responsibilities Ability to work in a highly team-oriented and dynamic environment Effectively interact and build relationships with internal/external customers of all levels Preferred Qualifications Prior Sales internship/experience Otis, is the world leader in reliable, efficient and technologically advanced elevators, escalators and people-moving systems. Our revolutionary Gen2® elevators, energy-saving ReGen™ drives and NCE “green” escalator have clearly set the industry standard for innovation, safety and performance. More than 2.4 million Otis elevators and escalators are currently in operation throughout 200 different countries. We are proud to have a global team that continues to rise to the challenges of a fast-moving company. Together, the people of Otis are creating new ideas and opportunities by collaborating across time zones, geographies and cultures. So just imagine where we can take you!  Otis is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. description: About Us  Freeman is the global leader in events. Whether virtual, in-person, or hybrid, we are on a mission to redefine live for a new era. With a data-driven approach and the world's largest network of experts, our insights are shaping exhibitions, exhibits, and events that drive audiences to action. Our integrated full-service solutions leverage a 100-year legacy in event management as well as new technologies to deliver moments that matter.  Summary  Interns in the EXCELeration Internship Program will spend a majority of the time in the Exposition Sales Department, while also spending time in other departments that Sales depends on for day-to-day operations.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities  Expo Sales (60 Hours)  Components Will Include  In the Expo Sales department, interns will be able to learn the process of tradeshow sales, from the pre-sale requirements to production to post show invoicing. Research upcoming shows and rotational schedules Research potential customers Shadow client calls and facility calls Attend precon meeting with sales and operations teams Customer Experience (60 hours)  Interns will learn the distinction between expo sales and exhibitor sales. Learn onsite customer experience roles Attend show and assist the concierge elite for customer service requests Understanding the use of Mobile apps and how they affect the trade show exhibitors and Freeman staff NRDC / Operations (60 hours)  Interns will review the different departments that make up the overall operations team and design department and see the role each department takes in the production of the show. Learn the scheduling aspect for labor calls Review the load list creation process for an upcoming show Spend time at show site for the show move in, show dates and move out to view the process Review the creation process of a production schedule understand it’s importance to the production of an event Learn how a general job differs from an exposition Learn about the Nevada Regional Design center and what branches they service and what requests they handle See the flow of collaboration items ordered by clients from floorplan and design to graphic layout and production Exhibitor Services (60 hours)  Interns will spend time with the customer service / recovery teams. See how exhibitor calls are handled Learn how exhibitor problems are solved on show site and during preshow prep Review the auditing of a show in the prep stages Max Compensation: $16.00/hr  Education & Experience Junior or Senior Level Standing 2.75 GPA Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office programs (Excel, Powerpoint, Word, etc.) Diversity Commitment  At Freeman, our commitment to diversity and inclusion is helping us to create not only a great place to work, but also an environment where our employees, our customers and our communities around the world can reach their goals and connect with each other. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status and other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

jobTitle: Internship - Operations and Business Coordinator - Hermès Perfume & Beauty - Miami
description: Hermès Perfume & Beauty  Our métier: the creation, production and distribution of Perfumes, associated scented products, and Beauty products. More than 500 employees work at our various sites in France (including Paris and the industrial site of Le Vaudreuil) and abroad. Our distribution extends to 14,000 points of sale throughout the world, including 450 Hermès stores and Hermès Fragrance and Beauty Personalised Spaces. An ambitious growth strategy featuring the development of new territories and the implementation of new distribution models and new industrial methods. Since it was founded in 1977, the industrial site in Le Vaudreuil (Eure) has been developing formulas and packaging, producing Hermès Fragrance and Beauty perfumes and associated scented products, and managing all the logistics and supply chain steps through to delivery at our clients' premises by a logistics service provider (14,000 points of sale throughout the world). Approximately 240 employees currently work at the site. The establishment in Paris employs approximately 180 employees (including regional managers and the sales teams of the personalised spaces): collection development, communication, international management and operational development, visual merchandising, merchandising, sales drive, international training, operations, e-commerce, finance, IT, HR, etc. Currently, approximately 100 employees work abroad, in: Hong Kong, Shanghai, Dubai, Miami, Toronto, Belgium, the Netherlands, Madrid and London.  Role Overview  The Operations & Business Assistant will report to the Business and Operations Manager. The intern will assist with the coordination of all budgeting and forecasting operations. He/she will be required to monitor the clients orders, to ensure respect of all forecasts requirements and the sell in budget achievement.  Responsibilities  Monitor sales budget  - Follow up of the region turnover (dashboard update) and monthly trend reporting to headquarters - Privileged contact for logistic subjects between HQ and Miami office launches information, OOS, product update, transport - Coordinate the communication between Area Sales Managers and Customer Service in France. - Monthly and quarterly analysis on sell in, sell out and market environment to top management - Build and deliver strategic analysis per clients, markets and channel - Assist in the quarterly revisions of sales budget (per client and per line) and building sales budget by month.  Forecast monitoring & elaboration  - Novelties forecast elaboration: define the purchasing plan with area managers and marketing, by clients and by references, according to historical sales, product potential and business strategy - Monthly follow up of the achievement of forecasted items per clients and references: adjustment of forecast according to products performance - Coordinate the communication between Area Sales Managers and Operations in France. - Propose and implement solutions to improve demand forecast accuracy.  Profile  - First experience in business area assistant or demand planning, ideally for a consumer or luxury goods brand, a distributor or a retailer. - Fluency in English and French is required, Spanish is a plus. - Bachelor/Master degree in Business Administration or Supply Chain Management. - Excellent computer and software skills: in-depth knowledge of MS Excel is required (data treatment, pivot tables). - Excellent planning, organizational and analytical skills: ability to prioritize and meet the deadlines; ability to multi-task and be proactive.  AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER It is the policy of HERMÈS of Paris, Inc. that applicants for employment are recruited, selected and hired on the basis of individual merit and ability with respect to positions being filled and potential for promotion or transfer which may be expected to develop. Applicants are recruited, selected and hired without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, medical condition, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. In addition, personnel procedures and practices with regard to training, promotion, transfer, compensation, demotion, lay off or termination are to be administered with due regard to job performance, experience and qualifications, but without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, medical condition, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. HERMÈS of Paris, Inc. also provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, in accordance with applicable laws. We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment with Hermes, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment.

jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits 401K Paid vacation and holidays Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  iPV5qnbKwx

The intern will work with the BD and Sales associates to gain familiarity with the DOLFIN product, while learning the tactical aspects of the DOLFIN sales cycle, with the goal of helping maintain pipeline accounts to try to convert leads to trial users and subscribers.  Responsibilities Maintain an actively nurtured lead list (pre-pipeline) by conducting market research using online and social media resources (LinkedIn Sales Navigator) and industry lists. Continuous review of CRM lists to identify highly engaged leads. Draft personalized emails to high-priority leads promoting upcoming events and with CTAs to sign up for demos. Draft scripts for sales calls to high-priority leads based on customer market and role. Participate on sales calls and support follow-up actions. Schedule demos and send out invites to attendees. Gather business intelligence prior to demos on attendees and companies. Attend demos and take notes on follow-up actions. Conduct demos as needed. Work with the product team to monitor trial usage and conduct relevant follow up action. Update the firm’s CRM with relevant account updates. Draft proposals and contracts as needed. Review trends of leads and prospects and assist the associate for BD and Sales in creating marketing material for different customer bases. Requirements Student currently enrolled in a graduate degree program (MBA, MA, MS) in business, sales, economics, or a related field. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Excellent writing skills. Interest in national security, the financial services industry, and financial crimes compliance. Familiarity with CRM (Hubspot, Salesforce, Zoho) and Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint (intermediate or advanced) preferred. Candidate must be located in DC or surrounding areas.

description: Description  Sands Investment Group (SIG), America's Fastest Growing Net Lease Company, is officially accepting applications for the highly-selective Jr Broker Internship Program (JBI) in the Charleston, SC headquarters. Interns will gain the foundational skills necessary to becoming successful Commercial Real Estate Investment Sales Brokers and compete for full-time Jr Broker positions to be offered only to the TOP performers at the conclusion of the program. The JBI Program is heavily focused on developing skills in research, marketing, and underwriting in addition to CRM/database maintenance and active participation in team role plays, meetings, and trainings.  Interns Will Support The Team By Mastering The Following Use proprietary and industry systems and resources to find and validate property owners, research competitors, and identify new leads and projects Research SIG's active inventory and contact/pitch properties to potential buyers Catalog relevant properties on the market by product type, CAP rate, and price Assist with Proposals or Broker Opinion of Value (BOVs) and pull comps on deals Update and maintain company CRM/shared database Actively participate in all team huddles, meetings and trainings Successful candidates must answer a resounding YES to the following questions: Are you extremely coachable, highly motivated, and fiercely competitive? Do you value business ethics, The Golden Rule, and teamwork/collaboration? Do you have 1+ years' experience in sales, cold-calling, or working in a professional office environment? If not, can you fake it well? Are you passionate about Commercial Real Estate and/or Investment Sales? Do you have your SC Real Estate Sales Agent License or are you in the process of obtaining it? Are you proficient in technology, e.g. Microsoft Suite, Google Suite/Docs, and CRM systems? Have the ability to work a full-time weekly set schedule? Does 100% commission motivate you? About SIG  Sands Investment Group is a commercial real estate brokerage firm that specializes in the buying and selling of net lease properties for private investors and institutions across the United States. Since its founding in 2010, SIG has closed over 2,500 transactions worth more than $5.3B in 48 states. Brokers with the company currently have over $800M in active inventory. As a leader in the industry and the first to offer true sub-product type specialization, the firm’s experience in net lease, retail, office and industrial transactions is unparalleled. Sands Investment Group has offices in Santa Monica, CA, Philadelphia, PA, Charleston, SC, Charlotte NC, Atlanta, GA, and Austin, TX.

description: Company Overview  WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.  WarnerMedia News & Sports brings together all of WarnerMedia's live programming and best-in-class digital properties. From CNN Worldwide providing news and information services to more than 2 billion people, in more than approximately 200 countries and territories, to Turner Sports leading the industry in the delivery of premium sports content across all multimedia screens, there's no limit to the reach you can have working here.  Join us. Shape your story here.  APPLICATION DEADLINE: Friday, October 29 at 11:59 PM EST  The Team  Do you want to learn from some of the best in the sports advertising business across the country? Ever wonder how much a commercial in the NCAA Final Four costs or how a brand can get courtside signage in an NBA game? If so, please consider a Virtual Spring Internship position at Turner Sports in the Ad Sales division! Turner Sports is a division of WarnerMedia News & Sports and the Ad Sales team monetizes the company's sports portfolio through award-winning advanced advertising capabilities, sponsorship opportunities, official marketing partnerships, experiential marketing, social, digital and linear media that power return-on-investment for brands.  Attracting a wide-scale audience of diverse fans, the portfolio includes leading media brands TBS, TNT, truTV, Bleacher Report, House of Highlights and Sports' high-profile coverage of the NBA, Major League Baseball, NCAA Division I Men’s Basketball Championship, NHL, B/R Gaming and ONE Championship. In addition, the company has digital sales partnerships with the NBA, NCAA and MLB.  The Job This is a hands-on & robust program, in which interns will work day-to-day with one of the ad sales or sales support groups. Interns will also be invited to attend events in which they will get exposure to all areas of the business, and the program will end with a collaborative end-of-the-semester sales pitch project. Overall, this program provides great opportunities for significant learning experiences, as well as the chance to make lasting business contacts. Opportunities are available within our various sales and support groups, such as: - Ad Sales (linear + digital for our various brands) Marketing / Content Partnerships Social / Launchpad Branded Content Programmatic Ad Innovation Client Strategy Account Services Digital Ad Operations Presentation + Design Strategic Planning Internship Program Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for the full duration of the internship Spring 2022 program dates are January 24th - April 15th; must be available for full program duration Part-time schedule (16-24 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule Company-issued computer provided for the duration of the internship program. Competitive salary; relocation is not provided Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more The Perks Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies Access to in-house learning and development resources Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. jobTitle: Community Development Representative | Inbound Inside Sales
description: Join our team:  If you enjoy speaking with people from all over the country and can turn a regular conversation into revenue through sharing a story, ONEHOPE might have the perfect job for you. As a Community Development Representative, you will help convert leads into members for the direct sales division. You will be providing an unprecedented level of service and sales expertise via phone and email, and expected to schedule up to 15 meetings per day. A CDR must be passionate about what our company has to offer and truly believe in the vision we sell. This excitement must come through on every call to guarantee that prospective customers enjoy speaking to you and want to learn more about our company and brand. As a CDR, you can enjoy your day in the comfort of your home office while making connections all over the country.  About ONEHOPE:  ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. Through our technology, we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nationwide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.  To date, we’ve donated over $6M to partner non-profits and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped nonprofit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by winemaker Mari Wells Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.  ONEHOPE is diverse in gender and thought; over 60% of the employees are women and over 35% associate with a minority race. Over 99% of Cause Entrepreneurs are women and over 50% are moms.  ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our Co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), Co-chairman Erik Anderson (Chairman of Top Golf and Founder of West River Group), Board Member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisors Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay) and Scott Maw (CFO of Starbucks), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice Founder and Felicis Ventures), Mike Repole (Founder of Vitamin Water and Body Armor) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and Founders Fund), and other fun athletes and musicians including John Elway, Aaron Rodgers, Larry Fitzgerald, Nas, Charles Kelley (Lady Antebellum), Leann Rimes and Darius Rucker amongst many others.  What You’ll Be Doing: You will become a leading expert on ONEHOPE and the opportunity. Embody and develop the ONEHOPE brand and voice through lead communications. Be the first touchpoint & introduction to ONEHOPE with Cause Entrepreneur leads. Conduct exploratory conversations while using business acumen. Consult, educate, and encourage inbound leads to join ONEHOPE as a Cause Entrepreneur so they can share ONEHOPE's award-winning wines with friends and family, hold online tastings, and earn an income while giving back to meaningful causes. Adhere to proven sales processes. Update the database with new information every time a customer connection is made. Follow organization standards to maintain high-quality service and guarantee customers receive exceptional service. Boost sales team morale by encouraging other CDRs and adopting a team mentality. Diligently manage and maintain an exceptional pipeline throughout the entire sales cycle. Work within sales management tools.  Experience and Skills Needed: Sales experience Exceptional writing abilities to provide clear and empathetic customer support through all communication channels. Strong and concise communication. Ability to be coachable. Extensive software knowledge; ability to pick up new technology quickly. Great interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive, multi-task, and prioritize in a high-volume, dynamic environment.  Technology Needed: Ability to connect directly to a modem via Ethernet with stable internet connectivity and speeds sufficient to support voice calls and video conferencing.  Competencies Valued: Heart, passion, and responsibility to the customer. A track record of high achievement. Previous successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales career. Leadership through innovation in everything you do. The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be better on a daily basis. Passion for what you do and a drive to improve. A strong drive to complete tasks. Personal and corporate integrity. The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basis. Experience owning and/or operating a small business.  What’s In It For You: A best in class team and company culture. A fun, but very hard-working and dedicated environment. Medical benefits 401K Paid vacation and holidays Casual dress code WFH / Remote Position  Sound Like a Good Fit?  We’d love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: Resume (including months/years of employment for each position) Cover letter Video Recording of yourself reading a sales pitch. (Submitted during the interview) Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Powered by JazzHR  NzbDmI3ao2

description: Kabbage is blazing a trail in big data & fintech and we are looking for interns to help us in our mission to help small businesses be mighty.  Acquired by American Express in 2020, Kabbage is a leading FinTech company changing the way small businesses manage their cash flow. Applying automation and real-time data, Kabbage provides small businesses a suite of integrated cash-flow technologies from flexible lines of credit, digital business checking accounts, fast payments and predictive business analytics. Now with the powerful backing of American Express, Kabbage can offer millions of small businesses the opportunity to access digital tools to help them grow bigger, lasting companies. While we've received numerous awards and recognition—such as Entrepreneur's Top Company Cultures, GlassDoor’s Best Places to Work, and Forbes FinTech 50—it is our people, our culture, and our leaders that make Kabbage such a great place to work.  We’re visionaries and brand experts. Story-tellers and problem-solvers. For more than 160 years, American Express has been at the forefront of finance, industry, and innovation, backing our Card Members as they move forward and helping our customers do more of what matters most to them.  What roles are open under Kabbage? Marketing Operations UX & Product Data Science Engineering Marketing - Kabbage’s Marketing team is a close-knit group that supports teams across the organization in pursuit of one goal: connecting small businesses with the financial solutions they need to grow. We’re responsible for building brand awareness, acquiring customers and increasing their lifetime value. We make sure our press outreach, advertising, emails, and social media support our customers and partners and tell a cohesive Kabbage story.  Operations - Kabbage’s Servicing Team manages the systems that keep the company’s operational teams up and running. We work across all of Kabbage’s financial products to support sales, marketing, customer service, collections, risk, and other teams and ensure that they have the tools they need to grow the business and deliver the best experiences to Kabbage customers.  UX & Product - You’ll be working alongside product designers, content strategists and product managers aimed to provide small businesses with the financial tools they need to enhance their cash flow. The team is highly collaborative, passionate, fast-paced and customer-focused.  Data Science – Our data scientists are focused on building the models that make our platform run. You would work alongside machine learning experts, analytical creatives, and data gurus.  Engineering - The Kabbage engineering team aspires to serve all of our commercial clients and deepen relationships with small business owners through our innovative Kabbage platform. Each of our customers is a critical part of the global economy – from the jobs they provide, the goods and services they deliver, and the change and impact they each seek to have in the world - - it’s an honor and a privilege to be a part of their story.  Skills/Experience Takes a project from ideation to delivery. Able to prioritize in ambiguous situations. Strives to deliver great products. Proactive, self-driven, curious, loves learning. Utilizes sound interpersonal skills to navigate in a cross-functional setup. Analyze operations for sales team and identify problem areas Collaborate with engineers to develop solutions Earn stakeholder buy-in and incorporate solutions into product roadmap Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience in any of the following languages and frameworks: C#, Java, WebApi, .Net Core, Entity Framework, SQL, Docker, Terraform, and Kubernetes. Analytical skills: Likes learning and learns quickly. Educational Requirements Currently enrolled in full-time undergraduate degree program Students must have a graduation date between December 2022 and June 2023 Life at American Express  American Express is known for backing our customers to help them achieve their goals and dreams, both big and small. At American Express, we’re changing the way people live and work through meaningful projects with real-world impact. When you join our team you can make a difference by improving the everyday lives of customers around the world.  Growing great leaders is one of the things that sets American Express apart. Every employee has the opportunity—and is encouraged—to take their personal leadership to the next level through a wide variety of leadership and learning programs.  Our colleagues and their families feel supported at every stage of their lives. We provide resources and benefits that help support their physical, financial and emotional well-being, such as our award-winning global corporate wellness program, Healthy Living, and many others including: 20 weeks of Paid Parental Leave (to be eligible, employees must complete at least one year of continuous service immediately prior to the birth or placement of the child), Health (dental and vision) and Life Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, and 401k with match. Some of our roles even offer flexible work arrangements so you can work how it makes sense for you, without ever compromising quality.  Creating an inclusive culture is both a part of who we are and what we do together. We value and embrace the diversity of thought, backgrounds and experiences of all our employees. Through our 15 Colleague Networks, participants can broaden their associations with other employees while expanding their knowledge of the business.  Why American Express?  There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.  American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.  We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and support.  Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.  The powerful backing of American Express.  Don’t make a difference without it.  Don’t live life without it.  Learn more about our opportunities at American Express by visiting https://careers.americanexpress.com.  With a job at American Express, almost anything is possible. Apply now!  Our team will review completed applications on a rolling basis. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application and will be in contact with you by April 30th.  Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

description: Company Description  At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.  At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that. Our technology helped people put a man on the moon.  We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest growth organizations in the world. From energizing the most competitive gaming platforms, to enabling systems to make cities safer and cars smarter and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and public cloud, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.  Binge-watch any shows, use social media or shop online lately? You’ll find Western Digital supporting the storage infrastructure behind many of these platforms. And, that flash memory card that captures and preserves your most precious moments? That’s us, too.  We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, storage devices and platforms for business and consumers alike. Our data-centric solutions are comprised of the Western Digital®, G-Technology™, SanDisk® and WD® brands.  Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. It’s You & Western Digital. Together, we’re the next BIG thing in data.  Job Description  We are seeking highly motivated university students to learn and contribute hands-on while working our Sales & Marketing teams. We are recruiting for the following roles: Inside Sales Field Sales Digital Marketing Channel Marketing Social Media eCommerce RAMP Program Elements Include  What is the RAMP Program. The RAMP Program is supplemental to your day-to-day internship responsibilities. In this program, you will gain deeper exposure to Western Digital’s culture and the different parts of the organization. Professional insights from leaders and professionals Engaging networking activities with cohort Equity, Inclusion & Diversity and Global Giving & Doing events Where are these roles located? You’ll have the opportunity to work with teams in: Irvine, California San Jose, California Qualifications Current student pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, Marketing, Sales, Social Sciences, or related field graduating December 2022 and beyond Right to work in the US without requiring Western Digital to commence or sponsor an immigration case in order to employ you (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration case) Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and has demonstrated ability to work well with others through clubs, sports, and other extracurricular activities Strength in prioritization, time management and organizational skills Strong intrapersonal skills / relationship management skills and openness to feedback Exhibits confidence in social environments / ability to easily connect well with others Proficient in Microsoft Office applications Interest in HDD, flash, semiconductor, components, nonvolatile memory industry Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Graco manufactures and markets premium equipment to move, measure, control, dispense and spray a wide variety of fluid and powder materials. What does that mean? Well, we pump peanut butter into your jar, and the oil in your car. We glue the soles of your shoes, the glass in your windows and the screen on your phone. We spray the finish on your vehicle, coatings on your pills, the paint on your house and texture on your walls. Graco is part of your daily life.  Graco has excellent opportunities available to individuals who want to be part of fast-moving, growing company – especially candidates committed to quality, innovation and solving customer problems. Graco was proud to be named a Best Place to Work in Manufacturing and Production by Fortune Magazine in 2016, 2018, 2019 and 2021.  Job Purpose  The Sales Intern in Tampa, FL is responsible for generating sales growth of designated CED products in assigned market(s) using a demonstration and education focused selling approach. Work closely with Graco CED Field Sales and Paint Store Channel Distribution. This position is aimed for sophomore- and junior-level college students. This is a home-based position. We are currently searching for a Sales Intern for the greater Tampa, FL metro area. Travel only required throughout the metro area. Start Date: The Sales Intern can begin in Winter/Spring 2022 on a part-time basis, with full-time hours in Summer 2022. Essential Duties Grow sales in assigned market. Use provided database resources to target end users. Develop immediate solid working relationship with assigned Paint Store Sales Reps. Conduct effective hands-on demonstrations of select Graco equipment. Implement marketing programs as required. Maintain a data base of all daily activities (hands-on demonstrations and sales leads). Work closely with local CED sales staff to ensure leads are turned in to sales in a timely manner. Coordination of all activities for assigned market with CED sales staff. Position Requirements Completed 2 years towards a Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, technical field or equivalent. Hands-on, physical work experience (painting experience preferred). Evidence of mechanical aptitude. Basic paint coatings knowledge. Effective communication skills. Hands-on demonstration capability. Sales closing experience or capability. Willingness and ability to travel within assigned geography with assigned sales reps. Proven Quality. Leading Technology. Launch your career with Graco!  Graco offers attractive compensation, benefits and career development opportunities. Graco’s comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, stock purchase plan, 401(k), tuition reimbursement and more.  Our expectations are high. That's why we are always looking to hire the brightest and the best!

description: This internship is for someone who is looking to become a future founder and/or business leader and who wants hand's on experience and ownership.  "Leaders wanted for hazardous journey. Low wages, bitter cold, long hours of complete darkness. Safe return doubtful. Honour and recognition in event of success."  You want to understand and learn business leadership in a startup environment. You will work and report directly to the the founders on a real product or line of business. You will learn leadership, ownership, teamwork, strategy, market fit, customer discovery, negotiation, marketing, sales, and product ownership. In short, this is an internship for someone who looks to be a future (successful) business leader in technology and/or healthcare.  Storyline Health is a Utah-based A.I. technology company. Our mission is to understand human behavior and make that knowledge useful for everyone. We work with leading researchers, institutions, and companies across every area of human behavior with initiatives in cancer care, homelessness, addiction, mental health and incarceration. About us: https://storylinehealth.com/story  Our Founders: CEO: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeffbarson/ CSO: https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopher-gregg-4b88936/  This is a year-round internship (including the school year). Compensation based on experience and time commitment.  To apply, please perform an initial online interview through Storyline by clicking on this link on your video-enabled smartphone or computer and follow the instructions:  https://open.storyline.care/openstory/KfGe  We look forward to meeting you! Chris & Jeff Storyline Health Inc

Who is Trace3?  Trace3 is a leading Transformative IT Authority, providing unique technology solutions and consulting services to our clients. Equipped with elite engineering and dynamic innovation, we empower IT executives and their organizations to achieve competitive advantage through a process of Integrate, Automate, Innovate.  Our culture at Trace3 embodies the spirit of a startup with the advantage of a scalable business. Employees can grow their career and have fun while doing it!  Trace3 is headquartered in Irvine, California. We employ more than 850 people all over the United States. Our major field office locations include Atlanta, Denver, Detroit, Indianapolis, Grand Rapids, Lexington, Los Angeles, Louisville, San Diego, San Francisco, and Scottsdale.  Ready to discover the possibilities that live in technology?  Come Join Us!  Street-Smart - Thriving in Dynamic Times  We are flexible and resilient in a fast-changing environment. We continuously innovate and drive constructive change while keeping a focus on the “big picture.” We exercise sound business judgment in making high-quality decisions in a timely and cost-effective manner. We are highly creative and can dig deep within ourselves to find positive solutions to different problems.  Juice - The “Stuff” it takes to be a Needle Mover  We get things done and drive results. We lead without a title, empowering others through a can-do attitude. We look forward to the goal, mentally mapping out every checkpoint on the pathway to success, and visualizing what the final destination looks and feels like.  Teamwork - Humble, Hungry and Smart  We are humble individuals who understand how our job impacts the company's mission. We treat others with respect, admit mistakes, give credit where it’s due and demonstrate transparency. We “bring the weather” by exhibiting positive leadership and solution-focused thinking. We hug people in their trials, struggles, and failures – not just their success. We appreciate the individuality of the people around us.  About The Role  As part of the Trace3xpereince Program, the Purchasing Specialist Tracer (Intern) will learn how to review sales orders for accuracy, create purchase orders in a timely manner, and fulfill all software/support/virtual items. The Purchasing Specialist Tracer will have a chance to work closely with outside vendors and internal teams to continuously build relationships and operational efficiencies. Tracers in this program will receive accelerated professional development, IT industry exposure, world-class mentoring, and a unique networking opportunity across the organization.  What You Can Expect To Learn Learn the different steps of how to process a purchase order at an IT organization like Trace3 Enter purchase orders into our ERP (NetSuite) and schedule shipments ensuring on-time delivery is met Review orders to ensure accuracy of shipping address, PO, shipping account information, price, etc. Learn and work alongside Accounting and Sales to resolve variances and problem-solve discrepancies Track all Virtual/Software line items and perform item fulfillment based on license key confirmations Learn how to build relationships with internal teams, sales, and outside vendors Perform other duties as assigned Eligibility And Preferred Skills Enrollment in the Junior or Senior year of an undergraduate or graduate degree program, at an accredited college or university Candidates should be pursuing a field of study applicable to the Purchasing Specialist Internship Cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 2.5 or better; People and Organizational Health may require a copy of the applicant’s transcript Academic or professional/internship experience working in a professional setting is a plus Ability to work independently on assigned tasks and accepts direction on given assignments Self-motivated individuals with a customer mindset and desire to help people Enthusiasm for technical problem solving, with attention to detail and strong communication skills Ability to learn and research in a dynamic and engaging environment Availability to work 20 to 40 hours per week throughout the internship Knowledge of the fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures associated with network engineering in relation to information systems. Proficient in basic computer/laptop use including advanced operations The Perks Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans for you and your dependents 401(k) Retirement Plan with Employer Match, 529 College Savings Plan, Health Savings Account, Life Insurance, and Long-Term Disability Competitive Compensation Training and development programs Stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages Collaborative and cool office culture Work-life balance and generous paid time off To all recruitment agencies: Trace3 does not accept unsolicited agency resumes/CVs. Please do not forward resumes/CVs to our careers email addresses, Trace3 employees or any other company location. Trace3 is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/CVs.

description: ABOUT KHAITE  The feminine unique. KHAITE is a women’s ready-to-wear and accessories collection that reimagines classic American sportswear for the twenty-first century. Designed to be cherished, each piece proposes a fresh balance of opposing elements—past and future, masculine and feminine, strength and softness, structure and fluidity—while embodying a signature sensuality and ease. Founded in 2016 by creative director Catherine Holstein, New York-based KHAITE evolves with each new season, building upon a foundation of robust yet polished items distinguished by exceptional materials and subtle yet striking details. The collection (pronounced “Kate”) takes its name from the Greek word (χαίτη) meaning “long, flowing hair.”  Khaite is seeking a temporary PR/Sales Intern for the Wholesale Department. This position is full time through the end of 2021.  Assist in coordinating and managing all sample trafficking for editorial, VIP and sales-related loans Manage logistics for sample loans including coordinating international and domestic shipments via fedex and DHL and scheduling messengers for local sendouts/returns Shadow and assist the PR team on all daily activities, including daily email requests, gifting initiatives, drafting press strategies, event preparation and execution Update and maintain all seasonal archives, press clippings and media/VIP lists on a consistent basis Work alongside our style team to create decks and assist on internal seasonal photoshoots  Track and record results of all PR efforts across all media platforms and through influencer market  Maintain and organize the sample closet daily  Qualifications: Must be highly organized, detail oriented and able to work in a fast paced environment

Looking for a lucrative career in the medical sales industry?  Orthopaedic surgical sales could be for you!  Average income more than $190,000  Recession Proof  Work alongside surgeons in the operating room  #1 Professional Sales Career  At Medical Sales College we offer 8 and 12-week courses in various orthopedic device specialties. We take inexperienced candidates and train them for a career in medical device sales. Our career development team works directly with top orthopedic device companies to assist graduates in getting hired. After attending one of our programs and working with our team of industry experts, your chances of getting hired increase significantly, as seen with our job placement rate of over 90%.  Benefits Of Medical Sales College  10+ Years of history with more than 2,000 Job Placements  Over 90% Success Rate of Job Placement  2,000+ Employers registered exclusively with MSC  Largest recruiter in medical sales  As an alternative to immediately attending one of our programs we are offering a 12-month internship to join our team!  Internship Overview  As critical members of the team, interns will start off by building phone skills and answering questions from prospective students while learning all about Medical Sales College. During phase two, interns will work alongside our industry experts to assist with building employer partnerships. This includes mapping hiring managers within assigned medical sales specialties. In the final months of the internship, interns will contribute to the promotion and growth of Medical Sales College by sourcing new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound phone calls, emails and texts.  Benefits Of The Paid Internship  Medical Sales College is the only industry recognized training program that will replace the required orthopaedic experience that employers demand for job consideration. During your time as an intern you will develop relationships with our internal industry experts and employers. This experience will drive your professional development and build a strong foundation in preparation for a career in medical device sales. You will be able to build your own network within the industry to accelerate your own career as a medical device representative. After successful completion of your internship, you will receive free tuition (value up to $16,000) and admittance into any one of our programs/campus locations. After completion of the internship and program, you will have the opportunity to enter the medical device industry anywhere in the U.S.  IS AN INTERNSHIP REQUIRED TO ATTEND MSC?  No. Our goal at MSC is to find the most dedicated non-experienced candidates interested in medical device sales who need training and assistance with job placement. In some instances a candidate may lack the necessary funding or professional experience required to attend Medical Sales College, and therefore would be a good fit for the internship.  Ideal Candidate  The internship is designed for those individuals with little to no prior work experience and who are seeking to grow professionally over a period of 12 months before entering the industry of medical device sales. The ideal candidate must have the ability to relocate to Tampa, FL for the duration of the internship.
